Reviews.Title: “Nice, but should have been better”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: Room 818 room was attractive, with a nice number of windows and a pretty good view. Very nice, modern decor, though the "art" on the walls was questionable. The room was very quiet and it's a nice touch that the windows open. The toiletries were DELICIOUS. Maintenance is an issue: Hanging strip of gasket on the shower door, cracked tiles in the bathroom, broken harp on a lamp, weak batteries on the television. The hallways needed a vacuuming and freshening of decor. Coffeemaker instructions suggested we use Evian from the minibar and that the $10 charge would be added to the bill. We chanced it with tap water. The concierge was very helpful in suggesting a moderately-priced restaurant for dinner (Bella Bacinos), which was a great pick. The staff in general was friendly and helpful. All in all, I just expected near perfection from a Fairmont, and didn't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical Fairmont Experience”
Reviews.Author: aomal
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for St. Patrick's Day weekend. It was in a great location for the weekend festivities, and it is in a nice area convenient to many attractions. The room was just okay. It was nothing special, although it did have a nice view of the city. My husband felt that it was small- he called to ask if there was an upgrade available and we were told we would have to pay $100 more per night- we're Fairmont President's Club members and we were of the impression that if an upgrade is available, we are to be upgraded upon request. But we wanted to get going, so we didn't push. The room itself was clean, but showing signs of wear. The hallways had torn wallpaper and everything just looked kind of like it could use some attention. When housekeeping came, they left dirty dishes inside the room and these weren't taken until we put them out in the hallway. Some girls next door to us came home about 3AM on St. Patricks Day and it sounded like they were in the room with us. VERY thin walls! (They were not loud or acting crazy- they were just talking in regular voices.) We've had wonderful Fairmont experiences before and this one just doesn't measure up. Its just a basic hotel. There's no pool. The only option for dining is an Asian restaurant that has only Asian cuisine, but other foods are available if you get room service. ??? (Typically, Fairmont dining is pretty fantastic.) I think there are better options in the area- especially for the price we paid. We would not be likely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont is losing its touch”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJohnChicago
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the hotel this time. They seem to be coming down in quality quite a bit. The clientele also seem to be of a lower quality. The lobby was quite a rambunctious scene with no one on staff seeming to notice. The house keeper only did the bare minimum in the room each day and did not replace the used toiletries or the coffee; she also left the dirty coffee cups in the room. I think I will have to stay with the InterContinental next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for confence”
Reviews.Author: BougieKnight
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend conference. The hotel exceeded my expectations. Room was clean, quiet, and family friendly; took my wife and 20 month old too. They had no complaints either.nBathromm was recently updated and had separate shower and tub, nice. Staff was most accomodating and made it a point to always ask if they could assist with additional taks, give directions, etc, very well trained and operated. Id definately stay again at our group rate, but im not sure their published rates otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, friendly service, must stay here”
Reviews.Author: Gina_Vachon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont in August 2010. It's a bit far away to write this review but I thought I would drop a line since I had a great experience. We booked through Expedia.ca. I had written a comment to ask if we could get an upgrade since this is a special trip. I went with my Aunt who had never travelled outside of Toronto since she moved from HK 40 years ago and it was her first time taking the plane and visiting the US. The hotel gave us a big suite with 2 separate beds and we had a beautiful view. We stayed here for 4 nights and the service is fantastic. We forgot our slippers and called room service late at night and they came very quickly. The rooms are what you see on the Website's pictures. And the hotel is very generous with the toiletries like shower cap, soap, shampoo, conditioner, shoe mit. If you need toothpaste, they will also bring it up. Only downside is it's a bit of a walk to Magnificent Mile - a good 10 minutes. It's windy and very sunny so be sure to bring a scarf a light jacket at night. But it's close to the Millenium Park and the bean. There's a grocery store close to the hotel so we grabbed some snacks there. We also walked almost everywhere but took a cab to a nice restaurant further away. I highly recommend this hotel, the staff at the front desk are nice, accommodating and there's no attitude or snottiness. I booked early so I think you should do that if you want to secure a good price. We had a room on a high floor and never heard any noise from the the rooms next door. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants and preferred venturing to cafes on Magnificent Mile and other streets in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stop over and good location”
Reviews.Author: Madp0lka
Reviews.Content: Had two nights here in a March when the temperature hit 80 degrees! General decor of the hotel is a bit dated but my room was clean, large and well appointed. Good shower, plenty of hot water, very comfy bed. Breakfast was decent if a touch expensive. Staff were charming in reception and front of house - waiting staff needed to cheer up! Easy walking distance to good shopping and restaurants. I was working in East Whacker Drive so ideal situation for me. For the money it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: nguyens
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 2805 this past wekend for my husband's birthday. It was nice the check in was friendly and quick. We swung around the block and by the time we got upstairs the luggage was in the in room. The view was ok Millenium Park and Lake south view. The room was modern clean and large. The Bathroom is nice large tub seperate shower and the WC is in it's own closet. The bed was comfortable enough and the sheets were nice the temp of the room was consistent. Housekeeping did a great job all of our requests were accomodated. They have several tv channels and that is nice while you are laying around relaxing. Only one thing that was not 100% was one of the mattresses had quite a dip in the middle. That was the only negative. Our bellman leaving was so nice very helpful. I really love this hotel, they even left a b-day cake in the room for my Husband's B-day. Room service is still reasonable, they are now 100% non smoking which is nice for some not for others...I do like it as a former smoker. I really enjoy this hotel it has a nice feel and I am sure I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: slicksar15
Reviews.Content: Average at best. Restaurants and bar were well below par. Bar caters to wine drinkers only. All three times I left the hotel I grabbed my own cab with no bell service in sight. Choose other hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecodevo
Reviews.Content: This hotel must have been a very nice place when new, or newer. It now needs more care than it is getting. More on that later. First the positives. It is well located for downtown activities such as Michigan Ave, the Navey Peer, Millennium Park and down town businesses. I had a standard room with a king bed. The room was large by hotel standards. There was mini fridge, but it was stuffed with liquer, beer and pops. One nice touch was a sofa by the window. I was on the 35th floor and the views of the Chicago skyline were amazing. The staff was very courteous and helpful. I stayed at the Fairmont because there was a conference there. The conference facilities are nice and once again the staff was outstanding, in particular George. Thank you George for your kind words. I only had room service once, and the Chicago style pizza was as good as it gets. A few negatives that move this from a 4 star to a 3 star in my book. The paint on the room door was pealing and dirty. The inside corners of most surfaces were dirty. If you are a neat freak this might bother you, if not no big deal. The doors do bang shut, so bring ear plugs. If you join the Presidents Club (free to do so) you get wireless Internet free of charge. You can join online at their website. Overall, this is a good place. I do not know what their regular rates are, but we paid $149 per night. That seems like a good deal for downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good property, location?”
Reviews.Author: nyfriend
Reviews.Content: If you need to be near Millenium Park this property is convenient. If you like to stroll out the door and be surrounded by shops and restaurants, well. The property itself is upscale with nice public space and rooms. I personally didn't care for the menu at the restaurants (2) so I passed. I did have a glass of wine in the lobby 'wine bar'. I wasn't convienced the person serving me knew a lot about wine but he was nice. The bar itself is a little dark for my taste and few people were congregated there so it seemed lonely. Overall the lobby and bar scene was at best low energy and dull. I prefer more energy, excitement (and people). The door staff was super, they got the cars fast and were very polite and helpful. Housekeeping was good but not intutitive like I prefer. For example, I like to sleep on the left side of the bed so I moved the alarm clock to the left night stand. After I returned to the room the clock is back on the right side. Not a big deal but my best housekeeping experiences is when the staff quickly learn my preferences and adapt. If this property fits your location, you should be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly service, beds need to be replaced”
Reviews.Author: happytravels1212
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at this well located hotel. Rooms were good and quiet and ours had a great coffee machine. Unfortunately, the bed seemed somewhat old and lumpy and should be replaced soon. We used the concierge service to arrange for restaurants-they were extremely knowledgeable and professional as well as courteous. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No longer a favorite!”
Reviews.Author: DDCee
Reviews.Content: For many years I stayed here. I was a member and would get upgraded to a suite. The doorman would address me by name. But a few years ago the hotel changed dramatically. they once had a famous restaurant called Entre' Nous, which was one of the best. I believe the hotel was sold and tried to go from a first class european hotel to a more trendy, middle of the road hotel. No longer on my top 10 list. The views have been obstructed by buildings over the years also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4* City hotel”
Reviews.Author: alelex
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Fairmont hotel, but i was a bit disappointed with this place. The hotel outisde is really nice, the main hall too, the checkin was not really smooth and the front desk agent was a bit rude. When we was their, the suites was not new at all, and the cleaness of the room was not really good, but as I know, they are working hard to change all the suites and add a new level of satisfaction and the hotel will become a no smoking hotel in a few weeks. Now, during my next stay in Chicago, I will FOR SURE, stay again in this hotel, like I said before, we had a few issues during our last stay their, but the manager took care of us, and they did a really good job. The asian restaurant is good too, and the location of this place is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: NarcissistNeroh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a weekend and greatly enjoyed the service. My number one standard for a great room is the condition of the bathroom, and Fairmont did not disappoint!!! The room was spacious complete with a lounge chair. They could get someone to interior design these rooms better No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Marathon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: love2travel987654
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October, while running the Chicago marathon. The beds were extremely comfortable (great for post-run naps), the location close to the finish line (important after running 42K) and the staff extremely friendly. As we went out sightseeing the day before the race, the concierge was handing out water bottles to keep everyone hydrated. Great hotel, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: lanzmo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property MANY times and our return speaks volumes. It is run very well and has great amenities. Great rooms and beds!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Chicago is a great city hotel. The rooms are spacious for being in downtown Chicago and are of course quite clean and well maintained. I had the luxury of having a lakeside view and just found that incredible. The lobby is really cool and funky and I enjoyed the the wine bar being right there in the middle. The hotel restaurant is absolutely delicious--a bit expensive, but we are talking fine dining here. Cheaper options are close at hand, so it was not a negative that the hotel restaurant was a bit more. As I was there for a conference, I must comment on their absolutely incredible conference space. Almost every room had natural light (a rareity in conference rooms) and was tastefully decorated. It was so refreshing not to have the beige boxes I normally experience at conferences. The staff was so polite and helpful. And finally the location cannot be beat. You are two blocks from Millenium Park! I really had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, classic hotel with 5-star service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: MilwaukeeGrrl
Reviews.Content: I had the supreme pleasure of staying at the Fairmont Chicago Millennium Park while on a business trip earlier this year, and was immediately taken in by the spacious lobby (with fabulous wine bar!) with high-end appointments in both the lobby, restaurant and room. The staff is polite, friendly and helpful...although I found the doormen to have a bit more "personality" than the front desk staff. The doormen, room service and housekeeping staff, in their smart uniforms, are courteous and exemplify the higher standard of service one could expect from this prestigious chain of hotels. They are the true lifeblood of this Grande Dame. One MUST experience Aria, the Fairmont's on-site bistro with menu designed by Top Chef contestant, Chef Beverly Kim. The menu is sublime. Kim really has a intriguing way of mixing flavors and textures that are bright and unique, and truly delectable. Our lunch was one of the best meals I have had in Chicago. The Spa at the Fairmont is definitely worth a visit - nothing melts away the stress from a busy work week than a massage and hot towel wrapped around your face, hands and feet - pure bliss. Will definitely return upon my next visit to the Windy City - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day!”
Reviews.Author: MsTiny58
Reviews.Content: In walking distance of Houlihans and the movies. We had a lakeside view on the 33rd floor. Spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms with a View can be had for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Douglas L
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice. Rooms with a great view to the south can be had at a reasonable price if you look for specials. There are plenty of other places to eat and drink. Park in the millenium park underground garages.

Reviews.Title: “Great Thanksgiving stay at the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: thomasgmay
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Very clean and spacious room, attractive lobby, very friendly staff. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Jennfer
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a great deal on this hotel by shopping on Priceline. I did the priceline search the day I planned to travel, so I imagine the hotel was at the point where they knew they weren't going to fill the room and were willing to sell for a lot less. That said, the room was awesome, hotel was modern, and staff was nice. We didn't eat there, but it looked like their menu and options were great too. I was in the room with my two boys (6 and 7 yrs) and we all fit OK in there. They loved the room as well. Our room had 3 windows, plus lake view. We had a huge flatscreen TV in the room and every other modern accessory. The bathroom felt clean and modern too. The location was the best, as it was walking distance to many sightseeing places and clearly easy to take a train or grab a taxi. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Chicago convenience”
Reviews.Author: Vivendi4
Reviews.Content: I selected the Fairmont Millenium Park in Chicago for its location, which is quite near the attractions my friend and I were planning to visit during our brief weekend stay. I also selected it due to my Fairmont Presidents' Club Membership (highly recommend this - it's free and you get free wi-fi, among other benefits) and the great rates being offered. While this doesn't rate as my favorite Fairmont (the Scottsdale Princess and the Kea Lani in Maui beat this hands-down) it still boasted the nice amenities I expect from the brand. We were invisibly upgraded to a high-floor, view room, which was quite nice to discover upon our arrival. The room was not huge, but very comfortable, with a sofa and a desk in addition to the two queen beds. The beds and bedding were comfortable. The bathroom, while large, was not the best for two friends to share, as only one could use it at a time (as opposed to having the sink area separate from the shower area). But there was a handy little shelf outside the bathroom so one could be applying make-up or drying hair while the other was showering. The one room negative was that the walls were quite thin and we could hear conversations in the next room. We also could hear an alarm clock go off and ring for what seemed like forever, as the previous room guest probably set it and then checked out. Lack of privacy is not something I expect from a higher tier hotel. The hotel lobby is sparse, with a bar that only seemed to be staffed now and then. The public areas of the hotel felt neither welcoming nor off-putting. They were unremarkable. The very best part of the stay was that the staff at the desk and door were extremely friendly and helpful. They allowed us a very late check-out (5:30 pm on the day of our departure) without batting an eye, which reminded me why I like Fairmont. They were very accommodating. The hotel is walking distance to the Art Institute of Chicago, and there's a great little cafe along the way, the Toni Patisserie. We loved it and ate there both mornings. Very reasonable and friendly, with to-die-for pastries. The cafe is also along the route to the Willis Tower, which is also walkable, albeit a bit far when it's 29 degrees and the wind is blowing. There is no walkable night-life from this hotel. We took cabs to restaurants and clubs, which were easy and quick. Most cab fares to downtown restaurants, House of Blues, etc., ran about $9 for the two of us. There is a very handy drugstore directly across the street for snacks, drinks and forgotten items. I would stay here again if I had a similar itinerary, but next time I may want to spend more time in the shopping district, in which case I would choose a hotel closer to that area. If you want to go to the Pier, the Art Institute, the Shedd Aquarium, the Field Museum, then this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very fancy, modernistic lobby, but to paraphrase what they say in Texas, it's more hat than cattle. It's rather overpriced, and the extra charges add up fast. I think it is okay for business if someone else is picking up the charges, but I would not recommend staying there on your own dime. The room itself was fine, but the service was only average. The catered food for our meeting was so-so. The location is excellent, but there are several other hotels in the neighborhood that I have enjoyed staying at more.

Reviews.Title: “How do they not know that the shower is broken?”
Reviews.Author: megblake
Reviews.Content: If you look at my other reviews, you will see that I'm very positive and highlight the positives of a hotel or motel. This is my first negative review, and I'm bummed about it, but feel that it's necessary. I arrived at the Fairmont in Chicago this last Wednesday night, very late. After getting to my room, I settled in and went to take a shower. Low and behold, the shower knob, no matter which way it was turned, did not produce any water. Now, I understand water issues and fix it issues, but I was disturbed to think that the cleaning staff had not alerted building management to this issue. Seems like it would be difficult to clean a shower if there was no water. Instead, they just set the bathroom like it was perfectly clean and ready to go. As I looked around the room more, there were stains on all of the furniture. It seriously looks like they got genuine "retro" furniture - maybe from an old frat house, I don't know. It was too gross to sit on. Before I had time to take photos, the staff brought me a key to a different room. While the new room was much bigger, at 5AM, after 3 hours of sleep since the shower debacle, I found out why no one was in that room. The elevators were literally located on the other side of the bed headboard. All I could hear were the elevators going up and down, which sounded more like a motorcross race. Ugh... Thanks for upgrade Fairmont! Unfortunately, due to travel, it looks as though I will be staying her more often... Grrr.... Now I know to ask for a working shower and a non-smoking room as far away from the elevators as possible! I would suggest that you do, too!

Reviews.Title: “NEA Convention In Chicago, ILL.”
Reviews.Author: Helena43
Reviews.Content: This past summer I spent a week in Chicago with National Education Assoc. RA (repsentative Assembly) I stayed at the Fairmont Hotel located near Wacker Dr. and Millennium Park. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and gained valueable info at the RA meetings. So much to see and do as Chicago is a busy city. Took my first public bus ride while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: clark1650
Reviews.Content: If you are in the mood for a great weekend get away look no further then the Fairmont Chicago. An excellent property with breath taking views within walking distance to great art, shopping and just a short walk or cab to word class dinning. A complete package.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hazel132
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room. Friendly staff. Great area to walk to all.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay at the Fairmont again!”
Reviews.Author: sailcaribe
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at the hotel and I must say that it is a beautiful hotel. We had a great view of the city. Our room was beautiful and clean. Everyone always happy to attend to you. Superpacked minibar a plus!!! :) My husband used the gym facilities every morning and was also very happy with the latest equipment it has. Will definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: epollack
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a truly outstanding hotel with spacious rooms (even the smaller ones), great views, polite and efficient room service, and so close to so much in Chicago without feeling compressed. Our room faced Lake Michigan and an open area and gave a terrific fireworks seating on one of those many nights that Chicago has such events. If you are looking for clean, this is it. Have stayed at Fairmont (Montreal) before, and the Chicago Fairmont was just as great.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DHerrold73
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night, but staff was friendly and the room was clean. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Nice location”
Reviews.Author: ajeffer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Room booked through priceline, name your own price, so the cost of room was excellent. Hotel clean. Rooms were nice sized. Staff very friendly. We were on 30th floor and views were great. Has sushi in Aria restaurant, which was ok. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - nice design and details”
Reviews.Author: AlertOwl
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at this hotel. The layout downstairs was a bit weird and the elevators didn't handle the crowds too well. My hotel room was great, and about average price for Chicago. The layout was very spacious, the bed was comfortable. I liked that there was a separate shower and bathtub. The shower was fantastic! The bathroom also included a lighted makeup mirror and a scale. (There's a nice fitness room downstairs) No refrigerator in the room. Concierge was very friendly and helpful. There is a CVS pharmacy nearby, and a great breakfast restaurant around the corner. I stayed here because of the conference, but I would consider staying at this hotel on my own next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Standard 4 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wolfpackgirl12
Reviews.Content: I am writing a review for the standard (run of the mill) double room only. Some friends stayed in nicer, upgraded rooms, so please keep that in mind as you read my review. I found the Fairmont to be a standard 4 star hotel. I enjoyed my stay, but I was not overly impressed by the room or the service I received. I have stayed in 4 star hotels that had better service and more luxurious decor/rooms. What I liked most about the room was that it was big. I have heard that rooms in most hotels in Chicago tend to run small, so I was glad that my room was a nice size. I also enjoyed the espresso coffee maker and coffee that came with the room. What I liked most about the bathroom was the fact that the toilet was separated from the rest of the bathroom by a door. I also liked the fact that there was a separate shower and tub as I hate standing in the tub to take a shower. What I didn't like about the bathroom was the fact that it seemed as though housekeeping didn't clean the toilet area very well. I have to admit that I am a bit of a clean freak, so please bear that in mind, but with that being said, the toilet just seemed dirty to me. The location of the hotel is also nice. We walked to Millennium Park, and we walked from the hotel to downtown and the Magnificent Mile area. Please note that I love to walk, so the hotel seemed to be close to everything. Overall, the Fairmont is a decent 4 star hotel. If you want a nice place to stay, then I recommend it. If you want luxury, then don't book the standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Fairmont Standards”
Reviews.Author: Matthieu25
Reviews.Content: As I start all reviews, please take a look and see how many hotels I've reviewed, I'm not a jaded one time traveler. I travel often and feel I have a good base to write a good overall review. I'd also like to say I love Fairmont Hotels, I've stayed in several and do prefer them to other 5 star properties (Usually) Before my stay I checked the TA reviews as I often do and was surprised by the amount of negative reviews. But I do take negative reviews with a grain of salt of the person writing the review has only written one review. This stay at Fairmont Chicago was surprising to say the very least. Upon arrival the valet was very prompt taking our luggage and parking our car. The lobby is really outstanding, it's very new and modern. The service was lacking, usually if you are a Presidents Club - Premier you're really rolled out the red carpet. This did not happen, honestly the man checking us in didn't even acknowledge it. At no point did he ask of we would like to upgrade to Gold or if we wanted any reservations for dinner or the spa. The elevators are quick (which I love) We booked a "Parkview Suite" on the 34th floor. The room was HUGE (living, dining, separate bedroom and large bath) as stated in other reviews the rooms are missing something. I don't know if it was because it was a suite but the room had a cold empty feel. The room did have the usual great bedding and comfortable bed in room coffee full mini bar. It appears that when the last renovation took place it was done quickly and no attention to detail. The paint was chipping in several areas, the bathroom door was out and out dirty the sprinkler head in the bathroom was falling out of the ceiling the pocket door for the water closet did not close. The bath did have an updated sink, mirror, tile and shower which were very nice and on par with other Fairmonts. Another huge disappointment was the lack of plugs and odd places for the light switches. In the bedroom there were two useable plugs and they were across the room one behind a heavy bench the other under the window so if you wanted to charge your phone by the bed you couldn't. Our room was right next to the elevators and unlike other reviews we had no issue, it just sounded like the wind blowing (and they don't have a bell that dings) As a Presidents club member their workout gear is usually waiting in the room again that was not the case, turndown service was sporadic of the 4 nights only turned down twice. ( I can close my own drapes but if you're going to do it be consistent) During the times we were turned down we received bottled water and a piece of paper with the next days forecast (at other locations these are nicely printed, here is was a very old copy of a copy with the info hand written) My biggest point of frustration was we decided to add a day to our stay. This in my opinion should not be complicated, yet the front desk seemed as if it was the biggest request ever made. First we were told sure that wouldn't be a problem, then received a call that our current suite was booked and would have to move to a standard room we said fine, then we were told we could stay in the room and then another call to see if we were checking out and then received a voicemail stating we wouldn't have to change rooms. To me it appears as if the right hand isnt speaking to the left. On top of all that once we returned to the hotel at 8pm we reached our room on the 34th floor to find our keys didn't work. We then got to stand in a line for 15 minutes so we could get our keys re-activated. At all the other Fairmonts I've stayed I like to view our Guest Folio via the tv. This location does not offer the option. The concierge was great, was able to give great transportation tips and suggest good restaurants. (Shaws Crab House, Gaylord Indian) The hotel restarant for dinner was OUTSTANDING, the food, service and even the decor excellent. It is really top notch and again on par with other Fairmonts. Sadly the breakfast was a total joke. Im sorry but $16 bucks for 2 eggs is a joke. They may claim that the pricing is comparable with other hotels but I still think to price gouge your customers who just paid for hotel room with you is not right. We do have some great tips, the hotel does not make you aware but they are connected with the Chicago pedway system. You can walk from the hotel all the way to Macys State Street (aka Marshall Fields) without setting foot outside. It is a little confusing and poorly marked but sooooo convenient with the harsh Chicago winters. After seeing the breakfast prices at the hotel we were able to take the pedway to "Wildberry" the breakfast is truly EXCELLENT (ate there all 4 days), everything is fresh and the prices are in line with what they should be. As stated the pedway came in handy, you can also take it to the train station and a mall on State Street. Granted if you look at a map they are only a block or two from Michigan Ave, but to get to the good shopping you must take a taxi or bus. You can walk to State street for shopping but Mich Ave is far better. Overall would I recommend this hotel? No. This is a nice hotel but does not live up to Fairmont high standards I've received at the other properties. I would have felt very cheated and most likely addressed these issues with the manager if I'd paid full price but they offered a good winter deal.. For the price I'd as you can read in my other reviews recommend the Four Seasons or Ritz if for a 4 star I'd go with the Intercontinental. Those are are very central and very high quality. If you have a chance to ever stay with Fairmont from my past travels I'd recommend them 100% (except this one) Happy Travels! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: McLean4
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently on business. It's convenient to both Michigan Avenue and the Loop. I like more traditional furnishings than what this property offers, but the rooms are comfortable and tasteful. Very convenient bus service so you don't have to rely on cabs and an easy walk to the L train. Great fitness facility. Just need to join the Fairmont President's Club to get free wi-fi and access to the spa/fitness center. Always a good choice when you can get a decent rate, but when rates are more than $300 a night, I would like at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overrated”
Reviews.Author: alphabetsoup2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while traveling for work. The hotel is nice - in a great part of town right by Millennium Park. But it just doesn't 'work' aesthetically. The check-in staff are inefficient; the lobby is laid out in a noisy, messy and disorienting way; the bell service is flurried and unfriendly, and the rooms are just kind of 'blah'. Nothing bad here - just not very inspiring.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: anniegarzie
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for the first time the first weekend of December and my stay at this hotel was great! The lobby is quite nice the kind of modern contemporary decor and the room (double bed) was pretty clean and spacious. The bathroom was impeccable and the staff was welcoming and helpful. The food at the Japanese restaurant is delicious! The best of this hotel is its location! It is situated minutes from millennium park (approx a 5-7 minute walk), Michigan avenue, Willis Towers, Museum of Art, Navy Pier, Train Station etc. Inside the hotel they can help you book some tours, like the city bus tour or the architectural tour. There is a nice restaurant right around the corner of the hotel called Wildberry. I had breakfast there which was just the perfect energy booster I needed to handle all the walking down Michigan Avenue! One last recommendation, go ahead and try Giordanoâ€™s Pizza which is down Michigan Avenue (we had to go like 1.30 hours before and write ourselves down on the list and then come back and order our food and afterwards we were seated, but trust me the food is worth the waiting) Also if you have a chance go to House of Blues; great music, food and drinks! I would definitely recommend you staying at this hotel as it is in a safe neighborhood and well located nearby all main attractions of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE staff - STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK”
Reviews.Author: Lisandro T
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel in downtown Chicago. The rooms are ok (nothing great), they were remodeled and is now modern instead of classic. However, the service (staff) was ABSOLUTELY the worst. When I mean the worst, is something worst than Super 8. I called to the front desk because my remote control was missing and the espresso machine was broken. I got transferred to the kitchen. The lady had a really bad attitude and was even screaming at me. The coffee and remote control arrived over an hour later to my room and I even had to call twice to get them. Fairmont? No thanks, never again. I rather stay at Hilton, Starwood hotels, or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jamesm0m
Reviews.Content: Our son just had a special birthday, so we decided to stay downtown (we live locally) to celebrate. We picked The Fairmont because our dog could come along. What a great choice! The suite had a fabulous view, gorgeous bathroom, dog bed and bowls for our hound, and a lot of ultra extras. There was even a chocolate birthday treat for our son in the room. The Fairmont's location is perfect. We walked to WaterTower, a movie theatre, and Millennium Park. Had dinner at close-by Tavern on the Park, which overlooked the park and streams of busy holiday shoppers. Everyone at the hotel, from the valets to Chef Concierge Timothy Samples, made our stay extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DWeso
Reviews.Content: Our visit was a weekend getaway for two couples. We booked two rooms, pre-paid, non-refundable through an internet website and got a decent rate. When we arrived, check in was quick and courteous. Our rooms were beautiful. Spacious, clean and well appointed. We lucked out with a beautiful East view, on the 19th floor. All of our interactions with the staff were great. Very attentive. The hotel is a short walk from Michigan Avenue shopping, which was part of the purpose of our visit. My wife and I liked this hotel very much, and will return on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the elevator rumble, Very Good”
Reviews.Author: ExoticDave
Reviews.Content: So, there are several things to discuss here. One, the restaurant was great. Overall I liked my stay here. The room, with its irregular shape, was very spacious, nicely appointed, clean, and comfortable. The shower wasn't huge, but at least it wasn't in a tub. The toilet was in its own closet, which I love. The sink didn't have an enormous amount of room around it. All this being said, the king bed was comfy with nice pillows and sheets. Fortunately the black out curtains were also insulating keeping the room nice and warm. I have no real complaints about the room, housekeeping, or the property in general. There was an audible "rumble" from the elevator bays that were several rooms away. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good location, but experience diminished by housekeeping (and management thereof)”
Reviews.Author: cjigga
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice. The first time (in early Feb â€™11) was perfectly fine, though a bit disappointing that there is no complimentary fitness facility. Comfortable furniture, nice dÃ©cor, and spacious bathrooms. Second visit was very much marred by the lack of cleanliness in the bathroom. The walls of the bathroom were filthy, including with what looked like possibly a smudge of blood. We had checked in rather late and unpacked and changed into night clothes before using the bathroom. As such, my boyfriend wasnâ€™t inclined to complain at that hour. Nevertheless, I went to the front desk and the attendant offered to change me to a comparable room. I took the key, saying Iâ€™d inspect it, and asked that whether or not I moved to the new room, he please instruct housekeeping to clean the walls during the next dayâ€™s cleaning. (The room was, in fact, below grade to that which we were already unpacked in. We didnâ€™t take it.) The next day, after returning from a day of out, I see the room was cleaned, but the walls were not touched. (And a robe was removed but not replaced.) I called the front desk and the woman who answered apologized and sent someone to clean it. I pointed out the areas to be cleaned and left the housekeeper be while I prepared to leave for an appointment. After a few minutes, the housekeeper announced that sheâ€™s done and I hurriedly gave a small tip. When I later stepped into the bathroom, the walls which had long dirty trails of thick, dripping â€œgunkâ€� were cleaned, but the red, blood looking stain was still there. I was running late and so disappointed that I didnâ€™t try to complain a third time. When I checked out the next day, I returned the keys, including keys to the lower grade room that had been offered to us, mentioning a problem with our room to the desk attendant. She didnâ€™t ask me what the problem was or if the problem was resolved. The Fairmont location is great and at first glance, the hotel looks quite nice. Unfortunately, housekeeping is not up to par and neither is management/follow up by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Gordinan
Reviews.Content: Nicely comfortable and staff is helpful, well located in downtown chicago

Reviews.Title: “Newer and Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Gatorfan-Craig
Reviews.Content: First time staying in Chicago and very pleased with this hotel. I booked a suite, which was very large. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The location was very good, maybe a little bit of a walk to downtown attractions and restaurants, but not bad. The food at the restaurants here was very good and overall, a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “First time staying at a Fairmont Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jade W
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed at a Fairmont hotel before but I found a great deal on Expedia for our Chicaco trip in August - $150 including valet parking. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel was quite conveniently located - we walked to the Pier, took the free trolley ride back that dropped us pretty close to the hotel, we had deep dish pizza at Giordano's near by and also walked to Millenium Park. The room was very clean, modern decor, with a great view. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “elegante”
Reviews.Author: turistadeccs
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, not cheap, but the views are mainly to the river there are better located hotels this one is close to the Millenium park

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kat0627
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect only 5 minutes from Michigan Ave. home of Magnificent Mile. Macy's was around the corner on Randolph and State, only 5 minutes away. Also in close proximity to the theatre district, Great hotel! Room was oversized, clean, with a great view of downtown. Nice breakfast place around the corner on Randolph St.. Only complaint was satellite signal on TV kept going out. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent service, splendid rooms.”
Reviews.Author: 1lilcook
Reviews.Content: Fairmont always does a great job and their Chicago property is a prime example of that. The hotel is lovely, service first rate, rooms are lovely with a contemporary flair and the bathrooms are large. We stayed in a "Pure" king room, and were upgraded to a higher floor with a lovely view of Lake Michigan and Millennium Park. The windows open, so if you are like me and crave the fresh air, you are in luck. The bed was extrememly comfortable and the room also had a desk with chair and a couch with a coffee table. Very roomy, very nice. We had breakfast one morning in Aria and while it was expensive, you expect that in a beautiful hotel. The service was outstanding. They offered a georgous buffet breakfast, very much like the ones you see in Europe. We didn't opt for this, but I looked amazing. The location suited us fine...you could wak to shopping on Michigan Avenue or to the Theatre district. Everything was conveniently located. I would highly recommend this splendid hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SimesFam
Reviews.Content: We loved that this hotel was located right in the center of things. We could walk just a mile in any direction and see it all. Service was wonderful and the bed was very very comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Marathon friendly”
Reviews.Author: Suffolkwanderer
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late on a Thursday night before the marathon but it didn't faze them. Got the lovely hotel within a hotel floor (the 15th i think) with included breakfast, etc etc. Lobby can be noisy and the wine bar service seems patchy but the restaurant is good and so is the bar. I was running the marathon and they offered a number of race services, free water and the location can't be beat, frankly. Clean, modern, friendly. Liked it.

Reviews.Title: “There are likely better options”
Reviews.Author: Lora01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property in Sept 2011. The location was excellent! The room was nicely decorated, bath area was lovely. This is an older hotel so I didn't expect everything to be perfect but thought the room could be a bit cleaner and better maintained. Electrical type panel in the room was falling off the wall. Silver fish ran across the bathroom floor once. Telephone wires were crossed with another room so when you answered you could talk to the other room and the person calling. It was addressed and fixed in a timely mannor. Had to call housekeeping several times, staff did not leave fresh drinking glasses on more than one occasion or remove dirty dishes, or garbage. I had to call more than once to have them refresh the coffee station. Concierge staff was amazing - very knowledgeable and helpful. Filled out form for management at the end of my stay and didn't hear back from them, guess they don't care about your stay after you have paid. We were there 4 nights, $1200, a bit pricey for this place over all. I would stay in the same area but likely at another property next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hope I never have to go back until it improves.”
Reviews.Author: Diamondgirl_11
Reviews.Content: I was there for a Tax conference in May of 2011. It was the poorest excuse for a hotel. The service was horrible and they overbooked the conference space. The other conferences were eating off the food put out for us with no staff to monitor what was going on. The AV dept. was spread too thin without enough staff to attend to our needs. The meeting rooms were not set up to our specifications and when we called several times before the meetings were to start to fix the problems, we could get a response and had to go on without without flip charts and handheld mikes. The projector didn't work in one room and it took forever to get help. Some of the staff yes'd you to death and never delivered! The only thing nice was the food and the beds were comfortable. Location was accessible to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: JoToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and family stayed at this hotel over a weekend for a wedding. There was a lot of buzz going on at the hotel, as President Obama apparently stayed at the hotel just the week before while coming back to Chicago to visit. The lobby is a little small for such a grand hotel, but the decor was modern and inviting. The bar/ restaurant at the lobby was great for lunches. I truly enjoyed the micro brewed Chicago beer sold there. The rooms at this hotel were quite nice. Very clean, crisp modern design. Beds were dreamy and lush. Our room was on a high floor, looking out over the lake and the park. Simply beautiful Chicago landscape. We found the staff to be about average and did not encounter any issues or stressful sitiuations. The hotel is located just a walk away from everything you could possibly want to do in Chicago... shop, eat and sight-see. Right next to Millenium park it was fun to hang out and people watch. Just a 20 minute walk to the Magnificent Mile for shopping. You can take a cab and it doesn't cost too much. Also if you have a chance, go check out the architectural tour by ferry. Overall, this hotel is very good for families and couples. We were able to get it at a discount because of the wedding. At full price, you might want to check out other options before deciding on this hotel. It can be quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a thorough cleaning and updated air circulation”
Reviews.Author: so_oregon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five days in November for conference. Floor dirty, the cleaning staff did minimal, the bar staff is responsible for upkeep of coffee supplies and apparently they are trying to use up decaf because as I used the regular, they kept replacing with more decaf. No service at all on the last evening. Air and heating unit is poor, no circulation in room and lots of scuff marks in hall and room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Fairmont experience”
Reviews.Author: Czar
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy staying at Fairmonts and when business or personal travel took me to places with a Fairmont, that's where I usually stayed. The Fairmont Millenium is a nice hotel - quite chic in the lobby. Unfortunately, it's just missing something. It doesn't have the same feel as other Fairmonts. I believe a big piece has to do with the service, and I'll recount some experiences below. Nothing terrible but not in line with the caliber a Fairmont is supposed to be. Overall, it's a clean space in an OK area. The Millenium Park is right there and a nice place to walk. You can also play tennis on the nearby public courts. So here are some of the negative service experiences: 1. Check-in - 2 people, both on the phone, so had to wait nearly 10 minutes for someone to help us. 2. Arrived at our room to find keys didn't work. Had to go back down, wait AGAIN, only to find that we were given the wrong room number (714 instead of 602). 3. Went out front to get a cab. Doorman asked if I needed a cab, I said yes, he blew his whistle, walked away and began a conversation with another employee. Cab never came and he seemed more interested in his conversation so I walked down to the street to grab one. 4. Called the concierge to ask about the Adidas Fit gear. Was placed on hold. Kept phone on speakerphone while I shaved, brushed my teeth, etc., and he never came back on the line. 5. When I did get someone in te line, I asked if they had sweatpants (it was 34â€¢ out), was told yes, they sent up shorts. 6. When I went to check at the concierge desk, woman was on phone with what I assume was a disgruntled guest, as I could hear the person's tone - while she was just rolling her eyes. 7. I had two packages arrive suing my stay. Was not alerted about either and when I found where to get them, it took about 15-20 minutes to get them. Overall, these are mostly small things. In and of themselves I wouldn't complain, but the overall customer service experience here is poor. It's akin to what I had expected at the Hilton I chose not to stay at. My conference was there, and based on the hotel and service, I wish I had stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: P C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont three nights with the Fairmont Gold package. I had a corner room with a view of Millenium Park and Lake Michigan off in a distance. The bed was amazingly comfortable and there were various pillows ranging from soft to firm to accomodate one's preference. The shampoo and conditioner provided smelled lovely. The concierge lounge is very nice and quiet and the staff were most helpful. The breakfast, cocktail hour and desert were perfect. I also ordered room service and the food was quite tasty and delicious. I'd definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel with super slow Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: TXwonderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fairmont two nights attending a conference. The hotel is in an excellent location. The check-in and check-out process was friendly and efficient. The room was spacious. The bath room had separate shower and tub. The closet was suprisingly small. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. I didn't hear street or hall way noise. My only complaint is the Wi-Fi speed. The standard package costs $15 per day. The speed was so slow I thought I mistakenly selected dial-up. I ended up going to Starbucks in the Aon Center next door to get free high-speed Wi-Fi. I had dinner in the Aria restaurant. The food was Asian fusion. The services were attentive but the food was not impressive enough for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in all things.”
Reviews.Author: marcyro
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference at this wonderful hotel felt a little like a vacation. Excellent, helpful staff, beautiful rooms and superb location mean I will return. Beds were slightly lumpy, but all the comfy pillows and linens felt so divine, I kind of forgot the mattress was too soft. The Eno bar was a focal meeting point for our group and it was a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Susan P
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Fairmont on the 25th floor which had amazing views. The room was very spacious and the bathroom amazing. Check in was very quick and efficient. In the foyer of the hotel is a wine bar called ENO. I would recommend this, its so good - wine, selection of cheeses and selection of chocolates, heaven!!! The hotel is very well located just far enough out from the hustle and bustle but near enough to walk to many interesting sites. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JCR059
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights in the Fairmont Chicago in early October. Several years ago we were fairly regular guests there but have not been more recently. It was a real pleasure to return and experience the new decor. We had a lovely, comfortable room with a great view. We had a wonderful, interesting dinner in the Aria Restaurant one evening. The service we received from the Fairmont staff was simply outstanding. The location of the Fairmont Chicago is outstanding with numerous restaurants, stores, and other attractions within walking distance or a short taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveller99
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights - 34th floor - nice size rooms - Not exactly in the center of things, but convenient (5 minute cab ride) to many good restaurants. Banquet food and service was very good. No complaints - not sure I'd use it as a base for a vacation - would likely use more centrally located places - but a very, very good business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at The Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: pasadena4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location near Milennium Park. Our rooms had views of both the Park and Lake Michigan. Easy walking distance to the Miracle Mile on one side of Michigan Avenue and the Chicago Museum of Fine Arts and the theatre district at the other end of the Avenue. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Spotty service on occasion ( lack of newspaper delivery 3 out of 4 days; housecleaning crew arrived before 8:30 am each morning).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: annette r
Reviews.Content: Just got back and we loved our stay!! Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, but they treated us to a glass of wine in the wine bar while we waited, nice way to start our anniversary getaway! Very nice room ( king deluxe) the view was amazing and clean as a whistle! The customer service was above and beyond, we had a package that included parking, they held our bag for us after check out for a few hours and let us leave our vehicle there at no extra charge!! Free parking in downtown Chicago??!! Awesome!! Perfect location, we'll def. be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views; walkable location”
Reviews.Author: sophiedogdaddy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views of the Lake and Millennium Park. The hotel is centrally located, but off of the main thorough fares, which makes it a pretty quiet location. Had lunch at Aria, and while pricey, it was very good. Can't wait to see how far the Chef makes it on Top Chef. I do agree with the earlier review that the nickle and diming gets old, but that seems to be the way things are anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Dschneid
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a beautiful hotel with amazing views from the guest rooms. The only complaint is that the walls were pretty thin...could hear our neighbors, who were very loud talkers.At 3am we called the front desk about the noise and they moved us to a beautiful suite and comped us breakfast at Aria. They couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great city - suitable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theatrebuzz
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is in a great location to enjoy Chicago. The room was a good size and clean, but not much charm compared to the Fairmonts in Ottawa, Quebec, and San Francisco. The hotel staff are efficient but no warmth (except the doormen)- I like to be asked if I enjoyed my stay. We definitely never hurried back to spend time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for the Marathon!”
Reviews.Author: James-RJM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Chicago Marathon and it was great. The bus to the Expo picks up right outside the door and the race start and finish is a block away. The rooms are very well appointed and very nice with great views on all sides. The doormen even offer you bottles of water when you come back from a training run.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: oldntyred
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for the Marathon and this is ideally situated for anyone considering entering in 2012. The view from my window was excellent and I was able to see across Millenium and Grant Parks towards the lake. From a tourist's persepective. everything you need in Chicago is within a short walk; Shops on Michigan, Chicago Institute of Art and even an excellent Deli around the corner. Rooms are clean, modern, spacious and well-equipped. Staff are courteous and helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend”
Reviews.Author: oldflame
Reviews.Content: This review is kind of late--we stayed here in Feb. 2011 for 2 nights. Pretty good location, just about 2 blocks off Michigan Ave but south of the river. Easily walkable distance from the Millennium station (south shore line). Beautiful lobby area, they have large ballrooms so parties going on both evenings. Upon check-in the front desk offered to help with dinner reservations but we were already set. Very nice room with king bed, desk, large tv, large cushioned bench at foot of the bed. The bathroom sink and shower and toilet were together and the vanity and mirror outside. Nice upscale hotel. They have a fur safe in case you're traveling with one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, easy access to shopping and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Julie6843
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Chicago Marathon and checked in on Thursday, before most other runners arrived. We were given a room right by the elevators and all we could hear were the elevators going up and down all night (and day, while in room). Thank goodness the windows opened and the weather was nice so we could drown out the sound. Otherwise, a nice room but, find out about your room placement to elevators!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Gold Floor Worth the Extra $$”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: As a President's Club member (free to join) I was given the option of upgrading to the Gold Floor for $65 on a standby basis (find out whether the upgrade is avalable at check-in.) it was the weekend of the Chicago Marathon, so I was surprised we got the deal. It includes complimentary wi-fi, use of the Gold Lounge, buffet breakfast and afternoon snacks, honor bar and dedicated concierge. Since we used the Lounge quite a bit, it was worth it. When my husband could not charge his Blackberry, the concierge lent her personal charger. The concierges helped with dinner reservations and directions (The lobby concierge was busy with personal call.s) Only 2 complaints: although coffe and tea are available in the Lounge, I like to make a pot while I am dressing. There was no coffee/tea maker in the room. The clock was a little analog thing which only lights when a button is pushed--I prefer one which can be seen in the dark, while in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: btyndal
Reviews.Content: Hotel was prebooked for us as we were part of a conference. The hotel itself is gorgeous, swanky wine bar in the lobby (Eno), sushi bar (Aria). We were here in October so the entire lobby was breezy and cold. I couldn't enjoy a glass of wine without being cold. The overall hotel is dark. There aren't any plush areas in the hotel to just sit, relax, work and be comfortable. The rooms were average, plain decor. Join the Presidents Club before leaving home (I didn't know about this)! Its supposedly free. Otherwise you will pay a daily fee of $25 for Wifi. There is a daily charge to use the hotel gym. Highly disappointed with this. A bottle of water in the room is $10. There is a market across the street to buy snacks and water but the hotel fridge is packed full of items that there is no room to put your own water. All the reviews I read claim the beds to be comfortable but I found them to be a bit rigid and woke up with a stiff neck and back. Comfortable sheets/bedding. Beautiful bathroom, large, separate shower and tub, marble. Ladies, if you have long hair, bring your own shampoos/conditioners! I am used to hotels that use Aveda. The products here left my hair unmanageable, low quality. The hotel location is a bit removed from central downtown, but still walkable if you are not wearing heels. very close to Millenium Park which was nice. Aria, the sushi restaurant in the hotel is very swanky, dimly lit. I thought at first it was too overpriced, a cocktail is $14, but then realized $14 is the average price in most of the bars! I am from Portland Or and most cocktails average $7! Staff and concierge all very friendly and helpful. We cabbed it there so I don't know how much parking was or whether it was free. This hotel overall was nice but it is the small things that count. I would probably try another place on my return visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: samjones15429
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel 4 nights in september 2011,&, although my business meetings were at another hotel, I am very happy with my choice. I had a corner room with great views from 2 sides. The hotel is so centrally located near beautiful Millenium park & near the Chicago River & the navy Pier. I also had free parking . Staff were very friendly & heilpful. I would stay there again & recommend this hotel to anyone, the room was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: faarias
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel in a good location, but fails to make more of an impression than any Hilton or Marriott would make. The decor of the rooms and lobby is nice nd updated, but does not match other areas of the hotel such as the elevators, doors, and outside architecture. We stayed in a room with Gold Lounge access and this was also a sort of disappointment; the lounge was nice and service was great and friendly, but not up to the standards of other Gold lounges such as Boston or Lake Louise. The location was great, an easy walk to Millenium Park or up Michigan Avenue, but would probably not stay here again with so many other great choices in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great. But still a nice place”
Reviews.Author: concordia7
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Very good quality snd high standard of device. Lobby looked great. Can't comment on amenities as I was simply in and out of the room. Had a corner suite. Big room but furniture was unimpressive. Sofa was worn in pretty bad in the middle. Doors etc were a little beat up. Beds were tiny! I think they were twins.stayed at the swisshotel the week before... Would go back to Swiss before doing fairmont again. Like I said... Good but not great....

Reviews.Title: “Luxe Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra_Toronto
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed at the Fairmont for a long weekend to celebrate her birthday. Service staff was accommodating, the only complaint we both had was that we were promised an iphone/ipod charging dock, and what it really was, was a lamp with an iphone/ ipod dock built in. It did not charge our devices (we left them at home since we knew there was a charger in the room) and we had to have them switched twice because they were dead. A small inconvenience. Otherwise, terrific room, good space, great beds (so incredibly comfy) and great A/C control on one of the hottest weekends of August. Located a little ways away from subway (about a 15 minute walk) but there is a nice view of Navy Pier from the hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If we don't upgrade to presidential, WE WERE NOBODY!”
Reviews.Author: EraCardoso
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the free parking and the location right in the city, we thought it was amazing, great deco, very pretty, but the more we stay the more we felt bad.............We ask about internet, is 15 usd plus tax, but if you upgrade to a presidential club, or what ever is free, not even at the lobby is free, we thought if we go out of the hotel we could get the free internet from the Hyatt next door, ja, ja, ja, ja, ja, ja, didn't try it, but it probably happenes. We try to go work out at the gym, no my friends is not FREE, they charge you!!!! first hotel they charge for the use of the Gym, that I know from around the globe!!!! But wait, if you are in the presidential club, you have it included................ We were afraid to look at their staff they might charge us for a smile!!! You want bottle of water from the room, is a charge directl to your room, twice the price from the pharmacy across the street. (This happenes in most hotels, so I guess is okay). But maybe in the presidential club you get a bottle of water for free.............. We order roomservice, they brought two soups and a pasta, very nicely set, and us like good Mexicans, we tip the waiter, with out looking that they added a 20% extra to the bill, we paid 65 usd for that light dinner............. It seem to me that they give you a good price of the room, but once you are there, they try to get the most money our of you from somewhere!!! Not happy with that, my friend that lives in Wisconsin and that stayed also there to meet with us got a call just last week from the sales manager asking "how was her stay and if she/he could help her with another stay in the future".......... that is the attitude, I smile be nice, and get MORE out of you!!!! No one really took the time to explain what was the presidential clbu thing they so much like us to join....... I think it was like 30 usd a day extra, you get a nicer or higher room, internet, gym and probably some other things............ if you don't have that, YOU ARE NOBODY, in that hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - a little off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: MattNY
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for a conference. It's a little out of the way for downtown Chicago, but there are always cabs available. The room was perfectly acceptable with a large flat screen TV that had HD service. I found the bed to be ridiculously comfortable. President's Club members get the basic bandwidth at no cost, but it's not very fast so you really need to upgrade for $10/day. If you're not a member, it's like $25/day. The gym is pretty large and they give you a towel and bottle of water when you get there, again, if you're a member of the loyalty program. There are like 9 treadmills, 4 ellipticals, a bunch of bikes, a stepper and plenty of weights. It also looks like a very nice spa (but didn't use). All the staff members, from the front desk to the bellhops to the doormen were very professional and pleasant. They are very good ambassadors for the company. The food at the conference was average, and from what I understand ridiculously expensive. It's a union hotel, so that's got to factor into the cost structure. Overall, I don't stay at Fairmonts much, so I wouldn't choose it over the other brands that I typically stay at, but if you do like Fairmonts (or don't care about points), then you'll enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, great service, but confusing layout and decor”
Reviews.Author: Charla
Reviews.Content: The people at this hotel are wonderful, e.g.: Attending a business meeting, arrive for Day 1 (banquet room) breakfast in search of caffeine - the carbonated kind. I make a joke to one of the banquet waiters about not everyone drinking coffee and tea in the AM and -voila- minutes later he shows up at the my side with a glass of Diet Coke. Stellar! Further, my guest room was nice enough - high-threadcount sheets, dressing area, bathrobes, marble bathroom with WC, big tub and separate shower, etc. Plus, I got free WIFI because I'd followed others' advice on TripAdvisor and joined the (free) FAIRMONT PRESIDENT's CLUB before I checked in. My room had a great view of Millennium Park. And it's only two or three short blocks to the Art Institute if you have free time. And there's a CVS nearby if you want a quick, inexpensive snack. It's this hotel's overall environment that left me scratching my head. (I wish this didn't matter as much to me as it does.) Our sessions met on three different, non-contiguous-levels of the hotel. So in effect, after a session concluded, everyon'es goal was to race to the elevators or escalators to travel to the next session (reminded me of high school) asap. Although the elevators were smooth and quick and many banks of escalators connected the levels, so much focus on vertical travel eliminated the opportunity for the informal mixing and socializing that usually goes on between sessions. There's also a gaping decor disconnect among the areas of the hotel. The meeting rooms are in the grand Fairmont style - lots of moldings, heavy fabrics, swagged drapery and high ceilings with pillars. The lobby (which has a really cool light feature at the check-in desk) had clearly been "updated" to present a contemporary appearance. But my guest room itself was so stripped-down modern that I'd swear it was a way to limit costs during a remodel without it being obvious. Overall, all this made me wonder what the building was going to be when it grew up. Honestly, on most business trips all I'm looking for is a clean room with functioning plumbing. At a hotel brand like as the Fairmont, however, I automatically expect more. (This is the same chain that operates the St. Francis on Union Square in SF, ladies and gentlemen!) The people are great, but the people can only do so much. However, if you plan on having a Hilton/Marriot-like experience and get a great room rate, (and you, preferably, aren't using their meeting rooms,) I'm confident you'll go home happy.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: GaTxNy
Reviews.Content: I was here for work so didn't have a say in where I stayed. I was a little disappointed in this hotel. They charge extra to use the gym and there's a fee to use the wireless, which I wouldn't have minded had the whole place been a little nicer. Sheets had stains, shower never looked totally clean. This hotel has potential but housekeeping (and the tacky ''my spa" sign which deterred me from even trying the spa) would prevent any future stays. The location is great, but there are a ton of hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ablakeley098
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont because that is where my conference was. The Lobby is very pretty and modern and has a great little Wine Bar. The full bar is located in the Aria restaurant. We each ordered a drink at the bar and our bill was $31.00. Crazy expensive so we decided to check out the local area for somewhere else to have a drink. The hotel is in a great location. We walked to Navy Pier and down by the river. The rooms are a bit dated and I didn't really like them. But the meeting space was very nice on the first floor. The best part was the concierge service. They were the most helpful and thoughtful of any hotel I have ever stayed in. I would stay here again based solely on their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Chicagologist
Reviews.Content: Friend came into town with her three kids (7, 5, and 18 months) with very short notice on Labor Day weekend. We phoned the Fairmont at 7:30p on a Friday and asked if they had anything available for that night. They said they did; we further complicated things by asking if they could arrange for a babysitter for three children, they said they would try and let us know; to make us the worst people in the world we said we would be arriving in an hour. When we arrived at the hotel an hour later, they had already called back and said the nanny service had been arranged. The front desk was not able to provide us with the two beds we requested, but instead offered us a grand master suite and a couple roll away beds. Assuring us there would be plenty of room for them. Our concern when was quickly removed when we saw the enormity of the room. Minutes after arriving, the nanny showed up, prepared with age and gender appropriate activities for the children. Quickly followed by our roll away beds. We ordered room service for the nanny and the kids, and it quickly arrived, and we ordered again for ourselves once we came back for the night. It was quick and delicious. The large size of the suite allowed for us to watch TV and talk while the children slept soundly on the other side. The room was clean, expansive, and had no major issues. The service of the hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ccctravels
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. It was in a great location within walking distance to the main attractions. We had a Park View Suite and it was wonderful. Very spacious and comfortable for a long weekend. We also had access to the Gold Floor and the amenities were great. There was a very nice breakfast each morning with hot items and nice snacks at night! The Gold Floor Room was very large with nice seating areas and well staffed. We also had a chance the first day to grab a drink at Aria and it was a nice restaurant with great drinks. A niced, dark spot after a long travel day to just relax! The hotel is decorated very modern and upscale. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne029
Reviews.Content: We recently (9/3/11) booked a room at this hotel with a late arrival check in. We arrived around midnight (one o'clock our time) after traveling 4 hours to watch my son play football in the rain for 3 hours and then another hour to the hotel to find out they had overbooked the hotel and did not have the non smoking room available that my confirmed reservations called for. After arguing for several minutes we were told there was nothing they could do but they would try and find us another hotel if we wanted but because it was Labor Day weekend it might be hard to get another reservation. Because it was late we agreed to check out the room before deciding whether to stay. The Manager went with us to the room and when we stepped out of the elevator into the hallway the smell was so bad I thought I was going to be sick. It was a mixture of marijuana and some other horrible smell. There was also food setting out in the hallway that smelled horrible as well. When we entered our room you could definitely tell it was a smoking room but we were only staying long enough to sleep and leave so we took the room. The only thing they agreed to compensate us for was a free breakfast (which they offer online anyway) We did not take the free breakfast because we didn't get up early enough and I could have cared less about the breakfast. We booked through Magellan Vacations (which was recommended on Trip Advisor) which is a luxury hotel reservation service and they are available 24/7 so I decided to call them and complain as well. They were very friendly and immediately called the hotel while I was on hold but it did absolutely no good and because of the Holiday weekend they would have to wait until Tuesday before they could call anyone. They did follow up on Monday and insured me they would call me on Tuesday however I had to call them back on Thursday. I was told the Hotel was not willing to compensate me in any way except giving me a free upgrade next time we were in Chicago. I have only been to Chicago twice and if I return I will definitely not be staying at the Fairmont so I refused the offer. Also observed another upset customer when we walked up to the check in counter and then 2 young girls were trying to check in and were being told the same as us. No non smoking rooms available even though they had reservations. They were not happy and demanded they find them another hotel. Not sure if they found one or not. We travel frequently and have NEVER EVER been told that a hotel had overbooked and we had to take a smoking room or nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall”
Reviews.Author: mark3r80
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at numerous Chicago hotels over the last 25 years, I will certainly return to the Fairmont.The staff could not have been more helpful. The rooms and common areas are very comfortable, and well maintained. The location while it may be a "bit" out of the way, I found it to be close to everything. We are looking forward to making the Fairmont Chicago one of our first choices when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Whinbrook
Reviews.Content: Recently spent six nights at the Fairmont for a first trip to Chicago. Have experienced Fairmont in Canada which were superb, so had very high expectations for this Chicago property. We got a very good deal so were greatly looking forward to our stay. However, it was just all very ordinary, unspectacular and even drab. We had a 'Stepford Wife' at check-in who we felt sure was on a remote control (she was there seven days later at check out, same fixed grin and glassy stare!). She gave us a large sized room that had all the amenities you could wish for. However, it was gloomy and souless, the contemporary furnishings adding nothing to a feeling of comfort or cozyness. We did have a bay window which was a nice feature but did not allow any more daylight into the room which remained gloomy despite the daily brilliant sunshine outside. The bathroom was large and well fitted but with no magnifying shave/make up mirror. The WC was in a tiny separate cubicle within the bathroom and was a squeeze to use. Toiletries were good quality. A 42" HD TV, swish coffee maker and complimentary mineral water ticked the right boxes too. And yet..... Public areas were stark and gloomy and the bedroom corridor, at least on our floor, was shabby and in need of a make over. We never ate in the hotel. It looked over priced for what was on offer and a menu with the pre-fix 'fusion' never works in our experience. We were concerned that the location was going to be out on a limb but were pleased to find that once we'd got the lay of the land, it was a good, central position for all that (fabulous) Chicago has to offer.
