And the CVS pharmacy in front of the hotel and Bockwinkles supermarket behind were very useful. I just wish I could get more enthused by this Fairmont property but it left me flat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover5169
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our first trip to Chicago. Location was central to walking to attractions, like Navy Pier, Millenium Park, shopping, & dining. Staff was very attentive, Timothy, our consierge was very helpful in navigating us thru the city, and making restaurant, tour and attraction reservations. Thank you to Timothy, and all the staff at the hotel for making our stay a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and nice spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: SLin96
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Close to Millenium Park, close to Michigan Avenue and everywhere else. I have read some reviews describing it as out of the way but I certainly did not find it to be the case. Beds were comfortable and there is a Nespresso machine for coffee. Bathroom is spacious. My only complaint is that there is very little in storage space in the room - I like using drawers to put things in and there was literally the night table and nothing else. There are plenty of places to put your luggage though. Breakfast buffet is a bit on the pricey side at $29 but the high quality of the food made it worth it. We came downstairs a bit too early (30 minutes) on the Monday to the restaurant for a quick breakfast, they weren't open yet but the manager came running over and said he would have the staff (they were setting up) make us a coffee and then he also told us to help ourselves to something in the buffet. We did not want to take advantage of them so we grabbed a couple bagels. I gave them my room number and told them to charge me and they said no no there's no charge. That's great service. Our rooms were cleaned efficiently. For those who get parcels delivered be warned - there is a $5 per package fee and ...this surprised me... they return parcels after 10 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and exceptionally helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gordaguy2
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the labour day weekend two couples in a junior suite - two adjoining rooms on the 22nd floor. The rooms were great - can't say the same for the breakfast buffet but over the top service by Mike and the front desk staff when we accidentally left both sets of car keys in a cab after it dropped us off at Midway (flew Porter to and from Toronto) - Mike was able to look up the security video of the cab that took us to the airport, contacted the driver and arranged to get the handbag back to us via the front desk - 48 hours later we had our bag, our keys and able to drive again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it at first”
Reviews.Author: junkrus
Reviews.Content: We thought this place was going to be a keeper for long weekends in the future but unfortunately it didn't turn out that way. Here is the pro's and con's Pro's -Great location for us near Millenium Park -The rooms are very spacious and monster size for a downtown Chicago hotel -The rate we got of $179 with AAA we thought was good -The service was outstanding by front desk and bell men Cons -We had a room near the elevator, so our bed was right in front of it, and all night long the noise was brutal -We had an adjoining room and we could hear entire conversation of the strangers next door all night long -The bed was too soft for my liking -$52 for parking. I know it is the standard downtown but still stinks My wife was doing the triathlon the next morning and had to be up at 4am, so our cons were big for us. I would go back if we could get a non-joining room away from the elevator. If they would allow it of course.

Reviews.Title: “Compliment to the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: jacaranda83
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Chicago, overnighting both coming and going to and from the East Coast and stayed at the Fairmont Chicago Millennium Park on N. Columbus Drive. The Hotel is one block from Michigan Ave. and one block from the Chicago Riverwalk. From doormen, to bellmen, to front desk, to concierge to restaurant and room service staff, it is the people who make this Hotel such a success. The Lobby design with its coffee and wine bar in the center is a gathering place for informal meetings. I encountered an unusual transportation issue and the two concierge people went out of their way to help solve the dilemma. The classy restaurant, Aria is far above the usual hotel restaurant fare. I took advantage of eating a lunch and dinner in the restaurant and both times was wowed with the service and quality of the food. Aria seemed to be the perfect place for a business lunch or romantic dinner, but did not seem very rambunctious kid friendly. The restaurant is expensive too-expect to spend about $35.00 for lunch without alcohol. A Hotel adjacent to the Fairmont has a restaurant that children would enjoy and I noticed that the room service menu at the Fairmont also had a children's menu. My room both coming and going was both spacious and comfortable. I did not have a view of Lake Michigan but believe those rooms are available. The rooms were clean although I thought that the bathroom floors could have used a little more TLC, especially behind the doors. The bathroom I had on the 9th floor had maintenance issues-loose light sockets that needed attended to. There was also an item left behind by a previous guest on the floor and overlooked by housekeeping. There were obvious scuff marks in the hallways where luggage had hit the woodwork. The pillows in both rooms had a slightly musty smell and probably needed replacing. I realize that I may be getting a bit picky but for these reasons I cannot give this hotel a 5th star. The Hotel has a spa which I used and was happy with. There is a complete gift shop on site off the lobby. All in all, I was very pleased with the Fairmont. I felt safe, genuinely cared for and a part of this vibrant City. I will definitely return here if the occasion arises.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Chicago Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresTraveler
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for the Half Marathon and booked this hotel becuase it was close to the start and finish line. I didn't have much expectations but I was pleasntly surprised with the hotel, I really enjoyed my stay. I would go back in a heart beat, excellent service, good restaurant, great location and spectacularly clean. The standard room was a pretty good sized room for a big city hotel and the bed was phenomenal. I can't figure out why this hotel is ranked at #62 on TA. It really deserves to be on the top 10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not overwhelmingly so”
Reviews.Author: number5alive
Reviews.Content: This property is nice. It isn't the newest hotel on the block but it has a nice, mature, well-established, and well-run feel. The bathrooms are the best feature: separate shower and tub, toilet in a separate WC area, very large, very comfortable and spa-like. The cleaning service in the rooms could be a bit more detail-oriented: there were dried water rings on the table and desk of my room, which indicated to me that the surfaces weren't being wiped down. This is kind of gross, but since I wasn't eating in my room it didn't bother me too much. Overall it is a decent stay, and I would stay there again. Also, the front desk staff was very helpful in telling me that I could avoid a wi-fi charge if I joined their loyalty program. I did this, called the front desk, and they took the charges off my bill.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, Great staff, One of my better hotel stays”
Reviews.Author: RyanB418
Reviews.Content: For many this hotel may be a little out of the way. I prefer being out of the crazy part of any city but the Fairmont is still close enough to walk to Millennium Park, Navy Pier the Financial District as well as a variety of restaurants. Getting deep into the downtown area was a quick 6 dollar cab ride or a 10-15 minute walk. The view from my room was wonderful, I could see the lake from the 37th floor and overlooked a meticulously groomed park, located between beautiful luxury high rise condos. The room was very clean and well decorated. The bathroom was big. The attention to detail, provided by the staff was top notch, I received 5 star service! The restaurant was good, there are many other restaurants that are better in the area but once again the service made eating in the hotel a very nice experience. Compared to most hotels the in room coffee was good and there was plenty, they provided a variety of tea as well. It seemed if I ran out of coffee, if I just walked out of the room and came back the coffee was replenished and the room was tidied up for me. Every day around 5pm, I was visited by the staff that offered me water and ice. The bed was extremely comfortable! The only downfall is the lack of a pool to cool down with on hot summer days. I was on business, it was my birthday, the staff brought a wonderful cupcake that was beautifully decorated with chocolate drizzle and fresh berries, around the rim of the plate the chocolate drizzle spelled â€œHappy Birthdayâ€�, it was a wonderful small gift from the hotel. The valet staff was very helpful, kind and pleasant to talk with. Many hotels are stuffy and overly arrogant, I found this to be a comfortable stay that was more like being home. I would definitely stay at the Fairmont again and would recommend it to anyone that would prefer to stay in a mature hotel full of helpful staff. I have stayed in hotels from Beijing to NY, this was one of my favorite hotel visits.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: fifioh
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Chicago is beautiful, clean and in a great location. It is very close to Millenium Park and to Michigan Avenue. Navy Pier is also walking distance. The hotel itself has been recently updated, although it still has a charm that beckons to the past. We had a room that gave us views of the lake and the weekly fireworks. The staff was very professional and unobtrusive. I love this hotel and Chicago and will go back any chance that I get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice look, less nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: RobLaw47
Reviews.Content: My main message is two days without hot water in the sink. One day I can forget, but not 2. Otherwise the room was nice, with a good view of the lake. The room wad loud. That can be the luck of the draw, but a better hotel offers better noise insulation. The location of the elevators is odd and poorly marked. I'm not a fan of the constant drum beat music in public areas, but some people think that's cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, rocky check in.”
Reviews.Author: ecross40
Reviews.Content: When booking our stay with the Fairmont, we requested an early check in, as we wanted to ditch our luggage and get straight to the taste! We stepped into the beautiful lobby and we checked in, but our room was not quite ready. We were told we could wait, and they would call us on a cell phone as soon as it was ready. Over an hour passed by, without a phone call. As the hour and a half mark approached we decided to ask about the status of our room. Apparently it had been ready for quite some time and they had forgotten to call...ooops! But we quickly got over the delay. The rooms were wonderfully decorated, with large bathrooms! We also had the most wonderful view of downtown! If you are looking for a nice hotel near both millennium park and grant park, this is a wonderful choice!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: AndrewSiemReap
Reviews.Content: It was a relief to find that the Fairmont Chicago had not changed one bit since my last stay a year ago. The staff remain exceptional, the rooms pristine and the facilities fantastic. One tip for future guests: sign up for the free president's club before you arrive, as this will give you complimentary wireless internet. I can't speak highly enough of this place, and look forward to next years visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, beautiful room.... wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Andie M
Reviews.Content: Probably the best stay at a hotel that I ever experienced. First, and most important, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Second, the room was gorgeous - nicely appointed (not overdone), incredibly clean and the view was amazing. The hotel is in a wonderful location. I would definitely stay at the Fairmont again. Thanks to all the staff who made my stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Superb room and superb location”
Reviews.Author: AZB12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for two weekend nights in late July. The service was great. Our valet parking attendant was courteous and efficient. We were able to leave two luggage items with the bellhop after check-out while we went about the city during the day. The bathroom was the nicest hotel bathroom we've ever had and very spacious. The room was delightful and contained a large HD tv. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would surely return to the Fairmont next time we're in Chicago. We booked it through Travelocity and got a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the concierge service here!”
Reviews.Author: JanineWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Fairmont Chicago Millennium Park. Both times have been for Lollapalooza, as our son is an avid fan. Last year we had an excellent room with a view of the city. This year, we asked for 2 rooms with good views, which we received, however our room was adjacent to a suite that had a group of Lollapalooza supporters who partied all night. We were moved to a quieter room, but unfortunately, lost our view. During the course of the move, the Chief Concierge, Timothy Samples intervened on our behalf and made certain that the individuals in charge attended to our complaint. Later that day, I went down and spoke with him. He remembered us from the previous year. Throughout our 7 day stay, he assisted us in many regards, setting up reservations for clubs and restaurants, right down to printing out our boarding passes because the business centre was closed. Finally, he sent up bags of gourmet popcorn to our room, with a welcome back card; a very thoughtful gesture. Likewise, the room attendant on our floor, Maria was very accomodating to all our needs. All in all very impressive service; everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful, but Tim really exceeded any service we have had from concierges at other facilities in the past. Now if someone could only figure out how to stop the room doors from slamming shut, it would be almost perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Beautiful but Staff is So-So”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Chicago is a very beautiful hotel. From the moment you walk into the place, the lobby is simply amazing. There is a wonderful wine and cheese bar in the center called ENO that serves great wine flights with cheese. Off to the right when you walk in is the check-in desk with a very creative light feature that looks like a waterfall. The elevators are very difficult to find, but it's on the opposite side of the check-in desk behind the stairs. The staff wasn't too helpful about where to find the elevators. We were on the 31st floor overlooking the Chicago River (looking north). From other reviews, the south side facing rooms have great views of the lake and Millennium Park. The rooms are very comfortable and decorated very well. The beds were comfortable and the TV was really big! There is a separate tub and shower, and the toilet is in its own little room. The bathroom was really laid out well. The only thing is that it's pretty dark in there - there was a light fixture that needed to be replaced, as you can see in the posted pictures. My only complaints about the room is that 1) the doors are very thin because you can hear what's going on in the hallway. 2) There is no privacy from the windows! Be sure to close your shades because people can look in on you and you can look in on other people. I could clearly see people in the condo building across the way. The concierge was very helpful in the lobby and recommended some pretty good hotels. The location is pretty central to everything as well. It's a quick walk to Millennium Park, the river, and the Magnificent Mile. In fact, we took a boat tour and it started raining. Since we didn't have umbrellas, we walked from the pier to the hotel on an underground street level that kept us dry the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Paid extra for the large room with a view and would do it again.”
Reviews.Author: louisjam
Reviews.Content: I was attending the Lollapalooza concert in Grant Park and needed a room to sleep and rejuvenate. Sprung the extra dough for a deluxe room with a view, which gives you a corner. You could see from two adjacent sides of the building. Blackout drapes were available but I didn't use them, preferring the privacy screens which seemed to block people in adjacent high-rise apartments from seeing in clearly. My room had two comfy queen beds and plenty of space. A small banquette was built into one of the walls looking out the window and you could also view the flat screen TV (40"?) mounted on the wall. There was also a small desk with a rolling chair and another cushioned bench that had drawers for storage. The bathroom and closets were actually in another "wing" of the room. Bathroom had both bathtub and shower stall. Toilet was also separated by a door. Didn't use tub, but shower had rainfall shower head. Bathroom floor and most walls were done in marble, which feels refreshingly cool to the touch. Robes were available and comfy. I splurged on room service for breakfast one day. It cost $41.00 with fees and (included) tip for two poached eggs, bacon, hash browns, croissant, pot of coffee, juice, but was quite an enjoyable indulgence. White-gloved staffer arrived on time, set up a sturdy cart and everything was hot. It's a bit awkward to sit at the table in hotel rooms with available seating, but I managed to bring over the desk chair. I had some wine and a selection of fine cheeses in the lobby wine bar. The server was knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Fairmont Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Loramay12
Reviews.Content: We are presidents club members and to date this was by far our worst experience!!!!!!! We stayed gold level and Jacqui the concierge who was working Thurs.Friday and Saturday was horrible.She is not concierge material,she messed up our boat tour and dinner reservation.She never apologized!!!! Anybody and everybody was having breakfast in the lounge because rooms were not being verified and half the time the concierge was not at the desk!!! We had just spent a week at the Fairmont in Scottsdale and we will absolutely go back there!!! Chicago Fairmont you really need to get rid of the gold floors because you guys obviously don't really care so much about the people staying with you!!! We will not return to Chicago but if we do it will NOT be with Fairmont!!! Shame on you!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: polarbear123
Reviews.Content: After looking for a hotel for the night of August 5, and finding out all were an arm and a leg because Lollapalooza was in town, we ended up here through Priceline, Name Your Own Price. I got a great deal (more than 50% off). We had gone to see West Side Story at the Cadillac Palace theater and the walk here was very easy. We had a room overlooking the Lake, Museum Campus, Millennium and Grant Park which was kind of cool since we could hear the sound checks for Lolla if we opened the window. Knowing the hotel was very full for the weekend, I am happy to report the noise level from the hallways was a non issue. There was plenty of parking in nearby parking garages with overnight rates for much less than the $51 the hotel charges for the valet. So look around at the nearby garages, they seemed to average around $30 for 24 hours. Check in was fast and easy, the bed was comfortable after a long day. I wouldn't hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely dreamy hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathyhub
Reviews.Content: Oh lordie I love this place. Everything is perfect. Great place for a meeting. Great room service. Great linens. I LOOOOOOOVE it.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont - Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bana6969
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great spot. Walking distance to just about everything including Millennium Park (not surprisingly.). The price is a little high but you get what you pay for. Very clean Hotel and the beds are extremely comfortable. Trust me, after a long night of walking you are going to be thankful for these beds. No pool at the hotel which is a minus on very hot days but the restaurant below is very nice. No breakfast included also. This always bugs me about high-end hotels....you pay through the nose and they can't even give you a bagel. (lol) Things are a bit overpriced..but it is a Fairmont for a reason. 2 espresso's were $11!! (Just to put things in perspective.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: lovvacations
Reviews.Content: Two adults for one night. Good location in downtown Chicago. It is located to the side of Millennium Park. About a 15/20 minute walk to Navy Pier and a short walk to shopping the Magnificent Mile. Valet parking is $51 per day but the good news is that you can leave it valet parked until 6 PM day of check out. So you can check out of room, check your bags at the bellmen and enjoy some more of the city on your last day. Room - we were in room 1703 on the PURE floor. I have an allergy to feathers so they upgraded me to this floor. Nice view from this room. Look out between two buildings to Lake Michigan, Buckingham Fountain and Shed Aquarium. The room had a small clock (with hands) that was not digital. You had to reach out and touch it for the light to come on to read it at night. I like being able to look and see time, especially in the middle of the night. The hair dyer they provided was a small plug in one. I am used to having a full size one in a luxury hotel. Room size was good. Had long couch against window, king bed, end tables, desk with chair and TV. Bathroom had a separate shower from tub and separate room for toilet. Also had a separate area from the bathroom with large mirror, outlets and ledge. This was great as an place for me to do makeup and hair while my husband was taking a shower, steaming up the bathroom. I also found myself hitting my foot on a wheel that seemed to stick out a little from under the bed. The above complaints are little and would not stop me from staying again. I just wanted to note them to reviewers. As a side note I have stayed in a few PURE rooms now at different hotels. From what I can tell they are feather free and have a PURE (air purifier) machine in them. So far, I have booked a standard room and noted my allergy to feathers and have always been upgraded for free. My husband and I also got to enjoy the wine bar located in on the main floor in the center. We liked the great selection of wine by the glass and bottle. The best part was that you were able to sample a taste before you committed to a glass. My husband sampled 3 different wines before he decided on his. I sampled two. Another nice option was wonderful cheese plates and chocolate options. We had just had diner so we did not order but others did and it all looked good. Only negative was the loud sounds coming from the lobby due to the fact the bar was open and in the center of the lobby. The concierge Timothy was nice and very helpful. Recommends the West Egg Cafe for Sunday breakfast and although crowed-great breakfast food.

Reviews.Title: “Great, with one snaffu”
Reviews.Author: LarisaP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. Great decor; great service from concierge, shop, room service and check-in staff. All my needs were taken care of, and I had a very comfortable 4-day stay, even if the hotel was fully booked and there were people everywhere. However, there was a snaffu at the Eno Wine Bar: travelling alone, I was sitting at a table with a magazine waiting for someone to see me to give me a menu or explain the selection or something. I waited 45 minutes before I eventually got up to get a menu myself, then waited another 30 minutes before I received my order. The food was fabulous and the wine was expertly paired, but the experience itself left a sour taste in my mouth (sic). So here's a tip: if you're travelling alone, sit at the bar, and don't read.

Reviews.Title: “Few extras”
Reviews.Author: GGDesMoines
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent. The property quality was first rate. We wanted to use the fitness facilities but were unable to because of the very short hours. Facilities also were very limited.. Could not check in before 3 pm on an off-season Saturday, but cell called when room was ready.Good downtown location. Had a room on 34th floor with minimal view and loud wind noise for 2 days straight (the windy city).

Reviews.Title: “Great views big rooms”
Reviews.Author: trevormom
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been newly redone and the rooms are quite large and have views over Millenium park.The location is ideal as you can walk to the Michigan avenue shops or head the other direction for a short walk to Millenium park and the motorized cable car that hits all of the attractions.The theatre distict is also very close. Staff was very helpful particularly Tim the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great city view”
Reviews.Author: jjackiell61
Reviews.Content: I went on a business trip (10/09) and took my family along. This hotel is downtown, within walking distance of the magnificent mile and millennium park. It is just a short drive or taxi to Navy Pier. Parking was a little pricey ($50 a night). The door staff were extremely helpful and felt like friends by the time we left after 3 days. We did not eat in the hotel restuarant and was disappointed that there was an extra fee to use the fitness center, which was located across the street. I Had a great nights sleep and the bathrooms were more than adequate. I would definetly stay here again if it were included in my business budget. If it were coming out of my personal budget I'd look for something less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “a very comfortale, upscale business hotel”
Reviews.Author: barleybo
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel where usiness gets done. Don't confuse it with a place where you could take your family. Exceptionally comfortable beds and pillows, large wall mounted flat screen. I don't use mini bars, and this one also proves to be exceptionally exhorbitant as well. It is well located when you want to break away and go for a run on the Lake, or get out on Michigan Ave for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: koolflowers
Reviews.Content: Pros: * Excellent location between Millenium Park and The Magnificent Mile * Huge bathroom with glass shower and bathtub, seperate "toilet closet", hanging line across bathtub for line drying hand washables * Nice big room and good view even in a lower floor room * Heavenly beds! Very comfortable, nice linens and duvet, plush pillows * Very clean and minimalistic in decor * Excellent maid service daily * Room service delivered on time each morning...beautiful set up * Friendly staff * Quiet Cons: *No drawer space! *$14.95/24 hours internet - This is 2011, please provide internet free of charge for a $300/night room!!! As you can see, the pros far outweigh the cons! We will be returning in October for our fall vacation! * *

Reviews.Title: “I thought this was a decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovefood53
Reviews.Content: We had very pleasant 3-day stay at the Fairmont Millenium in Aug 2010 with a package booked through Expedia. This is a short walk from the Magnificient Mile, but was far away to be fairly quiet when you wanted some quiet time. The rooms were quite spacious for three, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful especially the concierge. There is a drug store right opposite which allowed us easy access to snacks and beverages of our choice. Peferct location for walking around to check out the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to pay EXTRA”
Reviews.Author: phulana
Reviews.Content: The two stars are for the truly beautiful room. The missing stars are for the fact that everything else is extra--a LOT extra. Examples: overnight valet? That's 51$. Sending out a pair of socks for washing? 11$. Want internet? That will be 15$ per day. Using the fitness room? 10$/day. Like a cup of coffee in the morning? It will be charged to your room. To top it all off, this huge hotel seems to have a customer service staff of no more than 4 people at any one time. As a result, it is extremely impersonal (but, I'm sure, very lucrative for the owners.) In summary, if you like being treated like a giant wallet instead of a valued customer, try the Fairmont--it's super pretty!

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and comfortable--tiny peek of the Lake:))”
Reviews.Author: mtswilson
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Very spacious and attractive room. Bathroom design a little awkward. Very nice amenities--hairdryer, mirror with magnification, lovely toiletries. The corkscrew did not work at all. Took bottle downstairs to bar and they could not use it either. But used their super duper corkscrew to open bottle. Very nice personnel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: dm713
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Hyatt or Sheraton on the river, but the Fairmont had a bit lower of a price so gave it a try. I've stayed in Fairmonts in Asia and wasn't disappointed here either. The room was incredibly comfortable and well designed, flat screen wall-mounted TVs and a nice side view of Millennium Park. It's just a block or so off of Michigan Ave. so definitely quiet from street noise yet close enough to the action. A very short walk to Millennium Park and the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: edyrp
Reviews.Content: I slept better as well in the bed at this hotel as I do in my own! High thread count bed sheets and a great mattress helped make our stay very comfortable. We had a corner room (522) which had a nice view facing east. I would ask for the "22" room on any floor. Lake Michigan could be seen between the buildings, including a lighthouse. there was also a view of a rooftop garden below. The room was clean, the lighting was good, the towels were fluffy, and there was enough seating in the room for the two of us (sofa, bench in front of the bed, and a desk chair). It was a lovely place to come home to after meetings, shopping and way too much fine dining around the city. The hotel location is south of the Chicago River, so there is a 3 block walk to get to North Michigan Avenue, or a one block walk to get to Millenium Park. We were approximately three blocks to the Art Institute and the Loop. The room was near the elevator but we heard no noise from that area. Our rate was a negotiated convention rate so there is little to say about the cost other than it was worth it. This was our 4th stay at this Fairmont. I liked this room the best of the four.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PPender
Reviews.Content: The hotel was less than 2 blocks from Michigan Ave, located almost right in the middle. Room was large and spacious. Would stay again. Highly recommend the river tour of the architecture of Chicago. Staff helped arranged. Very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice, but not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RaySF84
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel in a good location. Rooms are large by Chicago hotel standards. Very tastefully furnished. Excellent internet. Beautiful and large bathrooms with a separate shower and plenty of room to put your toiletries. I would have given it one more star, but noticed a few things that while minor, show a lack of oversight. Bedside table falls over if you put anything on the edge. Air conditioning vent has so much dust, dirt, and grease on it that it hasnâ€™t been cleaned in years. Bathroom has a white stone molding around the floor. The top of it looked gray until I realized it was accumulated dust. Hallways are dark and dingy. They must not have been renovated when the hotel was a few years ago. In spite of this I would recommend this hotel because I tend to be picky. Overall it is pretty nice. I realize that hotels are looking for revenue. I know to stay away from the mini bar unless I want to pay an arm and a leg. However, $10 to use the coffeemaker? Come on now. It would be much smarter marketing to raise room rates by $5 and give â€œfreeâ€� coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: judithd_11
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to make us feel as UNcomfortable as possible. They made it seem like they were doing us a favor letting us pay to stay there. Our rooms were not ready when they were scheduled to be. There was no communication between hotel staff and no one knew where our rooms were. I cannot believe such a "fancy" hotel could employ such incompetent staff. Not once during our stay did anyone on staff apologize that our rooms were not available as they were reserved to be. On checkout we informed the staff at the front desk that we had used the room's fridge for our own drinks, but did not consume ANYTHING from the mini-bar. We were assured that we would not be charged...however- there was an extra $25 dollar charge on our credit card and now we need to waste more time with their incompetent staff dealing with this excess charge. We stayed at the Hyatt regency a few days before- their staff was very helpful, even gave us a free upgrade, would recommend the Hyatt regency over the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Good Quality Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: Basic good quality middle-of-the-road hotel. Nothing offensive. Lobby is a bit of a convention center. Rooms not bad quality. Had a rate of $180- for that kind of rate, I'd definitely stay here again. Above $250 per night, don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzlover23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 2 nights following a dismal stay at the neighbouring Swissotel. We were glad to be here. We had a suite on a high floor with a great view that accomodated our party of 3 adults plus a baby perfectly. And at a great rate! Included free parking and a $50.00 food credit per night. Got this from their website. The room was huge and well appointed with a separate living room and a dining area, a huge bedroom with ensuite. Plush and well appointed. Immaculately kept. Service at check was spot on. Food at the hotel was good but expensive. We did not eat at Aria but had room service for lunch. Service throughout our stay was friendly, helpful, accomodating. This is my second time staying at this hotel for the same convention and I will definetly stay here again and recommend to others visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Suite perfect for family in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mulliganm
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to park and easy walk to shopping. Stayed with family and suite with pull out couch perfect. Parking expensive but included with Expedia rate. Excellent service. Even provided a mini fridge for milk exc.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it - great location!”
Reviews.Author: RovingJohnUSA
Reviews.Content: Three nights during a sport conference headquartered here. Beautiful facility and excellent service, but unremarkable restaurants. That is of no issue, though, as the area surrounding is loaded with a variety of places to eat of all styles and pricing. The location is wonderfully convenient with shopping, Navy Pier and lots of other sights in walking distance, or a short taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: missmins
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days for business and loved it. The hotel is next to Millennium Park which is home to the famous "Bean". There is an outdoor theatre that featured an orchestra when we stopped by. You can get a local craft beer and walk around the grounds. So much to see in the area - minutes from Navy Pier. There was also a great restaurant called Giordano's that had true Chicago deep dish pizza right around the corner. The service was great (even bringing me a tooth brush at 2:30am) and the stay was a nice home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but won't go back”
Reviews.Author: alarmist
Reviews.Content: The room and the hotel was lovely. This hotel is pricey. One morning I went for coffee and I paid 2.75, next day I went to the same place same size coffe and I was charged 3.95. We did not eat in any of the restaurants, we were actually to tour chicago and go to the blues festival. I was told if I wanted to make coffee in the room with the one cup coffee maker I was advised to use the evian water and I would be charged $10.00. I guess it was cheaper to get in lobby. The room wasn't made up until 4:30. I asked if we could keep the room the day I was leaving till 3:00 and I was told no, only until 1:00. So we did leave our luggage with the bellhop and there was no charge for that. All in all, we won't be staying there again, it wasn't in the area that we wanted to be in, and prices are too high, and hotel was nothing special. Charge of $14.00 to use internet

Reviews.Title: “We had great views. Our room was huge and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: tiramisulover
Reviews.Content: We had a speedy check-in with an upgraded room on the 35th floor with fabulous views of the lake. The room was a little small for 3 so we looked at a 1 bedroom suite and we switched. We went down to the 7th floor and the views were even better!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrlasvegasio
Reviews.Content: Very good business hotel. Nice size rooms. Sort of out of the way but a 10-15 minute walk to a lot of areas. Dining is pricey. Went to local taverns for great food which are 10-15 walk. Employees Exceptional. CVS across street and down street for any items you forget. Only issue was scuffed hallways and doors.

Reviews.Title: “Received average reviews, I agree.”
Reviews.Author: travelexpress1
Reviews.Content: The staff truly were nice and tried to be helpful and usually were. We upgraded to the Gold Level and I was dissapointed. I have stayed on Gold levels on several occasions and this was the worst. I felt like I was at a "Kids eat free, HBO included " type place. The couple in the room next to us could be heard clearly (literally every word) while they were involved in constant arguing. The sound proofing was terrible! The quality of the guests in general was not as expected. The spa was nice. The room was average as was the stay in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Catter57
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our night here. Convenient to many restaurants, the skating park and the Art Museum. Wonderful view of the park. Only downside is there is only one restaurant in the hotel (sushi, asian I seem to recall) and due to allergies we couldn't eat there. It was below zero and snowing while there...we bundled up and walked and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “My new hotel spot in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Epicurian10128
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont a couple days in April for a Business Trip and I loved it. The location is great, the hotel is among the best 4 stars of the city, the rates are very decent, the rooms are large, clean and design and the staff is really nice and helpfull. From now, I will only stay there when I stay in Chicago. Best, Jerome

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious, efficient and bright”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelGeek
Reviews.Content: The headline says much about the hotel, it is fantastically located, modern, bright and very comfortable. Had a 2-room suite which offered incredible space, catering for everything one could and would ever ask for, and just had the edge when it came to detail. A few minor let-downs were the following - check-in was crowded and there was a long queue * the staff however managed to deal with everybody swiftly and efficiently with as minimal a wait as possible - car parking or valet parking were pretty tricky during busy times * the hotel has own facilities and one can get the car oneself, but the staff will do their best to get your car to you as soon as possible. It does not help that the drive-up to the hotel is quite narrow - the price one pays for the location. - the Japanese Sushi Bar was a bit pricey for what it offered but it could have been worse. Definitely our first choice when we get back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Goodroomsonly
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect as we had read a couple of negative reviews, but our stay was wonderful. The room was clean, new and luxurious. Best of all was the staff. EVERY staff member was pleasant and friendly and couldn't seem to do enough. The Chicago Cab drivers could take a lesson from the Fairmont staff. The location is central to downtown and within easy walking distance of everything.

Reviews.Title: “How to rectify a mistake and make the client happy!”
Reviews.Author: RETIREDFOREVERMORE
Reviews.Content: Due to a mistake, the hotel was overbooked during a Chicago convention and even though I had confirmed our reservation twice with the hotel directly, we arrived to no room in the inn. Fortunately, they found out they had a problem before we arrived and had arranged for a nice room at another hotel close by for 2 of the 3 nights. When we arrived back for our third night with them, we were upgraded to a suite on a top floor with a free breakfast. Oh and so we left with smiles on our faces, they didn't charge us for the 2 nights we had to spend elsewhere. Mistakes happen, but they went out of their way to make us happy. Kudos to the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: gacole
Reviews.Content: Great location...decent but overpriced rooms. Checked in and was told one rate....got bill for TWICE as much. I would stay away from this place with more trustworthy choices nearby!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Fairmont Millennium Park - perfect location for visiting the city”
Reviews.Author: Kim_TravelEnthusiast
Reviews.Content: Location: This is a perfect central location for visiting the city! It is just south of the river, so you are close to North River shopping and dining, a short walk from Navy Pier, just one block from the Magnificent Mile shopping, and a short walk (approximately 25 minutes) from the Museum Campus (Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and Planetarium all here) and you can take that walk through Millenium and Grant parks to get there. Plus a short walk from Millenium Station, the "L" and Michigan Ave bus stops. I cannot stress enough how perfect the location was! Hotel: The staff was super friendly and let us leave our bags with the bellmen while we toured the city after checking out. We found a super rate on Travelocity for Memorial Day Weekend. The hotel was very clean. It looks like an upscale hotel but is budget friendly (for being in the city). We had a room on the 33rd floor where we had a nice view of the city, and we were surprised at how quickly the elevator transended floors and never waited more than a minute for our elevator. There is a nice HD television in the room (not that we were there enough to use it), it was decorated very classy, and the shower head was a waterfall shower which was luxurious as well. I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and just had to give it a great review after visiting it myself. If you are looking for a central place to stay in the city, that is classy but budget friendly the Fairfield Millenium Park is for you!

Reviews.Title: “great locations, swanky, friendly staff - best concierge EVAH!”
Reviews.Author: courtchick54
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with two friends the first weekend in april for a girls' weekend. my husband i stayed here in june 2008 and were very pleased with everything about it. this time around, we arrived in chicago at 9a - upon arriving at the hotel we were checked in and in our rooms in less than 15 minutes!!! timmy the concierge was the most helpful person on earth to us that weekend, helping us with everything from directions to shopping discounts to letting me use his computer to order delivery for dinner. his recommendations were spot on. we had a small problem with the bathroom lights being out, and this problem was resolved within 30 minutes of a phone call to the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, classy, but room service is ridiculously expensive.”
Reviews.Author: lawmama
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent three nights at the Fairmont in August while touring colleges. It's a lovely hotel with traditional features but a very modern lobby and spa area. The location is only a block off Michigan Avenue only a short walk from trendy shops as well as Millenium Park and the museum. Quite a walk from nearest el station, however.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for a single woman”
Reviews.Author: BombayLiz
Reviews.Content: While the Fairmont is deservedly a 5 star place for location, rooms, cleanliness and so forth, it is so DARK in the public places I was very uncomfortable as a single woman. It is impossible to read the paper over breakfast, the lighting is so poor. In the evening, the restaurant felt more like a pick up place than a business place. Also, and this is petty, but when you pay more than $300 per night, you kind of expect them to throw in the Internet for free...............

Reviews.Title: “No Room At The Inn”
Reviews.Author: RLGBJD
Reviews.Content: Three months ago (2/22/11) I booked a night at the Fairmont Chicago through Expedia. I arrived at the hotel at Noon (three hours before check in). The check in clerk excused himself because he "had to check something." The front office manager came to the desk and apologized that the Fairmont had oversold that night and could not accommodate us; instead, the Fairmont would pay for our night's stay at another hotel "just a few blocks away." The Fairmont manager ostensibly called the other hotel in our presence to confirm the reservation. We had to retrieve our car from the valet and drive to the other hotel, which was much farther than a few blocks away, a far inferior hotel, and most inconvenient to the places we would be going while in Chicago. When we arrived at the second hotel, the hotel personnel had no idea who we were, had no reservation for us, and had no availability except a smoking room, which of course was completely unacceptable. When that hotel called the Fairmont manager, she claimed that she had sent us to the wrong hotel and the hotel where she had booked us was miles away. My husband told her this was unacceptable and he booked us at a Marriott. We were only able to get a room there because of my husband's frequent traveler status with the Marriott. In the meantime, I was nearly late for my afternoon meetings in Chicago, was deprived of any time for lunch, and was forced to go to my meetings almost late, hungry, and a bit disheveled because I had no time to freshen up in my hotel room as I had originally planned. I am absolutely astonished at how the Fairmont treated us like we were trash from the street (despite the fact that I was dressed in a suit--not that that should matter). Since we were so early to check in, I can only conclude that we were singled out to be booted from the hotel because we booked through Expedia, but if the hotel intended to refuse us service, why didn't the hotel have the common courtesy to let me know in advance so that I could make other arrangements? And why did your manager lie to us about the second hotel? Incidentally, while the Fairmont manager told us that all hotel expenses--including parking--would be paid by the Fairmont, we were in fact stuck with the parking bill of $52 at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: pasdad
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Visitor0510
Reviews.Content: We had a great room at the Fairmont. I loved the vanity area outside of the bathroom. The bathroom was large and had a large tub and separate shower stall, and a separate water closet. The view of the lake out of our window was beautiful. The bedding was very nice and comfortable. My husband arrived at 9 am and was given an available room immediately, which is a courtesy not always extended. I loved the look of the lobby too. All in all, a very upscale hotel, and we greatly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Love the fairmount chain”
Reviews.Author: WWHITE1967
Reviews.Content: Refreshing. Excellent executive lounge and again a superb gym. Love their presidents club where they provide sporting kit. Wonderful touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIMD
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice downtown 4-star hotel but nothing special. The lobby is sort of an odd mix of classic and new age/modern decor. My room was nice with a relatively small but newly renovated bathroom. The service was excellent. The hallways were pretty worn with old paint and carpet. The location is good. Five minute walk to Millennium Park or the "Magnificent Mile". When I am in Chicago again, I will consider staying here but there are several good hotel choices available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: tastytaster
Reviews.Content: After Christmas me and my sister got a surprise trip to Chicago at the Fairmont it was fabulous!!! Our room was almost at the the top floor and we got a beautiful view of the park below and it is conveniently a 15 minute walk to a deep dish pizza parlor.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in a suite”
Reviews.Author: vliou
Reviews.Content: All the suites in this hotel are right next to elevators - which means when they whoosh up and down in the tunnels, you hear it in your room. About once every 2 minutes, you get the whooshing sound. After I requested to be moved to a higher floor, the AC doesn't work. What a terribly stay experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: corklevy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location - it is a short walk across the Chicago River bridge to the Magnificent Mile, Gold Coast, etc, but is still far enough away that you won't be swamped by those crazy crowds. It is also very close to Millennium Park (duh), the Art Institute of Chicago, and the EL trains. There are always taxis outside. My husband was traveling for a conference and I stayed in the room with him. It was not a great rate - $239/night - for what we got. The rooms were fine, but a little cramped. The beds were not comfortable. The toilets in the bathroom had no tanks; instead, they were like public toilets. Suggestion: If you plan to stay here, sign up for the Fairmont President's Club beforehand (it is free). You'll get free wireless internet (otherwise it is $14.95/24 hrs) and we even got a free drink/sushi rolls, and a $25 gift certificate at Aria Bar, just because we were President's Club members.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisSaint
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont for two nights in March and we enjoyed our visit so much we returned again in April. The location is perfect, close to the action but removed enough from the craziness of Michigan Avenue. The hotel is well appointed and decorated, very clean, and comfortable. The staff is incredible! From our arrival the parking attendants & door men were very pleasant and accommodating. One of the parking attendant's called me by name every time we passed over a three day period. Made us feel special that he remembered us and greeted us by name. Front desk staff, housekeeprs, and room service personnel were all very helpful and most friendly. We will definately return as this hotel and staff make our little getaways from the kids very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amymow
Reviews.Content: When my husband handed me the list of hotels we could stay at for his upcoming conference, pickings were boring standard and then I checked the Fairmont. For starters it goes above and beyond the other hotels in its offering of aesthetic appeal. And if that's your thing, different, hip, pleasing, then stay here. From the fascinating check-in area (waterfall lights that sparkle in the wall and across the floor) to the wine bar in the center of the lobby surrounded by what look like gold vines, to the sharp vibe of the sushi bar and Aria - you know you're not in Kansas anymore. This is a step above the other 'chains' as it brings something more to the table. Rooms were modern, with a designer touch to them. I loved the canvas flower pictures above the beds. The bathroom was extremely spacious - biggest I've seen in a city in a while - a tub, a seperate toilet room, a seperate beautifully tiled shower with waterfall showerhead, all surrounding a large area with sink and ammenities from a London soap maker. Outside the bathroom is a great vanity area with large mirror, a close up mirror and bench seat that will make any woman feel like she's got her own space. Our view was nothing to write home about, but the room was so pleasant I didn't mind. Housekeeping was very good. There is a great coffee machine in room under the tv with single serve coffee capsules - it made delicious coffee. There is everything you need for in room beverages, wine glasses, wine opener, ice bucket - and if you don't want to tap into the expensive mini bar there is a CVS across the street from the hotel that sells everything from wine to beer to spirits - how convenient! I liked the location of this hotel - it is in a quiet area, which too me was a good thing. If you walk out the lobby/hotel, go right and cross through the AON walk thru and keep going you will easily reach public transportation, both L, subway and buses. Very convenient! I found the staff to be very friendly, anytime I saw an employee in the hall or in the elevator they were extremely kind. We did not eat in the hotel I am sorry to say, our 4 year old was with us, and unfortunately, none of the venues seemed appropriate for her! However, I am so glad we stayed here, I would stay again, it was just that pleasing. Every afternoon when I came back to the hotel I found myself smiling and saying 'I love this hotel'!.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience but a nice hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: sdfunnell
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Chicago Millennium Park is a beautiful hotel with updated renovated rooms. However, the retrofit of the bathroom (nice tiled stone stall shower, separate tub and separate toilet area) appears nice at first, but it eliminated the closet. What was left of the closet was so small, that there was not enough room to hang clothes for 2 people for 4 days. Also, the water pressure in the shower was practically nonexistent. The sink and tub both had sufficient water pressure, but the restrictors used in the shower head made it nearly impossible to rinse shampoo or conditioner from my hair. I ended up using the showers in the spa area...the pressure wasn't fantastic there either, but the showers there were equipped with a hand-held wand that made it easier to get the shampoo and conditioner rinsed. This wasn't really a problem as I used the fitness center each morning and the dressing room was well equipped and had lockers with electronic locks. As a President's Club member, one is not charged for the use of the fitness center. When we received our bill the morning of our last day, we had been charged for some (not all) of our visits to the fitness center. This required a trip to the front desk where the issue was promptly resolved. With the economy the way it is, you'd think people would show up to work on time. We wanted to enjoy a glass of wine at Eno, their wine bar, before going out to an early dinner. The bar was supposed to open at 4:00 pm. The server finally showed up around 4:25. And that was on a Friday. Also, Saturday morning, we went to the fitness center at 7:30 (opening time for the weekend) and waited (with about a dozen other people) for someone to show up to open the gym. After numerous calls to the concierge and front desk, we were finally told that their security can not enter that area as it is operated by an outside company. By 8:00, the manager of the front desk agreed to send us over to the Lakeshore Athletic Club (short walk indoors - fantastic facility) and would comp the entrance fees. All in all, this is a nice hotel in a good location. But I prefer the Swissotel, another Fairmont property in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Combination of Relaxation and Fun”
Reviews.Author: rockandtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the week of Christmas and must say that Fairmont provided both a relaxing and adventure filled vacation as the hotel is centrally located from all majour attractions but nested in a quiet area downtown which gives you a relaxing atmosphere. The staffs are attentive and helpful. The doormen always make you feel welcome and safe. There are taxis stationed right at the hotel 24/7. There is also a variety/drugstore just across the hotel. This hotel is five minutes from Millenium Park where you can go skating in the winter. Itâ€™s also nearby Loop and Magnificent Mile. Their standard king size room and separate shower and tub makes for a delightful stay in. There is no spectacular view from the room but rooms are always clean and very comfortable. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New modern hotel, lack welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: cultureseacher
Reviews.Content: Travelling around the USA in Nov/Dec, fairly newly refurbished hotel, nothing fancy but just newer. Doorman was nice but obviously vigorously working for tips ( as in rushing one taxi to get to the other and tossing the bags a little), Girls at the front desk polite but not the friendliest or knowledgeable about the area. great for business travellers though as you will be in and out in no time. Firstly we were given a fairly decent room but the bath tub run muddy water, Called the concierge where a technician arrived promptly, however after he couldnâ€™t fix the tub running grainy water his poor excuse was "who takes bath's these days?" FYI i do! have been walking around the states for 3 weeks, i need somewhere to relax in the freezing temperatures, I donâ€™t really need someone telling me how I should go about my days. After our complaint we were moved to a working bath(but smaller) room, however i didnâ€™t mind as we were there to sight see and not live in the hotel. Also do not have the breakfast at their in house restaurant. Crikey! $6 for an orange juicy? really? in America? come on! wasnâ€™t even listed in the menu and wasnâ€™t even refilled! The breakfast was so overpriced and ordinary. Prices excelled those in Sydney Shangri la! However, for business travellers this would be the better option. Comfortable beds, quiet rooms, clean enough bathrooms, always a taxi out front, prompt service, i would still recommend this hotel however wont be coming back. location was right around the corner from Mellenium park. 5-10minute walk to the loop. But $10 (incl. tip) taxi ride away from the main manificient mile.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmccusker
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel (once for business and once when visiting our son) and we like it a lot. The rooms are elegantly furnished with nice bathrooms. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the location is good. We definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: chibears12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! We stayed on the 36th out of 37 floors and had an amazing view of both millenium park and lake michigan. The location was great, right downtown and not that far away from great places to eat. The rooms were very modern and clean. Only a few downsides.. it was lacking a microwave and a table, however there was a desk. The only fridge was the mini bar, which was full. Also there were no vending machienes, there is a shop downstairs, but it has limited hours and its not very convient if your 36 floors up! The restaraunts at the hotel were too fancy for our taste, and wouldnt be child friendly. The beds werent the softest either. The staff was super friendly and helpful. They looked up information onine for us on attractions we wanted to see and gave us great advise. They got us a cab several times, which was nice since we are small town girls who couldnt hail a cab to save our lives! Over all I give this hotel a 8 out of 10. We will be coming back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A Shaky Stay on New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: SusieBaker_9
Reviews.Content: Living near Chicago, we decided to stay overnight in the city for New Years Eve. I received an email about specials at the Fairmont for $149 which prompted me to stay there. Thinking the Fairmont is usually a good option, we opted for it. The best part of our experience were the valets. They were awesome - extremely friendly. The worst part of our stay were the REALLY drunk guests and the elevator that shook and stopped for a full 5 minutes. It was really frightening. Also, a big minus - there weren't any Water Vending machines and no $5 water bottle option in the room. Which prompted me to go down to the bar of the restaurant, Aria, to buy a bottle of water. After the server returned with a 15 oz bottle of water, she promptly told me it was $15 - that is $1 per ounce. I walked out. I don't think I will be staying at the Fairmont Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: owens31187
Reviews.Content: we had a standard king room and it was pretty big. Very nice decor. i loved that it came with a beverage center which had two cocktail glasses, an ice bucket and some swizzel sticks. the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zuoz
Reviews.Content: Very good business hotel, good location and perfect service - I was lucky enough to book gold floor. On the gold floor everyting was perfect - really five star service. Also not too expensive. Location is also very convenient and after meetings I visited some shops near hotel. Generally , great hotel and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “a factory”
Reviews.Author: whenucan-travel
Reviews.Content: Not the place to stay unless your there for a large convention. Not in a good location for a brand-name hotel. Have to take a cab everywhere. Rooms are utilitarian. The main ingredient in a successful trip with younger kids is access to a pool. Although I made what I thought was a thorough enquiry into confirming there was a pool for kids; there really is not. The Lakeshore Athletic Club has one but does not allow kids in there during the week. You can walk underground for a few blocks and access the Swissotelâ€™s pool but it is a major bother. Both pools carry a $25+ access fee per person. Housekeeping is good. Place is like a factory albeit a well run one.

Reviews.Title: “An OK place to stay in Chicago.....”
Reviews.Author: sklnurse2
Reviews.Content: My husband was here for a conference, so my teenage daughter and I joined him for a long weekend. Our room was comfortable- the sleeping area and bathroom area were seperated by a hallway- that made it nice for whoever gets up early not to disturb the sleeping occupants quite so much. I'm not sure how all the rooms are configured, but i really liked ours. Nice touch- digital thermostat to control the temp. Concierge staff was helpful. Likewise the front desk. My only complaint was the restaurant, Aria. My daughter and I visited their breakfast buffet on a Friday morning. There were no plates in the buffet line and it didn't appear anyone was paying attention to refilling items that had been eaten. I asked an attendant, who said they were "washing the plates", waited about 10 minutes, and went back only to find- still no plates. I asked our waiter, who then asked someone else.... Really??? A restaurant with no clean plates??? For the price ($26), I expected a nice buffet with lots of choices and someone refilling the pans of food and bowls of cream cheese for my bagel. Definitely a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Service stunk in Lobby. Beauty and no brains in Lobby personnel concierge missing in action”
Reviews.Author: Michaelg12320
Reviews.Content: New Location was a problem. Went with two friends of which one was a President's Platinum Club Member. Concierge was unavailable for the first day and a 1/2.Almost went to Carson's Ribs on North Wells which was being renovated thanks to the fake concierge/ check-in at the Front Desk.When I appeared for the third time at the front desk since Concierge staff was at a Concierge convention. "Wait I see they are closed for renovation; no wonder why there is no answer. Public space is beautiful and elegant. Minature brownies and small cupcakes were dry and stale and uncovered in the room.The carpet is ugly. The room was dimly lit for packing. Hotel was decorated by Lilly Munsters decorator with the exception of dining room chairs. Bathroom was magnificent. Masking tape on wall. Desk made out of thin cheap wood. Could not identify stained coach which was cheap with an ocean wavy old mattress.Wet bar nice but useless. I loved the brown hospital curtains. Housekeeping was wonderful and polite.Wanted to prepay my third and desk people could not add two and two. To pay full price what a rip-off. Location not like others right off Michigan certainly not.Given used condiment jars in dining room for breakfast. French Toast given fast dip.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: DrTToronto
Reviews.Content: As a Fairmont President's Club member, I've stayed at a number of different Fairmont properties in North America, and this one was by far my favourite. Definitely more contemporary than what you'd expect (when I think Fairmont, I think Victorian architecture), but the same level of service you expect with the Fairmont brand. Had a basic room category which was spacious with a gorgeous bathroom. The lobby area is really nice, with a wine, cheese and chocolate bar alongside a sushi resto and a more traditional restaurant. Location is steps from Millenium Park and just a couple minutes walk from the south end of Magnificent Mile. The concierge staff are great, and will give you their business cards so you can skip the line at the restaurants they suggest...very helpful if you're there on a busy weekend! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Bringing_the_kids
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Millenium park Fairmont and were very pleased with the experience. The room was very nice with great views of the city and lake and the room service dining was FANTASTIC, probably the best in-room dinner we have ever had. The bathroom also looked new and nice, but the shower was a big disappointment - it almost felt like I was trying to rinse my hair standing under the rain - no water pressure whatsoever. I wonder if this would be better on lower floors... The location of the hotel is quite convenient, within walking distance of the magnificent mile, but not quite as busy and also close to the park. My only real complaint about this place was the price of the parking - it's outrageous. Nobody expects free parking anymore, but what this hotel charges is ridiculous. We ended up parking in a public lot across the street for half the price, and it turned out to be more convenient too, as we didn't have to spend hours standing in front of the hotel waiting for the car.... I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- wonderful views and luxury unique to this hotelier”
Reviews.Author: MissyR72
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! The location was wonderful- right near the park, central to the city and right off of the river front. The staff were friendly, the spa was amazing, and the beds were divine. I would've liked to have a regular coffee maker in the room, but the espresso machine was a nice change. We ate at Aria as well- it was definitely well run and the cocktail menu was divine. Chicago is a great city and staying at the Fairmont just made it that much more memorable. Just watch out for the cost of valet parking ($50/night- ouch)!

Reviews.Title: “Explanation as to uneven reviews.....”
Reviews.Author: NomadicNina
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 business stay nights at this hotel, upgrqaded to luxurious suite on Gold Floor, for extra $80, and as a very frequent traveler (100 hotel nights per year), I can understand why the reviews are all over the map. If you are used to a Hyatt or a Westin as the best type of hotels, then you will find this place great. It certainly has many pluses. The lobby is quiet (even tho the Jetson decor is not my thing), the restaurant is excellent (ricotta gnochi delectable), the view from the rooms is FANTASTIC!, the bed is very comfortable, elevator is the fastest, the Gold Floor lounge terrific, the front desk good. But if you are a Four Seasons fan, then this place is merely good. And here is why. No room service before 6am, which means if you want fresh hot coffee with MILK (not the packaged creamer left in your room,) you are out of luck. And the guy who informed of this at 5am, just told me to wait another hour. At the Ritz, someone would have come up to brew it for me! The maid service was mediocre, as evidenced by the empty Starbucks cup, with straw, that sat on the counter for two days. The furnishings are ugly: cheapo looking---1970s crap, as in veener desk, strange chairs. The rooms felt tired, hungry for updating. Also, having just stayed at the superb Fairmont Pac Rim in Vancouver, with its amazing service, I was shocked by the skimpy bathrooms provisions. When is the last time you did not have a box of tissues in the bathroom?! I depend on 24 hour room service as a travelling woman, so it is unlikely that I would stay here again. If you have enjoyed the Sofitel or Four Seasons near Michigan Ave, go back there. However, if you are choosing between a Marriot and here, then this place wil make you happy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: AnnieLSantaFe
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago for a long weekend in October. The location is excellent - very near Michigan Avenue and within walking distance of the Chicago Art Institute. And all the other major attractions in Chicago, for that matter. But (and this is very important), it was an oasis of quiet and calm in just a block from all the activity that defines this most amazing city. The experience - from arrival to departure - was just great. Check-in quick, doormen efficient and choreograph the comings and goings of cars and taxis beautifully. Fun to watch them. The highlight, staff-wise, was definitely the concierge, Tim; he is the best we have ever encountered. The lobby bar Oenophile, or Eno, has a great selection of wines - by the bottle or by the glass, and we were able to take a bottle to our room to enjoy. The view was great - we were on the 20th floor, looking over Soldier's Field, the stadium and the Field Museum. The room was large and beautifully appointed. Large flat screen TV and an excellent Help Desk when we had a temporary WiFi problem when we first arrived. Vanity outside the bathroom had great lighting and a large closet. Bathroom had separate bath and shower and was quite large. We ate out most of the time in our travels around Chicago but had breakfast in their restaurant one morning. Really v. good. Bountiful buffet. They simply did everything right. Hoping to return soon. Bed a bit soft for our taste, but that is just personal preference. Suspect most would like it. Bedding luxurious w/ wonderful, cozy duvet.

Reviews.Title: “excellent business accomodation”
Reviews.Author: londoncal
Reviews.Content: excellent business facilities and terrific location for non-business travel partners - close to millennium park and magnificent mile

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony2003
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to shopping, the Millennium Park and the Navy Pier but also easy to get around for business. I travel to Chicago for business several times a year. Fairmont Chicago is one of the hotels that I would choose to stay there. The beds and pillows were soft and comfortable. Decor in the rooms was modern. Service at front desk and concierge was attentive. Easy check-in and check-out. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i can't believe i paid so much for so little.”
Reviews.Author: asatwice
Reviews.Content: overpriced (i paid $320.00 a night), worn out carpet and mattress, uncomfortable, absurdly priced parking ($51.00 per day), no free internet ($15.64 a day), no free exercise room, bare minimum accessories in room, and a toilet that would be more at home in a high-volume truck stop than in an alleged luxury hotel. after eight nights at the fairmont, i can honestly say i gave it a shot--and it consistently disappointed. i will not be returning--there are dozens of better options--and there is no way this place should garner 4-stars.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: adsdadUsa
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and nice people. the staff was very attentive. only problem was Bed Bugs!. i was itching every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mosie44
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is luxurious, the staff is friendly, and the location is great. Our corner room had a view of Lake Michigan and the city. We would definitely stay in this hotel again. The room was very clean, comfortable and roomy, with a desk, a built in couch, lots of room for luggage and all those extra bags that are accumulated during a stay. The bathroom was nearly as large as the bedroom and the amenities were very nice. Walking distance of many attractions as well as the 'hop-on, hop-off' buses which are a great way to see the city. A great place to stay in a great city to visit. *I noted that pets under 20 pounds are allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: swimbikerun_10
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what some of the previous negative reviews were all about - I had a really great stay while staying at the Fairmont Millennium Park in Chicago over the Columbus Day weekend and running the Chicago marathon. The hotel is in a great location - just steps from Michigan Avenue (Miracle Mile) and a few blocks from Millennium Park/Grant Park. Hotel staff were all extremely courteous and friendly from check-in to check-out. Concierge (Haley was her name) was great with restaurant recommendations during busy marathon weekend. Hotel lobby has a trendy feel and the check in desk is interesting with a unique light display on the wall and in the floor. I stayed in a "Pure" room on the 17th which had organic bedding/mattress/pillows and an air purifier. Room had a good view of the city and of Navy Pier. Bathroom was large and luxurious, although a bigger shower could have been a nice touch but the rainfall showerhead was great! My one and only complaint was that the pillows were a bit too firm for my liking. I was also disappointed when loggin in to use the internet on my laptop that there was a $15 charge, but when I received my bill to check out, I was not charged for this (nice surprise). Overall I had a great stay here and would definitely recommend it to other travelers. If I return to Chicago I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: casjumbo
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get some excellent rates for 3 nights here through friends, to finish off our 1 month trip to the USA. Location is perfect, staff were really friendly (especially Maria in housekeeping on the 35th floor, she gave me a big hug goodbye :) ). We weren't advised of any gym or fitness facilities and would have like a swim during our stay, apparently they have access to a gym and pool nearby. The room was spacious (not huge), great views of the 'corn cobs' (exciting for our first trip to Chicago), really comfy bed, gorgeous bathroom, great nescaffe coffee machines in the rooms. The restaurant looked lovely but with a conference in the hotel, that and the bar were crowded and noisy so we ate 10 mins walk away instead. Overall, a great stay and would stay there again. Join the President's Club... it's free to join and the wifi is then free, as well as express checkins etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, great location, fantastic rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: acurrie27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Chicago for two nights, Oct 1-3. I can't comment too much on value for money since I paid a fantastic travel agent rate, but the room was wonderful - great bed, I literally could not make the mattress move enough to disturb my husband when I wanted to (he snores a little bit and I can usually get him to stop just by rolling over - the moving springs disturbs him enough to stop). Service was great, we requested a late check-out and they gave it to us (keep in mind this would always be subject to availability of course) and were very helpful when we asked for suggestions on places to eat, etc. The location is great - less than a block north of Millennium Park. Tip - if you're staying at any Fairmont property, join the President's Club. It's free and you get priority check-in, free internet, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & highly overated”
Reviews.Author: SisterPurple1708
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good, but my expectations were much higher, so to be honest I was disappointed. The bed wasn't that comfortable, the TV took a long time to load and the dressing gowns in the bathroom were as hard as can be - so you didn't want to wear them!!. The reception staff weren't that friendly, however the door men were. At night, the wind was whistling thru the windows which was so annoying and you could hear noises from other rooms. It was a good location, but I would have preferred to be on the other side near Michigan Avenue. I am all for paying good money for a great hotel but in my opinion I think this was a highly overrated hotel and there would be better hotels for less price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: candj39
Reviews.Content: I don't get the negative reviews. Everything about this hotel was simply lovely. It is elegant, comfortable, well-located and super first class. Fabulous bathrooms. Comfortable beds. Clean. Attentive service, from the doormen to the housekeeping staff. Everything you need is already in the room. A terrifice experience all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: indofranco
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this website I thought this hotel would be just what my husband and I were looking for for a relaxing weekend in Chicago. This was not the case. The hotel was ostentatious and loud. The room we stayed in was very mediocre. It looked old. The lobby was always loud. If you want more of a "party" atmosphere, then this is your hotel. The Swissotel is a much better hotel and is also very conveniently located. It is quieter and the room was so much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
