Reviews.Author: WpgFoodie101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent if you want to be close to the action of downtown Chicago. Within a 20 minute walk in any direction there is so much to do. The hotel itself is huge. Rooms are beautiful and new. Rooms are spacious, comfortable beds, large flat screen tvs, ipod dock and a beautiful view of the city. Hotel has a restuarant, a sushi bar and a wine bar. We didn't get a chance to try any of them but they all looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrades incredible, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed at this property in five years. The upgrades are beautiful! The lobby is incredible, too. This hotel is not on Michigan Avenue but very close. It's a high rise and the views are nice. Our king size bed was extremly comfortable. The bathroom was large, the plasma tv was nice and there was even a couch, along with the desk/chair. Elevators were quick. Breakfast was excellent in the Aria? restaurant, costing about $21 for sausage, hashbrowns, bread and coffee. The next morning, I had a muffin and coffee in the lobby bar at a cost of less than $10. Make sure you tell them you are Fairmont Presidents Club member (if you are) so they will deduct the $15 per day internet charge off your bill. There are no hotel shuttles here, so you must either walk or take a taxi around downtown. I took an airport shuttle from O'Hare for $29. It's a little difficult to find this hotel if your driver doesn't know where it is...it's near the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: HAF820
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Millennium Park is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The rooms are updated in a modern yet classic style. The hotel is walking distance to shopping, navy pier, water taxis and Millennium Park. Despite being a large hotel it has great service and a comfortable feel. I usually stay on Mag Mile, closer to shopping; however with children you can not beat this location. There is a Starubucks, and other cafes in the lobby of the conncecting Aon Center.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: zonacatsfan
Reviews.Content: would highly recommend the Fairmont Millennium Park to anyone looking for a place to stay in Chitown. Beautiful facility, great location, great restaurants on the grounds. This will be my go to hotel when staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure through and through....”
Reviews.Author: BIGTDIDDY
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! This hotel is beautiful. That people compare this hotel to Hyatt or Hilton is a joke. Interestingly enough we stayed at the Hyatt right around the corner from this location for the first night of our trip....the Hyatt was filthy, beds were uncomfortable and even the prints on the wall in the room were falling out of the frame. Clearly Hyatt is going the way of many larger chains....and you wonder how they keep a 4 star rating. The Fairmont was a delight. The lobby was beautiful and the assistance we received was top-notch. We found the hotel quite by chance having booked on priceline. WE ONLY PAID $100.00 for our room. We got there and requested a king room. The only Kings available were on the club floor and ended up costing about $60. more. We were happy to pay the $60. We were so happy we did. The club level service was impeccable. Our room was beautiful.....large and decorated in a lovely mid-century furnishing. Walnut wood all over the place and tastefully done. The room was by far the CLEANEST hotel room I have ever stayed in. The Club Level offered us free appetizers throughout the day and a wonderful breakfast each morning. The food in the lounge was DELICIOUS. We have stayed on Club Level floors at other hotels and have been thoroughly unimpressed with the offerings. The experience at Fairmont was impeccable. Everything was AWESOME. We will stay again next time we are in Chicago...even at a much higher rate. WAY TO GO FAIRMONT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: AndrewSiemReap
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Chicago is one of the great hotels of the USA, and probably the world. The emphasis is upon cleanliness, comfort and efficiency, and I certainly could find no deficits during my recent week long stay. The premises is reasonable well located on the north side of Millennium Park, a short stroll from Navy Pier and about 15-20 walk from the main buzz of Michigan Avenue. From check in to departure, the staff are efficient, courteous and friendly, without being superficial and ingratiating. The conference facilities are absolutely world class, and the support staff seem to anticipate everything in advance to prevent the predictable and not so predictable issues that can thwart best laid plans. But for my money, the highlight was the room itself. Although it seemed reasonable conventional, within minutes of closing the door I realised that this place was different. As mentioned, the hotel seems fixated upon clean cleanliness, and have employed an array of measures to ensure that every room remains fresh, bright, well ventilated and alive, including hypoallergenic bedding, air purifiers in every room and hallway, windows that actually open, and so on. I cannot ever recall staying in a CBD hotel that felt - and actually was - so fresh. None of the congestion and dry eyes one expects, but rather a restful nights sleep in immaculate surrounds. I look forward to attending more conferences at the Fairmont Chicago and highly recommend the hotel to both travellers and conventioners alike. Spectacularly good!

Reviews.Title: “Poor reservation”
Reviews.Author: Nakara
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and requested two beds. When we arrived, the hotel overbooked and gave us a room with one king bed. My friend with a 16 months old baby was put in a smoking room! The front desk agent didn't even bother to inform him.

Reviews.Title: “where is the concierge?”
Reviews.Author: SirNK15
Reviews.Content: Although the room was very clean, ample and comfortable, and the location is also great, the concierge's desk was always empty. I stayed there for 3 nights and not once could I get a hold of him to get restaurant recommendations, etc. So if its your first time in Chicago and you need some pointers, avoid the Fairmont. Otherwise, everything went well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: warmsonoma
Reviews.Content: While a big hotel, rooms were easy and fast to get into. Great concierge and parking valets and restaurant staff experiences. Busy hotel. Location next to river, next to lake. Walking distance to: Navy Pier, Northwestern U, Magnificent Mile. 5 min walk to Metra train to catch 5 min ride to Shedd Aquarium and Planetarium and Soldier Field. Costs $51 to park a car daily--couldn't find any better or other options.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, nice room, A/C couldn't keep up”
Reviews.Author: AFamilyOfFive
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is magnificent, very convenient to Millenium Park and to the waterfront. You can walk everywhere from here or take mass transit which stops quite nearby. Our only quibble was that the room was humid and warm - the A/C ran nonstop but couldn't keep up. The weather outside was 90 degrees.

Reviews.Title: “Don't need to look any further.”
Reviews.Author: thunt52
Reviews.Content: We found the service and rooms at Fairmont to be ideal for our travel. The rooms were light, airy, spacious and clean. We were in a king deluxe view room. It had an excellent view of park and lake. The front desk and valet service was extraordinary. And the location was perfectly situated between the river and the Millenium/Grant Parks. If you are interested in a hotel with a loud and crowded lounge/bar similar to Hyatt or Trump, this wouldn't be your choice. Fairmont is a bit more intimate, sophisticated but not pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: nphummel
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. The lobby is refreshing, roomy, traditional-modern, and almost organic feeling. Our room was a standard room, but it was quite large with hallways detaching the bedroom from the bathroom from the door. There was a big vanity area that I sincerely appreciated. Large, luxurious and clean bathroom. Big flat screen TV. Bed was just ok and the sheets sucked. Took the sheets off and just used the down comforter. Slept just peachy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection Personified”
Reviews.Author: travelpal28411
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Fairmont during our trip to Chicago made it even more wonderful! I am a huge fan of the Fairmont hotel group and almost did not stay in this one due to the reviews of others. I was worried about service and location, and I have to say that I am glad that I stayed here. Service was excellent---from the valet to checkout. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite for an extra $39 and it was fabulous! (I highly recommend the upgrade if you get that option.) We had incredibe views of the city from both rooms, could see the Navy Pier and even watched the fireworks on July 4th from our bed with room service! How's that for beating the crowds? You will walk alot in Chicago to see everything, or you can just take a taxi. I thought this hotel was a perfect location, especially to Navy Pier and the Chicago Riverwalk. We also walked to The Mag Mile and to dinner. The suite was fantastic and had everything that you could need! The bed, as always, was incredibly comfortable. The only thing that was substandard was the water pressure in the shower, but we did not let this distract us from an awesome stay. The suite also had a large tub for bathing, as well. The lobby was beautiful and the Concierge (Tim) was excellent. We booked 2 tours with him (the Architectural Boat Tour & a bus tour that he recommended). --When we returned to our room that night, Tim had sent us complimentary local beer and popcorn, which was very unexpected and such a nice gesture! There is also a gift shop located in the hotel, with snacks, water, toiletries and gifts. This was a helpful stop for us, as well. I wish we would have known it was here instead of waiting in a long line at the CVS across the street. In summary, this was an excellent stay with no complaints! We will return to this hotel on our next stay to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Chcago”
Reviews.Author: KCaporale
Reviews.Content: An amazing City, an EXCELLENT Hotel. Upgrade to the Gold level. will look for a Fairmont in any city we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great in Spite of Poor Reservation Service”
Reviews.Author: dwsact
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be ideal for our reunion of family members from three states. It is immaculately clean, tastefully decorated, and has good views of the Millennium Park from the less expensive non-lakeview side. We could also see the fireworks from Navy Pier. We had three king bed rooms and one suite which was ideally suited for night-time gatherings to play word games. Service at the conceirge desk was excellent no matter who was there. Our only significant complaint is that the hotel did not assign us a suite with two double beds as was shown on our confirmation order nor did it have in the suite a roll-a-way bed as had also been ordered. Our three grandchildren are not complainers which was why we did not learn of this mistake until our third day. In the meantime, two of them were sleeping in the king-sized bed and the third was sleeping without a pillow or bedding on the sofa in the living room. When this was called to the attention of the reservations desk they sent up a roll-a-way with bedding and removed the $20 charge for it. The desk clerk was very polite but had to check with his manager (behind the scenes) before making this adjustment. I think they owed us a bit more than this considering the care I had taken to get the reservation correctly recorded and the promise I had made to our grandchildren that each of them would have his or her own bed. Two other comments are minor: (1) we were not told at check-in that a less expensive breakfast than what was provided in the restaurant was available in the lobby and (2) signage to help one find the business center was lacking. Still, we very much enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont and would stay there again. I would just double-check to be sure the rooms assigned to us were exactly those that had been requested and confirmed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nevis1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 3 nights and had a 12th floor corner room. The room was large, clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful, especially the concierge. It was within walking distance of many sites. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: inja48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated within easy walking distance of great shops, theatres and restaurants. The room I enjoyed was spacious and very comfortable, overlooking the park and lake. It's a pity that there appeared to be no lounge areas other than the lobby for public seating/meeting. the hotel was full during my stay and so the room was not serviced until late on the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible shower”
Reviews.Author: FoodieScottsdale
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, but nicely appointed and comfortable. The "only" problem was the shower. There was absolutely no water pressure. We complained the first day and maintenance supposedly checked it out, but it didn't do any good. I think the showers are designed to conserve water. It took me forever to wash my hair because there was so little water trickling out. This is a dealbreaker for me. How can you enjoy your hotel if the shower is so disfunctional?

Reviews.Title: “Moved our rooms to another hotel without telling us”
Reviews.Author: kayjaypee
Reviews.Content: Facts: - booked 2 rooms for a June stay through Expedia - i had to cancel one room, so i called the Fairmont. the reservation associate said that both rooms were cancelled. i said that was impossible and decided to call back the next day to get someone else on the line. - called the next day, and i got the same response from someone else - i called expedia. expedia put me on hold for 15 minutes while they talked to the Fairmont. when the agent got back on the line, i was told that the two rooms were moved to the Intercontinental due to overbooking at the Fairmont. the Fairmont did not have a new confirmation number, the rate, or the room type that we would have at the new hotel - it took me 2 days to get someone from group sales at the Intercontinental to make the edits to my reservation (because these rooms were marked a "special case," i had to speak to someone in sales) If i did not call to make the change to the reservation, i would never have known about the move. my colleague and i would have gotten to the front desk to check in at 11pm and i can almost guarantee the person at the front desk would tell us that we did not have a reservation for the stay and would not have any idea about the "room move" to the intercontinental. i basically travel for a living. i have never seen such reckless unprofessionalism from a branded hotel like the Fairmont. fair to say that they have lost my business.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Cheaper and Had Better Serivice”
Reviews.Author: newoods
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a birthday get away and to be pampered just a bit. The problems started with checking in. When we got there they promptly asked for a credit card to put a security deposit on the room. Stupid me I give them one and it promptly doesn't go through. I asked how much she was trying to put on the card and she says $800. Stunned I tell the desk clerk but its only a $400+ bill for the weekend. Wrong they had the wrong rates in the computer, thank goodness we had our confirmation from their website because they had pushed the price up from $139 a night to $169. We got that straightened out and I can say that we were pleased with our room. Because of the location of the hotel we had to catch a cab everywhere. Not a big deal, but that does add up. The doormen were GREAT. They did a much better job of taking care of our needs and all they did was called for a taxi each time we left and gave them the address of where we were going. We had massages down at the spa. It was an OK spa, but nothing to write home about. They had no whirlpool and the sauna was over heated. Again, I've paid much less for services and they were much better than what the Fairmont had to offer. Our real trouble started when it was time to check out. I gave them more than half of the bill in cash. I wanted to put the rest on a Visa gift card I had received. They couldn't get the card to work. They at first thought it was their system, but their IT person was no where to be found. I was then told that they would send me an email and we could take care of the balance in a day or two, but they would not put the balance on my best friends charge card. Well two days letter she calls me smoking hot because they had put the balance on her card. It took one whole day for me to get them straightened out. They never were able to use the Visa gift card. They then proceeded to act as if they were doing me a big favor by reversing my friends credit card charges and sending me a fax to show that the charges had indeed been reversed. I sent a message to their customer service, and I have had no response. I will be writing to corporate. Oh and the business man that was there with a group of 60 mentioned breakfast. That was horrible and over priced. $22 gets you 2 eggs, 3 cold silver dollar pancakes, 2 dried up sausage links and a handful of greasy under cooked hashbrowns.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: mlissa27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Millenium Park for 1 evening, and it was pretty nice. All of the staff were very helpful, especially the bellhops and front desk. We asked for extra pillows, and they arrived very quickly to our room. The bed for me was very uncomfortable (it was way too soft) and the room was hot even though the thermostat was set cool. Parking was very expensive ($51 for overnight parking). The bathroom was very nice, and we had a great view from the 31st floor of the city. Overall, the hotel was nice. I think next time, we may stay right on Michigan Ave, as everything we wanted to do was quite a walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, but be prepared to be nickeled and dimed at every turn...”
Reviews.Author: mcolvard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference for work, and decided to stay a few extra days to see the sights. The reception area is beautiful, but from the beginning it was clear that this is one of those hotels that tries to sneak extra fees into absolutely everything that they can. We rented a car, and parking costs $51. You have only valet as an option. Wireless internet? over $15/day... their business center was like $5 a minute (and don't even ask how much to print something. Want to work out at their fitness center? Sure, for a "nominal fee"... and on and on... Absolutely ridiculous... I will say that the wait staff, valet, and bellhops were very helpful (just wonderful), although the concierge wasn't the most helpful. In summary, if you are staying for business reasons, then sure, go for it (especially if you don't have a choice, like I didn't). But I would never come back to this hotel for a leisure trip, and I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone who is staying at their own expense... unless they don't care how much money they drop. To me, this hotel wasn't THAT nice for that sort of money - I've stayed in MUCH nicer, and not had all of those stupid fees to contend with!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this, the Gold Floor is Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Deckerjw
Reviews.Content: Madeline Cole and her staff on the Gold Floor make this hotel the one not to miss! Nothing is too much trouble and everything is no trouble at all for the gold Floor Stafff. Kudos for making our stay truly memorable

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bubbafb
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying at the Fairmont and it does not disappoint. The lobby is hip and elegant yet simple. There is a bar in the center with the check-in desks to the right and the elevators and restaurant to the left. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and extremely nice and comfortable. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom spacious with a separate toliet area, stand alone shower and large tub. There was a stray long hair in the shower that takes a star away from the cleanliness but that was the other issue in that regard. There is a large flat screen HD TV in the room and a great view from the 29th floor. The on-site restaurant, Aria, is great for Asian inspired cuisine and is very nice. We also ate at Rosebud on Rush (very good Italian) and the Hard Rock Cafe (exceptional service and good American bar food). The gym is in the spa area and was efficient with plenty of available, and working, machines. Overall, this is a great place when visiting Chicago. It is a block or so off of Michigan and then a few more blocks to the heart of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriend getaway”
Reviews.Author: mbeck_hokie
Reviews.Content: My friends and I returned to Chicago for a long weekend and decided to stay a little closer to the Magnificent Mile and after much debate chose the Fairmont due to their larger room size (3 of us in one room, we got a rollaway). The hotel was very nice, big lobby, great concierge and the room was nice and big with a little sitting area. The bathroom was also big with a rain shower (stand up shower, there was also a separate tub with no shower). The location was a little further out of the mix then I thought and not real close to the L train if you have luggage (take a cab to get back and forth to train). Last time we stayed at Hotel Indigo on the Gold Coast and loved it but we wanted to be closer to the shopping. Ironically we found ourselves spending more time in the Gold Coast (Urban Oasis spa and Bistro Zinc were repeat places we went to that we love) then we did on Mag Mile (the weather was rainy and in the 50's). Had a great dinner at Le Colonial and cocktails and tapas at The Purple Pig. We also took a great food tour via Chicago Food Planet Tour. Next time we'll probably try a different hotel, the Fairmont was nice and big but the location wasn't as convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl610
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of Fairmont Hotels and their Chicago property did not disappoint! The hotel has an impressive, large lobby with a coffee bar (day)/wine bar (night) in the center. It is modern without being cold or impersonal. Check-in was a breeze and service was very friendly. The room was fantastic - very large with a small seating area and a water view. Again, the style was very modern. Just a few complaints. The bed was a bit harder than I prefer, although I did sleep very well. The shower was a little weak, but I think this may have been intentional in order to conserve water. I sampled the bar at the hotel restaurant - Aria - and it was excellent. The sushi was some of the best I've had. Definitely not a typical hotel restaurant and very trendy. I also sampled room service for breakfast (pancakes) and it was good. The location of the hotel is really convenient being just a few miles from Michigan Avenue with lots of shopping nearby. I would definitely return to the Fairmont Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, there are much nicer hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: enjoythenow
Reviews.Content: They rave about their beds but the beds were average. On surface room seemed clean, however, dropped my pen behind nightstand and discovered at least an inch of dust. It appeared there had been repairs to something where they had to cut away part of the wall. The repair job was covered up with a wallpaper board over the hole but the board did not even completely cover hole. Impossible to have a decent shower or bath. EXTREME water saving devices on both the shower and tub provided basically a trickle of water. I was unable to get the shampoo out of my hair as pressure was so poor. Also be prepared to be nickled and dimed to death. There was even a $10 charge if you used the coffeemaker in the room, really! For room service they tack on a delivery charge and a 20% gratuity. Since the waiter does not stay to serve you how is he earning a gratuity. I have already been charged for him to deliver the food. The parking fees were outrageous at $51 a night but to add insult they charge a hotel patron the same fees as the general public. Upon packing to leave we realized that the dvd set my son had brought was missing. I reported the theft to the hotel. Had to file a report with security who promised me they would investigate and get back to me within 2 days. It has now been over two weeks. No follow up, no apology even given. We will never stay at this hotel again. We have been to Chicago many times and this is the worst hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Floor is a Must”
Reviews.Author: emceemk
Reviews.Content: On day two of five, my husband turned to me & said, "when we come to Chicago, this is _our_ hotel," as in, our song, our special little private secret. the service on the Gold Floor is worth every penny, from the private concierge to the breakfast buffet to the lounge, with its honor bar and beautiful views. Don't get me wrong, I like the Kimpton Hotels, but in terms of the level or service, the Fairmont is hard to beat. Love the Montreal Fairmont too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaanusB
Reviews.Content: We had Eastern coast trip last year and we stayed in different hotels. Fairmont was one who brings up good memories. As it was first stop in our trip it was great to make free skype calls to europe throgh free wifi. Staff was helpful, view was very beautiful and location was good. I deffinetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not memorable.”
Reviews.Author: randdmack
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and enjoyed a partial view of Millneum Park and the lake. Our room was very quiet and the furnishings comfortable. My wife had trouble staying warm in the room. Also, there were marble floors in the bathroom that were very cold, and there was no radiant heater. I appreciated the fact that the shower was separate from the bath-tub. Room service breakfast cost $37 for two eggs, bacon, hash browns, toast and coffee. We found breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made my Chicago experience perfect!”
Reviews.Author: GM33
Reviews.Content: You have a lot of options for hotels on or near Chicago's "Magnificent Mile", but if you get a good rate on this hotel do not hesitate to book it. I stayed here for a conference in March for 4 days. I had a deluxe room on the 21st floor with a great view. The room was bright and spacious with a nice bar area that was separate from the main living room area. The marble bathroom was spacious as well, and the shower was separate from the tub which I liked a lot. The service really stood out! Very friendly staff always greeted me with a smile and were extremely helpful. It was a wonderful experience after a long day to go back to this hotel. Everything just "clicked". There is a 10-minute walk from the Fairmont to the start of the main part of the "magnificent mile" which I didn't mind at all as I'm a walker, but for those who want to be in the middle of the action may want to consider a hotel right on N. Michigan Ave. However, I had friends who stayed at hotels on the mile and had to sleep with earplugs despite being high up because the traffic, and particularly the sirens from emergency vehicles which are constant, were definitely a drawback. No such problems at the Fairmont which was very quiet. This was my 2nd stay at this hotel and I'll keep going back. I won't consider another hotel in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Recent renovations are terrific!”
Reviews.Author: gabigoose
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve stayed at the Fairmont Chicago Millennium Park many times. We love it. Location is just great. If you plan to visit Grant Park, Millennium Park, the main museums, Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue...this is the place. This hotel oozes understated charm and sophistication. The recent lobby renovation is very contemporary and impressive...especially check in. I love the style of new rooms since the recent upgrade. Very impressive. During my last stay I was only in the hotel a brief period so I had little interaction with the staff. I can comment on the front desk agent at check in...she was wonderful. Warm, charming, and efficient. Great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “contemporary hotel with great staff in terrific location”
Reviews.Author: napervilletraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an early 20 year anniversary celebration and loved the place. We had had our reception here in the gold room and they were nice enough to upgrade us to a beautiful suite with lake and city views. There were also chocolate covered strawberries upon arrival in our suite.(nice touch) The room was very large(800-900sq ft) and clean. Turndown service included a misting of your pillows with either a eucalyptus or lavender scent and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was quite spacious. The shower came equipped with a rainfall shower and toiletries were very nice but I am unfamiliar with the brand. There was a vast collection of movies and the movie we had planned to watch at the theatre was playing on the TV.(crazy heart 13.99) That saved us a venture into the frigid cold. The Aria Bar was a nice area to lounge and have dessert and drinks. Service was a bit slow but the staff was very nice. We also had breakfast in the morning with wonderful service, nice reading material and an available brunch for 27 dollars a person. My only complaint was the parking which was 51 dollars overnight(ouch). We would like to return in the summer and walk around since the hotel is flanked by navy pier, millenium park and the river and wacker drive. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but location not great for walkers”
Reviews.Author: chriswin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of my birthday vacation - location is not the best if you are travelling by method other than car - it's a bit of a walk to the train and especially so in the cold of December. The lobby and rooms were quite elegant - I can't believe how big the room was they gave me! Staff were for the most part okay, excellent in the business center, but had some difficulty trying to connect with a concierge, The only restuarant I saw was a sushi place - not what I'm looking for when I dine out. I don't remember internet access being free so I will say it was not. For $67 a night through Priceline, a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “So Fancy!”
Reviews.Author: JenE2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful inside and out. It's really close to everything and I totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: DiraeG
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the view, the huge bathing area, full bar and turnback service, heavy hooded robes. I mean what should I had expect? Great time

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: Jaybird9520
Reviews.Content: was very nice. Great new spa. Great location. Loved the Bentley!

Reviews.Title: “super elegant”
Reviews.Author: romanasa
Reviews.Content: great service in general the staff was incredible great food and room service

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is going through hard times”
Reviews.Author: travelspye
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying here for my wedding in late September, and was surprised by the signs of hard times that were subtle, but affected me and my husband. For example, he got locked out of our room 2 times, once having to wait for 15 minutes in the hallway after going to the spa. The other time was when he was getting ready for our wedding ceremony, so that was stressful because he lost some time. The keycard just would stop working. Then a fuse blew, so we had no power while trying to get ready. It happened to me also, coming back from the spa, and I called on the hallway phone to get help. Luckily, right after that, an employee who was randomly walking by asked me if I had been waiting long--as if she knew this was a problem. I said no, and she called down to check. Apparently, no one had even called Security to get me back into my room! She had a set of keys and let me in, thank god. Then, on our wedding night, my husband wanted to order from room service. It was a little after 10:30pm. We were told that room service was closed for the night--even though all the literature in the room brags about "24 hour dining." That fact was never communicated to us when we checked in. I feel like the quality of service and amenities are slipping. We later heard something about a lot of employees getting laid off, so maybe that's why people weren't too intersted in providing good service. I don't think if I would recommend that anyone stay at this Fairmont nor will I ever again. BTW, the spa is great to hang out in, even if you're not doing a massage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: raindrops4evr06
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel- it was in a great location near Millennium Park. We were in walking distance to several wonderful restaurants, Navy Pier, the museums, and several other sites! The hotel was nice and roomy and had wonderful amenities. Also, the concierges were extremely helpful and provided us with some wonderful directions and suggestions for restaurants. I look forward to coming back to this hotel someday!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kell113
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early November for a girlfriend trip! Booked a suite and had incredible views. I don't think the beds are as comfortable as Westins..etc. Check in was fast and easy. I found ALL the staff to be super friendly! We were on the 21st floor...two bedded suite with a nice bathroom. Our room was quiet. I used the Fairmont Fit program and enjoyed that. I wouldn't recommend the Aveda kit....not worth the $10 they charge. DIning. We dined outside the hotel. We luved the Chicago Chop House. Huge portions and we brought our own wine from California...$20 corkage fee. Mike Ditka's had a great fall menu...very busy restaurant. Won't go back to Restaurant on the 95th at Sears Tower....not that great of food. LOVED the brunch at David Burke's. $35 and a 2 1/2 hour meal! Amazing and fun! We had a tour of the meat locker and that was interesting. Went to the Redhead piano bar. Go early to sit at piano. VERY busy after 8:30 PM. Saw a play down in the theater district. Had drinks at the Hard Rock Hotel....cucumber vodka drink....yummy! Took the Wendella river and lake cruise....$23. Very interesting and glad we did it. Next time will hit the Marshall Fields museum. Shopping is huge! BIggest hits were at Bloomies and Marshalls.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: LaurettaViaggia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont in Chicago. I got a great deal on Priceline so I was a little worried what the room would be like. It was beautiful and big. The hotel appears to have been recently renovated. I loved the shower which had one of those big rainfall shower heads. The neighborhood was also nice because it is near the Marshall Fields (now Macys?) and that shopping area. My room had an amazing view too. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kgmasterpiece
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful hotel, although desk staff not exactly the friendliest initially.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expect from a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: choptliva
Reviews.Content: Finished a 3-nighter at the Chicago Fairmont about a week ago. Overall, the experience was okay. Unless I need the stay credit, I don't think I'll stay at this hotel next time I go to Chicago. Drive-up: Taxi pulled up to the hotel. No doorman in sight. It was 3 pm. Perhaps all occupied with other guests. Don't know. Good thing I only had the one carry-on. Check-in: Line-up was not very long, but it took a while. No check-in packet was prepared ahead of time with my info, etc. on it. First time I experienced this at a Fairmont. Person was pleasant enough, though. Room: Used an upgrade coupon and supposed got an upgraded view room. Well, the view was still primarily the building next door, though I did catch a glimpse of the park. Furnishing looked fresh and new. Maybe a bit too "new," in the sense that it doesn't have the typical Fairmont flaire, but felt more like the normal upscale business hotel. Like perhaps a nicer version of a Westin. Pretty small room, though. Checked the floor map thing on the door, and it seemed to me that this FPC Plt was in one of the smaller rooms on the floor. Well, I was alone, so it's not that big a deal. But certainly the upgrade cert was wasted. Never was offered a further upgrade (not even for money), electronic or otherwise. Bathroom was good-sized. Surprisingly, not even mouthwash in the room. That's a first for me too. Housekeepers are friendly and nice. Coffeemaker is the Nespresso thing. Pretty cool. Large flat screen tv, probably too large, considering how small the room itself was. Closet was absolutely TINY. The Lobby Bar: Indifferent service. Very indifferent service. Breakfast at Aria's: Greeted with great apathy. But waiter was fine. Food was okay. Not great, but it's only pancakes and stuff. Never mind. I think I'd rather go to the Hyatt next door and pig out for the same price. Overall, not a bad experience. But really, there was a reason why I switched from a lot of business class hotel chains to Fairmont. The Chicago Fairmont would not justify such a switch in my mind. It's all about expectations, I suppose. Properties like San Francisco, Washington, heck, even the old Frontenacs and Chateau Lauriers, they have a certain character. This is greatly lacking in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Rice Paper Thin Walls-May be my last time at a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyNPrinceTravels
Reviews.Content: We have a tradition of visiting an American city every year that we haven't been to before. Last year, it was Washington D.C., which was AMAZING. This year, we picked Chicago, and it was a bit of a letdown. It did have a little to do with staying at the Fairmont. My inner voice said Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, but my little heart said give Fairmont another try since they have such a great loyalty program. The exterior of the hotel is very impressive, with it's tall buildings and amazing views of the lake and city. Location was a little inconvenient, so we did end up taking a lot of taxis, especially for dinner. About a 15 minute walk to Michigan Ave, where the shopping is truly to die for. Navy Pier about a 10 minute walk. Check-in was brusque, a bit too sterile. However, I'm glad to say that we were given a very high floor room (two floors from the top) with picturesque views and the elusive King bed. Toiletries were the Fairmont standard Miller Harris stuff, shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion. Bathroom huge, marble, walk in shower and separate tub. Comfortable bed and linens, overall very clean. Did call and ask about a DVD player for the room, and the charge was $150 for 4 days? That didn't sound right. Breakfast at Aria was fantastic, didn't order the buffet but did order off the menu and selection was great, price was cheaper than I've experienced. Our waitress at breakfast was for sure one of the sweetest people I've met on my travels, her name was Loli or something like that. She really brightened up our day. Went to quite a few famous places for dinner, not impressed with this "Foodie's City." Quite disliked Moto, dropped $600 and found the food to be different, even innovative but quality, presentation, taste was even downright hideous for some dishes, chef must have been heavy-handed with the salt this particular evening, anyway it just didn't live up to the hype. Ironic that Aria, the restaurant in the hotel, was even better for dinner. Service was good, food was excellent! Would recommend one dinner here early in your stay in case it should be repeated for lack of a better choice. One of my favorite things about staying at a Fairmont and if you are a President's Member, which is FREE by the way, is the complimentary use of the gym. Gyms at the Fairmont are typically huge, and connected to a spa. Which means you have access to a steam room, sauna, showers and great amenities. I spent most of my getting ready time here after a workout. Their gym is a little on the smaller side, with an aerobics/yoga room. Approximately 3 treadmills, 3 Precor machines, 4 bikes, a few weight lifting machines and a row of dumbbells. Not to worry, there was never more than 2-3 other people using at the same time as you throughout the day. The biggest complaint I have about this place are the room walls. There may as well not be any. Someone just shuffling above you, you can hear it. Toilet flushes in any room nearby, you hear it. The ice machine is down the hall, like all the way down the hall, and you hear it. Earplugs are a MUST if you stay here. However, those coveted earplugs would not have worked our last night at this Old Dame. Not 1, not 2, but THREE weddings on one night. Besides the obvious, what the heck? You would think they would put aside 1...maybe 2 floors for non-wedding guests. You know, so you can get a good night's rest. Regardless of everything, I would never come back to this hotel if I ever return to Chicago in this lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mikegol
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Good location. check in smooth, hotel lobby just right level of ambience. Rooms very large for Chicago, nice flat screen LG TV, shower and Bath. Great views of the Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Chris40008
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with this hotel. The staff seems hurried and unhelpful. Our room was not made up until after 5 PM despite several requests. The blower in the hallway blew freezing air, but the staff told us that there was nothing that could be done about it. The lobby is not inviting and there is no where comfortable to sit. The room and bed was comfortable, but the cream and and modern art work are not our style. The room lacked many of the amenities other hotels in this price range offer. Certainly not worth the rate compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dani25240
Reviews.Content: Great location - near Michigan right off Wacker. Concierge was AWESOME! Very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BrianfAppleton
Reviews.Content: Love the Fairmont. Luxury without the pretensiousness. Great rooms, Great restaurant called Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: USBrit08
Reviews.Content: I spent a Saturday night at the Fairmont with 3 other friends (mid/late-20s), and all 4 of us thoroughly enjoyed the stay. We had paid very cheap internet-only rates for each of our two rooms (which made it all the more enjoyable), but I suspect we would still have been happy if we had paid full price. The front desk were courteous and were happy to place us in adjoining rooms - each of which was well furnished with a large HD tv, couch, and elegant bathroom. My only minor complaint was the charge to use the internet, which I think is ridiculous for a 4-5* hotel (but seemingly most other hotels do this too). The staff at the hotel's sushi bar (where we had drinks but not food) were incredibly nice, as was the concierge who got us into priority seating at Ginos East Pizza. I would thoroughly recommend the Fairmont

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: anono99
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for one night, which was not enough time... The hotel parking was a little tricky for us to find, and we ended up at a self park next door which was a bit cheaper anyway. The decor has a sleek and more modern look. Every employee that we encountered was very friendly and helpful. Check in was fast, and they gave us a corner room on a high floor, which had really nice views: you could see a little bit of the river out one window, and the lake out the other side. The room was really very spacious for a downtown hotel. Good location, within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, HOB, the park. The only negative was that we could only get a room with 2 double beds, not a king. But, I was aware of that when I booked it, I was just hoping to get lucky when we checked in. I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend this hotel. We did not eat here this time, but I would like to come back and give Aria a try.

Reviews.Title: “Mod and Spacious - Great place to explore the city from”
Reviews.Author: kimndallas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful -- I loved the shimmery mod reception and our room which had a king sized bed and was really spacious with a seating area. Also, it looks as if the place has been recently redone. The bathroom was immaculate with a separate tub from the shower that was big enough for 2. I thought the location was really great. Definitely within walking distance to lots of major attractions. The concierge staff here is great! They booked us in at a very posh and romantic Italian restaurant with a call 2 days before I arrived and were ready with excellent tips and booking help throughout our stay. Only downside to our stay was with 4 weddings at the hotel and the jazz fest that weekend, the hallways were a bit noisier than I would have liked in the wee hours. I booked though a Priceline name your own price and was very pleased with the outcome. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed that this hotel failed to live up to brand expectations”
Reviews.Author: RoamingFromBoston
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby. Bellmen never held doors or offered luggage assistance. Wireless internet doesn't work unless close to the elevator. Pool listed as an amenity is offsite so very inconvenient and additional charge despite premium nightly rates.Room quality varied greatly in size, layout and view. Large by NY standards but small for any other city I've visited. Paid a premium for quality that wasn't delivered. Not all rooms have fabulous views. Onsite menu options extremely limited for longer stays although exceptional quality. Some staff exceptionally accommodating while others were rude.Late checkout request accommodated and location walking distance to Millenium Park was a nice benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, Nice Room, Poor Shower”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont Chicago for a 3-day wedding weekend trip. We had a deluxe room, which was only slightly nicer than the standard room our friends were in...nice view of Lake Michigan. We had recently signed up online (free) for FPC (Fairmont President's Club), which got us complimentary access to the fitness center / spa. The hotel and rooms are very nice, and the fitness center / locker rooms are gorgeous, but the biggest problem with the hotel are the showers, which to our understanding had been renovated in the last year. These are those rain shower head things that look pretty, and are probably pretty green friendly, but the pressure is just awful. I mean we are talking nearly impossible to get soap suds off of yourself. My solution in part was to use the fitness center showers, which were slightly better and had a handheld piece, but even these had mediocre pressure at best. Call me picky, but it is precisely the bathroom/shower that can differentiate a good hotel room from a not so good one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay...great location”
Reviews.Author: LS19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to get away for a night and we booked through Priceline. Great location convenient to Millennium Park and Navy Pier. I asked for a view of the park, and the friendly desk attendant advised that I would have to pay for an upgrade, but he'd see what he could do. He put us on the 31st floor with a lake view instead! Much better than my request indeed. The room was spotless, but with the minor irritation. The magnet that holds the shower door closed was missing, so the door was slightly ajar and a bit of water got on the floor. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great view from our room but a few blocks from everything!”
Reviews.Author: TORN1
Reviews.Content: Nice room, warm welcome, nice bed, huge bathroom and shower area, clean, great view of Millenium Park down to Buckingham Fountain, Shedd Aquarium, etc.... (SOuth facing). Not overly spectacular. Good room service one night at about 11pm because no restaurants in the area were serving food that late. We were in Chicago for my partners birthday and I told the attendant on the phone who sent up a piece of cake with our room service. Very nice gesture. The hotel is a few blocks from Michigan Ave and the river although it felt like a miles away from any happening area. Seemed more business than tourist although if it wasn't as warm out as it was it would have been easily walkable to most places. Next trip will stay at N. Michigan Ave although not because the hotel is lacking in anything in particular but rather location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location helpful staff, but a little shabby”
Reviews.Author: dec-ben
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and baby for a large meeting & conference. The conference facilities were good and that end of the trip was fine. We had a king room booked with a crib. On arrival we were given a double queen room, but they did change it for us when we pointed out the error. The hotel has had a recent refurbishment however there does seem to be quite a bit of wear and tear. This I think is due to not great housekeeping. The carpet in our room was dark brown with coloured stripes and it was not clean. It needed a good vacuuming. The bathroom was large with an over the bath shower but the bath itself had worn at the bottom and didn't look very clean. We managed to blow the circuit in the room a few times, by having the tv on while blowdrying our hair !! We had a nice view over the roof garden of the Aqua building and out to Lake Michigan beyond that. The concierge service was very good and we had dinner out twice in restaurants they recommended which were very good. The restaurant in the hotel "Aria" is grossly overpriced. Our meal for two with a glass of wine came to almost $200.It is mainly asian fusion style. Anyone in our very large group who ate there said the same. Apparently the restaurant that was there before the refurbishment of the hotel was much better according to the other delegates that I spoke with. There are better hotels in Chicago. I much preferred the Marriott on the mile and the four points by Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: pointless_parasite
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the Lollapalooza music festival in Grant park, for which it is well positioned. I was suprised to find that my room was available at 9:30am, which was extremely convenient. Still, the young man at reception was somewhat arrogant and lacking in manners. The room was very clean and tastefully fitted. The bed was perhaps the most comfortable I have encountered, and I had three excellent nights of sleep with no noise from other guests at all. The bathroom was also very nice and featured one of those large rainfall shower heads. The hotel is easy to find, being located right behind the AON centre (the huge white skyscraper which has a similar design to the old world trade centre in New York). So despite being called the 'Fairmont Chicago Millennium Park', the hotel does not directly border the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: travel09Ontario
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Concierge was very helpful and gave us great recommendations. Really enjoyed our room and it had a large luxorious bathroom. Close to all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as good as the Fairmont Lake Louise, but still a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: London_UKNeil
Reviews.Content: We had a 3-day special for a suite, with was good for us with 2 toddlers to run around in. I've never been to Chicago before but I'm not sure it's a 5-star hotel, more of a good 4-star. Nevertheless the room was comfortable, large (suite) and what you'd expect from a quality brand. The bed was very comfy, we had two LCD TV's, one in the bedroom one in the lounge. Breakfasts were good (not included in package) but not as good as the Omni in San Francisco! The restaurant was quiet for breakfast probably due to the hotel's mainly business clients, and the front desk staff are a bit humourless at times - don't blame them! The Bell staff were very helpful though with our 12 tonnes of kiddy luggage! Two negatives now:- first the tap in the bathroom went dry and then sludge came out on our last morning - the hotel claimed that this was due to external factors beyond there control, but then again didn't feel it necessary to warn people. Luckily we had a second tap in the lounge, but other guests from normal sized rooms complained a lot and got upgraded. The A/C also switched off unexpectedly on our last morning - again ok for us as we were leaving anyway but others were annoyed. Second complaint - as we were heading off to the airport we were advised that we couldn't book a large taxi for all our stuff (very odd claim I thought), and one could simply be flagged down. Of course when it came to it, it took much longer than expected and then there was confusing between us and other guests as to who's taxi was who's. As we had lots of luggage we didn't mind giving up the smaller ones and wait for a larger one - all in all a bit of a shambles. I would consider staying here again but would definitely check out other 4 and 5 star hotels as well. Under normal circumstances this would be a good bet for a stay in Chicago - great location a few minutes from Millenium Park, near the lakeshore. For families, there's a pharmacy opposite as well for any essentials. Note the hotel staff also claim that due to the economic circumstances no room service is provided after 10pm - although the night staff were helpful in getting milk to us for the kids in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, nice room, great location, terrible service ..”
Reviews.Author: jbphotography
Reviews.Content: slowest wifi on the planet. literally. terrible room service food. HORRIBLE RESTAURANT EXP.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel with superb staff and eatery”
Reviews.Author: yww168
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel by chance since we decided the spur of the moment to spend a nite in Chicago on 7/24/09. We went thru Priceline and was lucky to get a room at this hotel for only $69 (normal rate was around $200). The room was superb on the 29th floor with a nice king bed. Hotel is only about 1.5 blocks to Michigan Ave so the location is very convenient. Parking is very expensive at $50 a nite but we parked right next door at a selfpark for just $30. We decided to have breakfast at the hotel restaurant to save us from walking elsewhere. We ordered the buckwheat pan cakes and egg benedict. They were absolutely delicious which stunned us since we didn't expect this type of experience from a hotel restaurant especially for breakfast. Glad we didn't pick their breakfast buffet since the special menu is much better. I highly recommend this beautiful and cozy hotel for your Chicago visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: DublinCait
Reviews.Content: As we had come from a small bedroom in a hotel in NY the size of the room on arrival was amazing! Lovely bathroom, comfy bed, wide screen telly and the major plus was an nespresso machine in the room! The location is excellent, right by millennium park and can walk to main shopping area in about 10 minutes. Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the quality of the food but the lobby and general ambiance of the hotel was very cool. Helpful bell boy and concierge and generally staff were lovely. Only small complaint was a rather condensing and rude waiter in the wine bar but you cant have everything. Overall great and would definitely recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming --- but great location.”
Reviews.Author: JetSet1227
Reviews.Content: The Good: The location is perfect! Walking distance to Navy Pier, Millenium Park, shopping on State St. and Michigan Ave---we even walked from the Union Station Amtrak station---it takes about 30 minutes, but w/ little luggage and lots to look at it--the time flies. The concierge service was really great. They gave us good recommendations of things to do in the area and great restaurants to try. The hotel itself, as stated in the title is underwhelming and a little dull. The lobby is drab, and the lounge/restaurant bars are barely occupied by patrons. The wine lounge only stayed open until 9-10pm on a Saturday night---and the bar lounge closed at midnight. We were out on the town anyway--so it didn't matter too much--but we were disappointed upon returning from our night out that we couldn't finish the evening w/ a night cap. The rooms were alright---good bed and bathroom, great view and awesome flat screen tv. The bad: The a/c barely worked--and we both woke up hot and ornary in the middle of the night. Also--not sure if the people above us were just heavy on their feet---but we could here them stomping around up there. Overall---the hotel was nice. Functional. I am super pickey when it comes to hotels and like a good atmosphere---which I did not find here. But given the short stay, it did not bother me too much---as we had a great time and saved money on taxi fare w/ the location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Chicago I've Ever Had!”
Reviews.Author: Richland34
Reviews.Content: Got a great promo rate, so went for the Fairmont. Absolutely LOVED the hotel. Very courteous, unpretentious service. I wasn't prepared for how friendly all of the staff were. The room was exquisite and I'll let my photos speak for themselves. Location was fantastic: walkable to Michigan Ave. and to Navy Pier. We used our car to venture out to dinner in Lincoln Park and Lakeview , two adjacent neighborhoods we hadn't seen before. I would recommend the Fairmont without hesitation. Prepare to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Staff”
Reviews.Author: UDSL05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend of shopping and sightseeing. The staff was absolutely delightful, they went out of their way to see our stay was pleasant and our special requests were met. This was in addition to the clean comfortable rooms and a wonderful location. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a Chicago getaway.

Reviews.Title: “FAB-U-LOUS!”
Reviews.Author: sedaygogirl
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped up to the front entrance my luxury service began! I enjoyed every minute @ the fairmont! The King room was spacious and the decor chic! The coffee maker was the coolest and the bathroom is huge! I really like the separate shower, tub, and separate door for the toilet. The desserts and cheese spread at ENO so yummy. Before the fairmont the W hotel was my favorite chain of hotels to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: td397
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a nice location - just off Mil. Park and Grank Park - a few blocks from Lake Michigan and the marina area and just blocks from the theatre district and Michigan Avenue - probably the best location I have ever stayed in Chicago... moreso - QUIET little streets surround the hotel and the views are nice. The hotel is contemporary and the rooms are luxurious and large in size. The staff was wonderful and courteous. The one fallback is that the fitness / gym area is privately owned and costs 25.00 a day extra to use. :( There is a spa in the hotel with great services for men and women. Extra costs there too obviously. But overall... nice property and I should mention - VERY CLEAN! Parking is 45.00 a night. Fitness Center 25.00 a day WIFI Internet 15.00 Restaurant and bar $$$$

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the extra Cheddar!”
Reviews.Author: whosyer12
Reviews.Content: Up For a Cubs weekend --we usually stay wherever Priceline can put us for $75 or so. That usually means the Hyatt, Drake, Wyndham Chicago, Burnham, Palmer House or Hilton Chicago. Since it was our anniversary and I was able to get a deluxe-view king for about $50 more under Fairmont's Friends and Family promotion (you need an employee id code to get rate--widely available on web)and since Fairmont is generally considered to be a Premium brand a cut above those listed above, we went for it. Pros = Beautiful facility. Our room's view was a knockout, Milennium Park. a slice of the lake, Field Museum and Soldier Field! Bathroom was cool--separate marble shower with huge "rain" showerhead and one of those big round backlit magnifying mirrors that lets you see zits and blackheads at about 10x. Room was also very clean and quiet. Cons = Poor A/C --it was a hot humid weekend. Though the a/c was set on high cool and 64* -- the room never got below 73* I know that is a fine temperature for most--but I cannot sleep unless temp is below 70. I've come to believe that a lot of hotels have some sort of non publicized low end governor and they decide how cool your room will be allowed to get. I want it my way and at a Premium hotel--should be able to get it. I reported it the first morning after the first night and they promised to send an engineer up.--We were out all day so I've no idea if anyone looked at it as they weren't considerate enough to leave me a message. At any rate the second night was the same as the first---hot and humid! First night we went to see "Jersey Boys" (great, highlight of the trip!) and returned to our room at about 10:30 and decided to order up a snack (hotel directory advises 24hr in room dining) after studying extensive menu and making our selections we called to place our order only to be informed "in room dining has closed for the night" !! Here we are in Chicago at a supposed world class upscale hotel and we couldn't get any room service at 10:45 PM !!! I guarantee you I could have scared up a cheeseburger or club sandwich or something at the Holiday Inn in the little Indiana city I live in. Geeez. Location --most reviews call the location good. It is unquestionably in a good, but business oriented neighborhood--other than the CVS across the street, it is about 3 city blocks to any shopping/dining/entertainment venues- (dining choices are severely limited at the Fairmont) so for my purposes, the location is average to poor. Concierge service: I sought the advice of the concierge on two separate minor matters---but each time the concierge desk was overwhelmed and people were waiting 3-4 deep, not how I wanted to spend my time--so I did without their counsel. Was the extra $50 or so per night worth it for the view and the bathroom? IMHO hela no! Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern rooms, nice experience”
Reviews.Author: markbanshee
Reviews.Content: I got an incredibly good rate which made this reservation a no-brainer. One of my main requirements was a downtown Chicago hotel that had a spa in the hotel. The spa was clean and new with a good size workout facility, nice bathroom, steam room and relaxation lounge area for post workout or before getting a massage. The massage was very nice, good masseuse and new massage rooms. It is not the largest overall spa, but if going with a friend or two its a nice, modern facility and free to guests of the hotel. The rooms were big, with comfortable beds and a new, large LCD TV but an odd lack dresser space, we had zero space to unpack our clothes. Good shower and a new bathroom round out a solid room and a comfortable stay. We were upgraded to a "lake view" room, which provided a decent view, but it was not really a full-on lake view, instead there is a large building across the way. This might bother some, not a big deal to us though. I did not deal with the front desk much, but the concierge and people at the Spa were very friendly and helpful. Finally, the location is great, 10 minute walk to Grant Park and the attractions around there and a 10 minute walk in the other direction to get to Michigan avenue. There are MANY options in Chicago and certainly some luxury options that might be nicer, but especially if you can get a good rate, the Fairmont is a very fine option, providing modern, large rooms, helpful service, good location and a spa in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “spent overnight for bday - unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: denstar
Reviews.Content: Well first I must say that talking to someone online about the trip started some amazing follow ups from the hotel. We paid for a regular room, but I had made plans for champaign upon arrival since my husband and I were going downtown Chicago for my 40th birthday celebration. Well upon checkin we found they automatically upgraded me to the suite on the top floor. The room had 3 views of the city from the North, East and west. The room was huge,. Then after we had a late lunch, come back to the room to find a birthday surprise. Timothy Samples made all these plans for me, and he really made my stay a memory of a lifetime. We went to Soldier field for a huge concert, the only drawback was having to walk almost half the way back before we were able to hail a cab - quite frustrating, but the bed upon getting back to the room made it all worthwhile. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The room service for breakfast in the morning allowed us to enjoy the room a little, and checking out and getting our vehicle from the valet - was perfect timing, no delays and they all from the valet, to the room service, to the concierge - they were all amazing,. I would go back there for any visit ever.......

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMan3333
Reviews.Content: Fairmonts are some of my favourite hotels, but this hotel exceeded my expectations. A much newer decor and building than the beautiful Fairmonts in Canada, the lobby was modern and trendy with interesting restaurants and bars. The central area was a chocolate and cheese-tasting bar! The rooms were modern with large LCD televisions and free Internet (for Fairmont club members - it's free!). When our travel agent failed to relay our requested upgrade to a suite, the Fairmont gladly obliged and even gave us the discounted room rate. The newer building also meant the rooms (even the non-suite room) were much larger than Canadian Fairmonts. The fitness center was fantastic with televisions on every machine including plugs for your iPod/iPhone! I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chimigi9
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about at all. Gorgeous bathroom. Attentive service. Comfortable bed. Large room. Got a great deal on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - We received an unexpected suprise-early check-in at 8:00 A.M.”
Reviews.Author: mssuzan
Reviews.Content: We booked our shopping trip via Priceline as a vacation package at the Fairmont. We received round trip air fare and two nights stay for $256 at THE FAIRMONT. EVERYTHING was excellent. When our neighbors came home each night at 3:20 a.m. and decided to party, the front desk was called, and literally within five minutes the situation was handled and all was quiet. Too wonderful. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont is Nice with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: MooseMikeNY
Reviews.Content: Although my room seemed to be laid-out strangely (optimizing every square inch), it was a beautiful experience. The staff is excellent, everyone very friendly and willing to help. Maids are very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, clean rooms, nice bell hops, great view...”
Reviews.Author: susymisir
Reviews.Content: We staying at the Fairmont Chicago from May 16-May 18 2009. We booked the Fairmont as part of a conference/show that we were there for. We booked a room that slept 4 and one room that slept 3. The room that slept 3 was clean, with 2 beds and had an amazing view on the 30th floor. The room that slept 4 was huge with 2 TV's, a tub and shower, and a huge bathroom. There was a bit of a misconception with that room because we were led to believe that there were 2 seperate rooms but it was one room with a King sized bed and then a pull out couch. It wasn't a big deal and they brought up and extra cot right away. This hotel is located about 3 blocks from the Magnificent Mile and is central to most of the shopping centers. It's about 15 minute walk to Navy Pier. On the day we checked out our bus wasn't picking us up until 2:25 so we decided to go shopping, and we left our bags at the front bell hop. There was no problem in picking them back up or leaving them there. The staff were friendly and tried to accomodate all of our needs. We asked for extra pillows and an extra blanket and they were brought up to us within 20 - 25 minutes. As part of the suite we booked, we received free breakfast in the restaurant however we changed that to in room dining which we were then charged for, but we then called the front desk and the charge was waived. The price we paid for the rooms was quite pricey but that's what you can expect for a high class hotel in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Why you should stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: msdrannie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago Fairmont for four nights for a conference. My fiance' accompanied me. When we checked in, we were given a room with two full size beds despite the fact that our reservation was for one king size bed. So instead of relaxing on the large luxurious bed we had imagined, we were forced to either sleep in separate beds like Ward and June Cleaver or either cuddle up on a small full size like two college kids in a fraternity house! We discovered that the coffee maker wasn't working and called down to the desk to have someone look at it, and waited two and half hours. We had issues with the plumbing, including extremely slow hot water tap in the bathtub which took 45 minutes to fill. The toilet stopped working twice. We returned one afternoon from the art museum to find the maid in our room, sitting on the bed, watching the tv and talking on her cell phone. They bellman were rude, and wouldn't let my fiance unload our own car which was packed with some of his very expensive camera equipment. There were errors on our bill. Last but not least, we saw a ROACH in the drawers. Alive. The restaurant downstairs was decent, and the location is fairly good since my conference was in the Hyatt next door but for the price you can find someplace better. I will never ever stay here again under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience and service”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: Room were fantastic. Services was excellent. The staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was memorable. The location is a little off the Magnificent Mile but right next to Millenium Park. Made our trip to Chicago a lasting memory!!!

Reviews.Title: “FAIRMONT CHICAGO - Great Location, Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: Nestled just off the beaten path and about two blocks from the river the Fairmont Chicago offers an excellent location to operate as home base for your trip to Chicago. The staff were friendly and helpful, arranging many of the sightseeing events we enjoyed while in the city. There are many attractions withiin easy walking distance (The Art Institute is a must see and Millenium Park is a fun visit). The architectural tour by river departs a dock that is very close to the Fairmont and there are lots of restaurants nearby. The rooms were excellent and the club room is worth the extra expense. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with spacious rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: livuska
Reviews.Content: I'm in the hotel right now, and wanted to write this review before I get back home and don't have the time to do it anymore. I booked this hotel on priceline, and I got a really good deal ($70 per room with king size bed). The hotel is about 4 blocks from Millennium Park, in a quiet area. It's also two blocks away from the river front. Both these places are worth visiting! Also, across the river there is a high end grocery store 'fox and obel' where you can shop for delicious food for your room. There are also a number of Walgreen, CVS, etc nearby. Around here there are only skyscrapers for about 2 blocks...there isn't much traffic nor any rail roads (that can get loud) so again the place is quiet. The room doesn't have a great view but it's spacious and has a modern bathroom, spotless. It also has a very pleasant decor and a flat screen TV that rotates so you can view it from the armchairs/table. The hotel has a spa that is pretty expensive, but there is free wireless internet access. Overall I'm very satisfied with our stay here, it's truly comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and beautiful renovation”
Reviews.Author: brdandbtr
Reviews.Content: We just finished our family "staycation" in Chicago and had a wonderful time at The Fairmont. The staff was extremely attentive -- from the time I made the reservation to our final breakfast at their lovely restaurant, Aria. There has been a recent renovation and the room was decorated in a clean, contemporary style. The view from our room was fantastic -- the lakefront, Navy Pier, and Millenium Park. We also used their spa facilities which were relaxing, provided everything you could want in a spa, and were spotless. I would highly recommend The Fairmont to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good views, modern decor, excellent spa-- you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: eeod
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a "stay-cation" to this hotel. The MySpa services were excellent and convenient. Our view was lovely (30th floor). The room itself was a little small. The bathtub was awkwardly small to take advantage of the "bath sommelier" service. Perhaps other suites are better suited. Overall, a nice escape. The decor feels a little Ikea, and almost cheap. The bed was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Simplistic Decor - Decent location”
Reviews.Author: Go-OSUBucks
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Fairmont with my kids over spring break. There was a great special on the Fairmont site of buy 2 nights, get the 3rd free. With that they gave $100 restaurant credit, $50 spa credit, and discounted parking of $25 per night (regularly $49). Arrival and check in no problem with excellent service from the time I originally made the reservation until we checked out. Rooms were great size for a Chicago hotel. Decor very simplistic with a Euro style flair. I liked the shower stall with door as I always hate at hotels having water pool all over from shower curtains. Nice large bathrooms with Miller Harris toiletries (my daughter's hated the shampoo but I'm thinking it was the low flow from the waterfall showerhead). There was a closet with in room safe however drawers were almost non existent (our room had a padded bench with two pull out drawers and there was one nightstand drawer and that was it). I did like the padded window seat for catching a glimpse of the lake (blocked mostly by buildings though). Bedding was very crisp and comfy and I always love hotels where they have bathrobes. We used our $100 credit for breakfast. It covered one breakfast for three adults and one child and with tip was $98 so certainly not the amount I normally spend on breakfast. The other two days we walked to the AON Center next door and there is a Starbucks, and Au Bon Pain, and another little cafe for breakfast. Didn't try out the bar but definately liked the vibe of it. We pretty much did museums on our trip mixed with a little shopping. Had to take cabs most every place. We did decide the first day to walk to the Field Museum but.....probably wouldn't again. Didn't realize at first but it was about 2 1/2 miles to get there. Within walking distance we found a Giordano's for fantastic stuffed pizza and it's also walking distance to State Street shopping. First time I've stayed this far south and it was a good locale since we only needed one trip up the Mag Mile for shopping the first evening. Just wish I could have found more evening restaurants around the area which is what I felt was lacking. If you sign up for President's Club (it's free) you get free internet service. Utilized it but had a heck of a time as the connection from the nearby Hyatt kept overtaking the signal from the Fairmont and I kept losing connection. So in all, a very nice stay. For what I paid for the place it would be a five but if I paid over $200 per night I'd probably give it a 3. So I'll average it out. As mentioned, service was a 5. Decor just wasn't my personal preference and wish there was more within several blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but problems”
Reviews.Author: RichR49
Reviews.Content: Hotel room nicely decorated, but only one drawer to speak of, lived out of suitcase. Wide screen tv was not HD, only SD and would not maintain SD aspect ratio, kept resetting to stretch. Annoying shower head was rainshower type, too little water pressure, not adjustable, hot water took 15 minutes to arrive in the am. Given only one bar of soap for the week, maid never left any more. Bed very comfortable, ventilation good, reliable wakeup call, elevators fast. Restaurants and bar downstairs were very expensive. No buffet, but a full breakfast was over $35, dinner out of the question. Local brew Honkers Ale was $7/bottle, mixed drinks $12, dizzy bar waitress. Found other places to eat breakfast for $15 and drink, like Houdibras around the corner. Hotel staff very pleasant, doormen very helpful. Valet parking is steep, but then it is downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Follow-Up”
Reviews.Author: MangoGT
Reviews.Content: We recently completed our second stay at the Fairmont Chicago. The check-in process was quick and painless but the front desk staff was almost disinterested in the whole procedure. That is fine when I am traveling on business, but on leisure trips I would appreciate a warmer greeting. The hotel was hosting a convention at the same time as our stay, but other than seeing some signage/attendees in the lobby, we wouldn't have noticed. This is probably due to the separation of the conference areas from the guest rooms and the 8 speedy elevators. We stayed in a Parkview Suite so we had a large room with a great view of Millenium Park. The anteroom was well appointed with a sofa, coffee table, desk, mini-bar with sink and coffee maker, and dining area. The bedroom appeared to be the same as a standard Fairmont room, but maybe slightly larger. The bathroom also appeared to be similar to a standard Fairmont room, and once again, possibly slightly larger. The upscale modern decor is pleasing but not overtly luxurious, and several small touches such as a shoe shine station (with extra collar tabs), are peppered throughout.
