We booked a few evening activities through the concierge and everything was perfectly handled. The hotel restaurant, Aria, couldn't find our reservation but they oddly new my name and remembered that the hotel had called to make a reservation for us. They had no problem seating us and the dinner (both food and service) was lovely. Minor complaints: The pillows could be better. I'm not sure if they remembered our preference for non-down bedding from our last visit, but seriously, these things barely felt like pillows. I'll suffer through some congestion if I can get better neck support. Also, the valet parking attendants seem overly eager to take your car (and charge you $49). And as I mentioned above, the front desk experience could be improved. Best feature: After our first stay, I gave a brief review in the comments section of the Fairmont President's Club (membership is free) website. I received a phone call from the Director of Rooms the same day asking to discuss our experience. After this stay, I left a comment essentially thanking the hotel staff for a great stay, but still received a warm, friendly phone call from the Director of Rooms asking if he could do anything to improve our next stay. Kudos to the Fairmont for taking its customers seriously, and for that, they've won my loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Regular guest, a little dissapointed this time...”
Reviews.Author: diego37
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Chicago Fairmont for many years. This time, I found it totally redecorated in a style that, in my opinion, makes it look cheaper. Water preassure in the shower was very bad, some guy came in to fix it, he changed the shower but still, nothing even close to good enough. The room service mentioned a 25 minute time for delivery when I made my order, but it took one hour for them to come, and another hour for table pick up. The bathroom door was really in bad shape, humidity and badly painted. The lighting on the WC area was totally insuficient. Staff was ok, and the hotel is very well located. I like the idea of having Lakeshore Spa next door where you can spend hours working out or at the Spa... that is good. As for the redecoration, I guess changing the TVs and some other little details would have been enough, I guess millions of dollars were spent with a very doubtable result.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: LoyalBear
Reviews.Content: Redecorated rooms with cheap furniture (a 3-legged coffee table that fell over when you brushed up against it), no water pressure in the shower, polyester pillows that were so old & flat they were unusable (we're allergic to feather), overcharges on the bill ($138 for breakfast at the hotel restaurant, which we never visited)... The crowning blow was a buffet breakfast for 20 set up in the room next door on two consecutive mornings (at 7:00am!), which made sleeping in impossible. When we complained we were told "that they weren't doing it tomorrow".

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade Yourself to the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: For the price of the Marriott we spent a night here ($122 + tax) and had an enjoyable if brief stay. As others have noted the hotel has been recently renovated, and the rooms are furnished with attractive and sleek scandanavian-type design. The staff was polite and attentive, and seemed to match the redesign with a hip kind of feel. The parking is pricey at $49, so I used an adjacent lot and self-parked, and as others have noted, the lack of water-pressue in the shower was disappointing. Good location. Would return, esp as this pricepoint.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place; Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: djstraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Chicago from 1/12 thru 1/15 for a convention at McCormick. The convention rate was $159, and I used an President's Club upgrade certificate to upgrade to a park view 1 bedroom suite (room#2301). I took a cab from O'Hare...costs about $45 including tip and didn't have to hassle with parking, which is typically expensive for a downtown hotel in a large city. Cabs were plentiful everywhere we went, and were always available and hailed by the bellman quickly. The location is central and right across the river from Michigan Ave shops. The lobby is very nice and modern. In fact, this hotel is very "un-fairmont" like. Not old luxury, but rather very modern, with a scandinavian feel to the furniture, etc. The room was HUGE and well equipped. The spa and exercise area was beautiful. Bed was great, water pressure was not great though. I recommend joining the Fairmont's presidents club. You will get free local calls and free internet access, which alone is about $15 a day. And if you stay 5 nights or more in a calendar year you become a premiere member, which gives you some upgrades and dining certificates. All in all, a nice comfortable place to stay. But probably not worth the regular rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “High parking cost-$49.00”
Reviews.Author: Lynne_9
Reviews.Content: We spent New Years Eve in Chicago our overall trip was great. After paying over $200.00 for our stay they charged another $49.00 for parking. We wanted to park ourselves but we were told they were suppose to park our vehicle .So the next morning we received a charge of $49.00 to park our vehicle when it was all said in done we spent over $275.00 Unless you like to spend alot of money I wouldn't recommend it at all. When I said something the next morning I was told it cost money to park.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in a good location”
Reviews.Author: patrickstpaul
Reviews.Content: This property was a refreshing change from classic Fairmont hotels with its striking reception area that gives the pizzazz of a trendier hotel brand. The front desk service was exceptional during check-in and check-out. The representative checked me in for my flight and printed my boarding pass rather than just directing me to a business center as is the procedure at many hotels. This was a much-appreciated time-saver for us. We couldnâ€™t have asked for a better view from our 31st floor room, overlooking the park below and Lake Michigan beyond and the calm color palette contributed, along with the dÃ©cor, to a pleasantly serene room above the city below. The bed was very comfortable and I liked the large somewhat walk-in closet. A couple of concerns that you may want to inquire about â€“ I went down to the work-out room around 7:30a and was told it doesnâ€™t open until 9:00a which doesnâ€™t make sense for a business hotel. Also, there isnâ€™t a pool in this hotel, but I was told for $25, you can use the athletic facility pool next door. I donâ€™t know if this is the pool mentioned in another review or not, but there isnâ€™t (according to the concierge) a pool at this property. For the excellent service, great location and comfortable rooms, Iâ€™d stay here again, however for a longer period, I would probably choose a hotel with more recreational amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing for the money”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Fairmont at the end of Oct., 2008. For the price I found it to be a pretty average hotel experience. I booked a superior room and I did have a view of the lake. As it was an especially mild night and day for autumn in Chicago, I appreciated being able to crack open some windows for fresh air (although I had to climb over furniture to even get to the curtains). I was underwhelmed by the room decor. The room was relatively spacious, but seemed a little 1980s style and out of date. The bathroom was the room's best feature, but there was somewhat of a water pressure problem when I took my shower in the morning. Nice robe for guest use in the closet. The bed was comfortable and the room was pretty well lit for reading or working. There was a charge for internet use, which I didn't take advantage of since paying $15 for about 4 hours of connection seemed a waste to me. Check-in was quick but fairly perfunctory, although thank goodness he gave me specific detailed directions for finding the elevators or I would have been quite lost. Since I got in late, I ordered room service for dinner. Service was quick. My dinner was average though. Breakfast the next morning at Aria was much more satisfying. It isn't that I disliked this hotel. It was fine and under similar circumstances I'd probably stay there again. But for $414.00 midweek, it seemed overpriced to me for the quality. I realize that the downtown Chicago area location is pricey, but my $180 room at the Doubletree in Rosemont on my way back out of Chicago compared favorably to the Fairmont room that was more than twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “High Marks all 'Round”
Reviews.Author: Archipelagic
Reviews.Content: A fine property with staff offering excellent hospitality. A kiss away from Michigan Avenue, in a peaceful location. Great city views, beautifully appointed, good choices of places on property to enjoy food and beverage. Especially loved Aria's eclectic menu (the Pacific cod was my favorite) and pampering service, and ate there two nights running. Fairmont Chicago proved a fine place to stay and I will put it at the top of my list for my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: SFMichele
Reviews.Content: We loved the San Francisco Fairmont and now we also love the Fairmont in Chicago! A big THANK YOU to the Chicago hotel for terrific service, lovely accommodations, and excellent location. From start to finish -- the stay was great. We had a very nice room on the 9th floor where it was quiet -- the floor plan places rooms in little pods of four, no long halls -- and the draperies really kept out all the light. Good big-screen TV (my SO gave it 4 stars). Close to everything -- museums, Michigan Avenue, the El -- either on foot or by cab. When we had a plumbing mishap and forgot to take the "do not disturb" sign off the door knob, resulting in an unmade room, the staff beautifully took care of everything ASAP. Also, when I discovered I'd left an item behind, they sent it home without charge. Wonderful breakfast menu in Aria restaurant, too! You will love this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: DrLisaK66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont during a professional conference. While I have to say that for a conference, some of the meeting rooms were too small, in terms of traveler's comfort the hotel is exceptional! I can't think of a single thing about my room that wasn't perfect. The accommodations were luxurious and the hotel is conveniently situated within walking distance of many Chicago attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: PAfamily07
Reviews.Content: I would agree with all the positive recent reviews. We stayed here in July 08 and were very happy with the hotel. The room was well appointed, clean, spacious,and quiet. When traveling as a family, we are often staying in family hotels but decided to splurge a bit while in the city. However through joining the President's club, I was able to score a very nice price for this very nice hotel. To save on cash we parked in the Millenium underground facility half a block away. The location is only about one and a half blocks from the river and is half a block from the park. The area has a number of hotels and is within walkable distance to a number of downtown attractions, however at night it becomes somewhat deserted.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best”
Reviews.Author: ProSpotter
Reviews.Content: The concierge was so helpful. Without hesitation they had the best recommendations for restaurants and attractions all turning out to be wonderful. They even gave us business cards for restaurants that did not take reservations so we could obtain preferential or immediate seatingâ€™s. Loved the health club at the back of the hotel. By joining the presidents club, it only cost ten dollars a day to use the facilities. The rooms were large, updated and had views looking out in 3 directions. The coffee maker in the room was exceptional. Location is great for getting mostly anywhere. Parking is overpriced so we took our cart to the underground Millennium Garage that was only $25.00 per 24 hours and a few blocks walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent downtown digs”
Reviews.Author: tcook052
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Fairmont's recently I was curious to see how the Fairmont Chicago stacked up and it passed the test without breaking a sweat. Unlike many others in the Fairmont chain this hotel isn't a heritage or historic landmark and so has a more modern feel. The design is somewhat retro 70's chic and at times it tries a little too hard, such as the flashing white lights inbedded in the floor at the front desk. The location only a few short blocks to the Jay Pritzker Pavillion which is in Millennium Park makes for comfortable morning walks and should you feel up to it the celebrated Buckingham Fountain, Field Museum, Soldier Field and Adler Planetarium are all not much farther. The other direction will take you to the Chicago River and riverwalk with lots of restaurant choices. In terms of getting to the hotel, I rode the Blue line CTA train right to Clark & Lake and then walked the approx 5 minutes to the Fairmont and at $2.00 one way the CTA in from O'Hare many times cheaper than the airport mini-van transfers at $27.00 one way. My room was a deluxe king room, #3104 with a decent view looking towards Millennium Park though it isn't an unobstructed view as other tall towers nearby limit the view to some degree. The retro look was carried over within this guest room as the wooden chaise lounge chair and green cusion had a 60's/70's Euro design feel but were comfortable enough. The large flat screen TV was a little modern appliance set amongst the retro design and wasn't enclosed in a cabinet as some hotels use. The large king bed was fairly standard for a luxury chain but the where the room really excelled was the bathroom which had separate large tub & large walk in shower with a great rainfall shower head that made for a relaxing start to the day. I'd always wondered whether they were as good as all the hype I'd heard and for the most part would agree they are miles better than the regular shower head. Fairmont sells them on their shopping website but at $470 will pass and keep my old shower head. The one small annoyance during the 2 night stay was after relaxing in the big tub I turned the button but the recessed plug didn't pop up to let the water drain and without any fingernails couldn't get any grip to pull it up for after a few minutes gave up. I noticed housekeeping looked like they were equally as unsucessful as maintenance must've been in because there was a new and different plug installed when I returned to the room late in the day, though nobody had bothered to actually clean the tub in the process. When I made the booking months earlier I received an email saying Fairmont & Aveda were working together to offer guests for a nominal fee a travel liquid pack and so I asked for one to be put in the room upon my arrival. After checking in I noticed it wasn't there and on my way out to dinner I mentioned it to the concierge in the lobby and it was in my room upon my return and never showed on the hotel bil at check out so it must've been made complimentary as goodwill gesture which was appreciated. The travel package was a gift for a niece and I hopes she likes it as I wouldn't have ordered it for myself as it really wasn't anything that would replace my more utilitarian travel liquids pack that doesn't have any facial cream or eyebrow lotion. I did have a pre-meal drink in the Aria lounge, which is again very retro in look and feel. Note the lounge in the middle of the round lobby is only a wine bar, not all cocktails. The only other service I used on site was the business center which offered the first 30 minute internet use for guests and so took advantage to do my airline online check in and print my boarding pass, saving loads of time at O'Hare on Labour Day long weekend. There were only four terminals so be prepared for them to be full at times. The staff I encountered were all fairly young but had good attitude with friendly but polite manners and I was more than happy in the quiet refined retro luxury surroundings. The Fairmont Chicago delivered everything I'd hope and a little more and so I would return again. Price is always a consideration and were this hotel to be on sale I'd easily stay here over others in the Magnificent Mile area as I liked the Fairmont's location more. Would I pay $400+ per night? Probably not but I've seen it on sale at times as low as $149-$179 and at that range think it a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cidalianicole
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Chicago for 3 nights Aug 1-4 with 3 friends. We went for Lollapalooza in Grant Park. This hotel was in a great location. It was clean and our room had a great view. We were on the 36th floor in a corner room. We asked for a mini fridge in our room and it was brought to us within 5 minutes.The I pod dock in the room was a nice touch. I did not hear any of the other guests talking in their rooms, it was pretty quiet. The hotel has a Complimentary Car that takes you places around the area. You can take advantage of that Mondays- Saturdays. There is a great breakfast place called West Egg...there usually is a 15-40 minute wait but it is worth it. The food is great and the prices aren't bad either. It was about a 10 minute walk, you can ask the concierge where West Egg is...or the hotel car will take you and drop you off. We put our names down on the list for waiting and they told us it would be 20 mins, we walked around the Magnificant Mile area for a bit and came back. This is a great hotel in an awesome city! Will definetly return to this hotel next year for the concert!

Reviews.Title: “Love the new look”
Reviews.Author: Jdreamer
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have stayed here several times and I must say the needed remodel has turned out great with a trendy fresh comforting atmosphere. I did find it unusual that the room had no chairs in it. Was told they are coming from China so that was rather strange and feel they could have easily told me before I took the room but I certainly didn't go to Chicago to sit in the room even with the beautiful lake view I had. It is really too bad the restaurant couldn't be located in the hotel where there are windows. Although Aria is good one might expect linens on the table for the price and the service certainly is not on a par with the rest of the wonderful staff. I impressed my guests with our evening ride in the Hotel car - a 2008 beautiful Bentley. One has to ask but if it is parked in front you will more often than not get a nice ride to your dining destination. I do miss the President's Club reception area to check-in that allowed not waiting in line when a convention is checking in. Over all it was again a wonderful experience that lived up to expectations. If you have time go to the Segway tour office two blocks East and take a Segway tour for a different and fun thing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel property with good location in Chicago. Check-in was fast and pleasant. Room was average size with a great view of the City. The bathroom was great with separate bath and a very classy tiled shower stall. Bed was comfortable and bedding was high quality. A small clock/alarm with iPod port was provided on the nightstand. Flat screen TV was perfect in size for the room. The desk area adequate to do work with good lighting. The high speed internet line, however, was disconnected between the wall and the desk, and when I tried to log on, nothing happened. I pulled the desk out from the wall and sure enough, the line to the desk internet plug receptacle had been unplugged. I plugged it in and the internet began to work on my pc. Not sure why it was unplugged but someone less resourceful than me would have had to call the front desk and wait for someone to come fix the connection. Didn't order from room service nor ate at any of their restaurants. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Fahrrader
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Fairmont. A couple of years had passed, and the rooms have been redone in a very modern, minimalist style. Very neat. This hotel remains a first class establishment in every way. From the professional, courteous staff, to the swank lobby, to the spacious and top notch rooms, and the luxurious marble bathroom. The new wine bar in the lobby is really a nice way to sample of flight of wines from around the world. And finally, the location can't be beat. Away from traffic in a residential area, its still only a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue and Millenium Park. A bike rental place is less than a block away with easy access to Chicago's stellar lakeshore bike path. A bargain, this place is not. Overnight parking alone is $50. But in downtown Chicago, you tend to get what you pay for. This was an anniversay splurge for me, and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: mat342
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Fairmont for 2 nights while we were attending Lollapalooza in Grant Park. Having this being a tradition of our we are able to stay in different hotels every year. This hotel has been the best so far. We entered the hotel, the entrance is low key. It sits quietly on the corner. Once you go into the lobby you can see very modern detail, the wine bar in the center of the lobby is really cute. We checked in and got our room right away. We were on the 25th floor, we had city views and a partial lake view. The room itself was very large. There was plenty of room for all of us staying there and for people that came up after the concerts. The bathroom was also large and beautifully designed. The entire feel was cool and modern. We did not eat at the hotel or purchase anything from the gift shop, but I can tell you that it was expensive for the most part. The only thing that seemed reasonable to me was the sushi restaurant. Their prices seemed to be comparable to what we would pay anywhere else in the city. The service was great. Everyone we spoke with was nice. I have to admit I was surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Place”
Reviews.Author: charlieboy322
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one evening. It was a very trendy hotel. The rooms where huge. The bed was very comfortable. Pillowtop mattresses, down comforters, soft pillows. Huge moveable flat screen tv on wall and where we were at, a nice view. Room service VERY expensive. For the most part, rooms were clean, small things left on floor like vacuum couldn't pick them up. Walking distant to lakeshore, shopping, food, Grant Park. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $ - the best part of this hotel is MySpa.”
Reviews.Author: spa_lady
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont was remodeling when we were there, and except for apologies, it was SO inconvenient to stay there during that time. The room was not worth the price; even with the gorgeous view of the Lake. Plus they were making way for the new chocolate/wine bar thing that to me, isn't worth it. This is a very expensive place to stay, folks, and we're used to paying for the luxury hotels (i.e., Ritz). Fairmont needs to provide better signage here because it's confusing, and do better in customer service for guests staying, especially for business. Parking is horrendous, and the best thing to do is suck it up and pay for valet, realizing that it's going to cost you. Aria's breakfast buffet had hot turned cold food every day, and there were problems in the kitchen with staffing on 1 day where the restaurant apologized and breakfast ala carte items were free. We're used to staying at the Renaissance, which has a better location, but without a view of the Lake. For the over $100 price difference, it wasn't worth the room. The accommodations at the website are not what you get unless you pay for THOSE exact rooms. However, if you want the best for spa treatments, go to their MySpa. Holy cow - it's wonderful. It's not just new; the whole atmosphere is relaxing and I enjoyed 2 treatments on 2 separate occasions. If traveling to Chicago again, I'd stay at the Renaissance and go to MySpa for massages. It's THAT great, and the staff at the Spa are very pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MYPRITI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for 4 days. To be honest, the only reason we stayed there was due to the reduced rate offered by the hotel, as this was a business trip. It was a beautiful hotel, the lobby exuded a serene atmosphere. I felt the same way about our room. The shower was very nice as was the separate bathtub, sink area and vanity. The bellmen were pleasant and always welcomed their guests back. However, we both agreed that we would probably not return to a Fairmont given their usual high rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: vacationlisa
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about the $49 parking. There is a public lot right across the street. However, we were running late for dinner reservations with friends, and there was a line to get in, so we opted to drop the car at the $49 parking. Check-in was easy. We were in 2619, facing the lake, if you looked through the condos under construction, so a very limited view of the lake Not their fault, I realize. The room was slightly disappointing. Not sure whether our room had been renovated. It certainly didn't look like any of the photos on here. I expected a more oppulent look. It was just basic Marriott or Westin decor. Window treatments were boring gray panels with no cornice. I wish I had taken pictures to post! There was not a single picture on the walls. The ipod dock is on the desk lamp. I read other reviews of thin walls. The only time we found this true was in the late afternoon while trying to take a quick nap before dinner. I don't know where the music was coming from, but it and it's bass were so loud that it was disturbing. That same afternoon a plate of sugar cookies arrived. We signed up for President's Club before arrival, so not sure if everyone receives them. You must be present to get them. Couldn't find anywhere to stash our clothes except in the bedside tables. Upon packing to leave, realized there were drawers in the ottoman at the end of the bed. Did find the espresso machine while searching for drawers and that was a highlight of the trip! A wobbly, funky table and a floor lamp were in front of the window. The room seemed large, but it was because there were no occasional chairs there. The only chair was a desk chair. We couldn't decide if the bed was comfortable. On the first night it was not. It got better as we got more tired from exploring the city. The lobby, bar and other common areas were very pretty and the staff were all super nice and friendly. We booked the pre-paid rate on their web site for $160 a night over the July 4 weekend. It was a good deal for the price. But I probably will try out a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location will not disappoint....”
Reviews.Author: Need2ski2
Reviews.Content: Celebrated the 3rd of July fireworks with my family.....First of all-the best thing we ever did was sign up for the Presidents club. Their frequent user club is fantastic. We have stayed at many of thier hotels and they are always an experience. We were absolutely surprised at how nice this hotel was. We have been disappointed by the hotels south of Wacker in Chicago-preferring to stay at the Four seasons or Peninsula or for family events the Westin on Michigan. If you want to walk- which is the way to really "feel" the city- those hotels are simply too far. To enjoy the museums-Grant Park and all the concerts and festivals and Navy Pier we were hoping to find a hotel south of Wacker. It has the feel of the Four Seasons and could well compete with this gem. The lobby chocolate bar was fun for the kids. Room service was the best we've had in a while and on and on..... Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: Sausca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Chicago last nite, a place we have stayed at multiple times before. Our room had been re-done and not for the better. The Fairmont use to reflect the turn of the century French style of the original Fairmont in San Franciso and had a lovely soigne feel about it. The new room style is like Motel 6. The carpet is a tissue thin industrial type, the lovely furniture is now laminate over particle board. The desk was relocated away from the window and faces a wall. There are no pictures on the walls other than the vinyl thing over the bed, and NO CHAIRS other than the desk chair. When we called to front desk to ask about the missing chairs, they acknowledged that yes, that was a problem. The light fixtures are from Home Depot, etc, etc, It just wasn't a pleasant room to be in. It is still a good sized room and they left the limestone in the shower, but not a quality experience. The restaurant ARIA is good. Very imaginative dishes and a extremely friendly staff. Indeed all of the staff is cheerful and makes every effort to make you feel like a guest. Although the hotel was built to a excellent standard, the problem appears to be the new ownership skimping on expenses. I think we will look for alternatives in the East Side neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “If you appreciate great service, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Naveron
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three-night stay at the Fairmont. I was really happy with this hotel. The staff (from the check-in, concierge, wait staff, etc.) are on the ball and do not miss a beat. They seem to know EVERYTHING about Chicago. They were so helpful in booking restaurants, tours etc. The rooms are a very generous size and have all the amenities (including an espresso maker which was great). The location is very convenient and you can easily walk to the Wrigley Building, Millenium Park, Navy Pier, Magnificant Mile and the Art Institute. You cannot go wrong with a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: LindaLouHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: I went there for a 4 day conference and loved it. I travel 50% of the time in my job, usually 3-4 star hotels. The location is great, there is a wonderful sushi bar in the lobby, the bartenders were friendly. I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Refurbished is Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Lei430
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at The Fairmont and were most impressed with the excellent customer service - the staff were all extremely friendly and most helpful. Our room was recently refurbished and spotless, the bed was really comfortable. Our nightly rate included breakfast which was so well worth it. I definitely would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: girlluxe
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Fairmont. The first visit was during the week for a business event at this hotel, and the second visit was over a weekend for a pleasure trip. The conference facilities and catering were top notch. The lobby was under renovation at the time of my second visit. I did not have a newly renovated room, but I still thought it was nice. All staff from the greeter/valet, front desk, bellman, concierge were so nice and helpful. I went to the Aria Bar, which had a good atmosphere and service. The recently opened spa was very nice, except the waiting area was small with not many seats and the steam shower was out of service. My deep tissue massage was fabulous. I liked the fitness center equipment, and it was stocked with chilled bottled water and wet towels. The hotel is quiet during the weekend â€“ more of a weekday business hotel. Itâ€™s far enough from Michigan Avenue and the Chicago River to be quiet, yet a very short walk to everything. Cabs are also very readily available. The weekend rate was slightly lower than other hotels even of lesser quality on Michigan Avenue or in River North. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TiredCanadian
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Fairmont was an excellent location for 5 days. It was walking distance to a number of great attractions -- including Millenium Park, the Art Institute of Chicago, and is right next to a great city park for young kids. I liked the spa -- I can recommend the Thai Massage that was a cross between a Swedish message and physiotherapy. The hotel coffee/muffin station on the main level is a bit limited, but the hotel is connected via one of the lower levels to an office block that has a small shopping concourse with some excellent breakfast, snack and light lunch choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good example of 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it'”
Reviews.Author: PaintTheCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last summer and thought the Fairmont was excellent in every way - from the decor to service to the rooms, etc. I knew I'd be back and I was a walking advertisement for this hotel. Since then, they've renovated and still are in the process. Along with that comes problems - and I respect that - but my opinion is that I preferred the hotel before, when it had that 'classic hotel' look and the staff was seasoned and experienced and totally accommodating to the guest. The check-in was ardious, the room I had reserved months before, and even confirmed the night before I arrived, was not available. A guaranteed smoking room was now a 'we cannot guarantee all requests' - which puts the Fairmont in the same long list of hotels that claim the same thing. In fact, most everything now ranks them as just as good as the hotel down the street. It's a shame - they stood out and ranked higher prior to the changes. Pros: Location is superb. Housekeeping, doormen, bellhops - all the service is 100%. Cons: Problematic wireless internet access. I never was able to connect inside the hotel, even on my iPhone. The front desk repeatedly referred me to tech help, which repeatedly referred me back to the front desk. The layout of the room I stayed in was ill-conceived, with the brand new plasma tv unable to face the bed. Absolutely stupid design. So here are the two things you want in a hotel room after your long day - the internet and television - and neither were right. Room service was prompt, the food was below average. When you have a great experience at a hotel, you can only hope the next time is the same if not better. In my case, I was dissappointed in the changes all around and would opt for another hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paper-thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: MMSE
Reviews.Content: hotel rooms were reasonable. Very nice bathrooms with rainshowers. The room was recently painted and the smell was a bit strong. Two important flaws: Paper thin walls - I could literally hear the snoring next door; and hallways were in sad condition. The carpet has seen better days - loose in some spots, multiple paint marks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: 2dMax
Reviews.Content: My husband had business in Chicago and I tagged along for a 5 night stay at the Fairmont. This was my first visit to Chicago. Upon check in the staff was friendly and attentive. We had a deluxe room on the 10th floor which had views of Millineum Park, observatory and the lake - beautiful! Our room was updated, contemporary, and of decent size with a couch, desk with internet hookup/phone, and a 42"flat screen TV. There was a mini-bar along with snack cabinet. I loved the Nespresso machine provided and made good use of it. It was thoughtfully replenished daily. We slept wonderfully in the King bed that had 4 goosedown pillows and a goosedown comforter. We appreciated the 3 sheet bed. The bathroom had a separate rain shower (a huge plus) in addition to a tub. Plenty of thick white towels. Separate toilet w/door as well. 2 robes, blowdryer, wine glasses, coffee mugs, glasses and ice bucket. Every thing provided was first rate. Soaps and shampoos were high quality also. We had 1 lunch and 1 dinner at Aria as well as 2 evenings at the Aria bar. The food and service was excellent. The hotel proximity was great for the sights we wanted to see. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Realy Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deedeetoo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Chicago and found it to be a fantastic hotel. Staff was always courteous and helpful - from the front desk staff at check-in to wait staff in Aria restaurant, to the maid who cleaned my room. The rooms were recently updated, with large flat-screen TV's, beautiful linens, and exceptional toiletries in each room. My room even had a view of Monroe St. harbor. It is truly a first-rate hotel. Location is south of the river and east of Michigan Ave â€“ as we normally stay north of the river it seems a little out of the way (if that's possible in downtown Chicago), however its location significantly lowers street noise. The hotel has excellent access to Millennium Park, the Aon center (there is a connecting concourse), and is about 4 blocks from shopping on North Michigan Ave. I ate dinner in Aria and it was fantastic! Room service for breakfast was quite good as well. Overall, Iâ€™d stay again in a minute if I had business in the loop, or leisure plans in Millennium or Grant Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: tberen
Reviews.Content: If you're a business traveler, stay away from this hotel. Their internet connectivity is provided by a company called Superclick. It tracks every website you go to. What this translates to is slow speeds, random redirects and, most devastatingly, difficulty accessing my secure work email via webmail. Vista noted the snooping, as did my remote email site, which blocked me out half the time. Work that should have been straightforward and easy took three times as long. Otherwise the hotel was nice enough and convenient, but what I'll remember about this stay was the hassle in trying to get my work done. See more about Superclick in "Superclick is Evil": [--]

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: CrystalVancouver
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about this hotel after reading some bad reviews, but it was fine. The check-in was a bit confusing, as I had booked through a conference site and they had got the dates wrong, but the Fairmont staff sorted it out. There was construction at the entrance site but aside from that, the hotel was very nice. The staff were all friendly and helpful, not one rude person. The room, which was a basic one, was spacious for a big-city hotel room. The clock radio was on when I got there and didn't turn off. Within 5 minutes a housekeeping staff member came to check and, when he realized it was broken, replaced it immediately. The bathroom was very nice with a separate shower and good-quality toiletries, No mold, everything worked well. The room and hotel itself were clean. No excess noise from other rooms or hall. The view from the 17th floor was great, able to see the water. However, views of construction would have been beyond the control of the hotel itself so I just considered a good view a bonus. Didn't try the restaurant or room service, but prices and selection seemed reasonable. It's easy to walk to stores, restaurants or delis from the hotel. Overall this was a pleasant hotel experience and I wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: LindaLouFranklin_WI
Reviews.Content: WOW - What a wonderful surprise!! Our stay at the Fairmont was a wonderful experience. The room was spacious, newly renovated and beautiful. Beds were comfortable, Huge flat screen TV was awesome, coffee /expresso machine was a real treat. My friend and I hightly recommend this hotel. We fell in love with the huge bathroom . We also enjoyed wearing the comfy White Fairmont Robes!! The location is close to Michigan Ave. The staff was very nice - Checked us in upon our arrival at 10:00 AM. The really AWESOME Surprise was the ride in the house car , a BENTLEY back to Union Station. Dean our driver was extremely nice. This is a 5 star property - Nicest hotel We've stayed in. And Yes, the price was right - Only 89.00 for the night. We will definitely be back!! FAIRMONT ROCKS!! We highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAtrip
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently when in Chicago since my company has a price deal there. This is not a sacrifice, the hotel is great and I would take my family there. Clean and well equipped rooms, great staff. It is a bit of a walk from the heart of "Michigan Avenue action". But the cab ride is cheap or in nice weather the walk is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if in chicago”
Reviews.Author: roadTrippinNM
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel for less than 100.00, what a steal. These rooms and the service are amazing. There is excellent mini bar and in house coffee maker, as well as a spacious room. This is by far the best place I have stayed at in chicago for less than 125.00. This clean and comfortable facility made a romatic getaway more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience in my life”
Reviews.Author: JBean17
Reviews.Content: The room I prepaid two weeks in advance was still not available to us 3 hours after check-in. We were told they had no idea when we would have a room. We missed our dinner reservations with friends for my 30th birthday, which was the only reason for staying downtown in the first place. The staff was extremely rude. When I was told there was no room I asked for a refund so that I could find a room somewhere else. I was then told "I don't know what to tell you" and then the man at the desk walked away leaving us to stand there upset and stranded. We finally got in a room that was not the King we had book and PAID for in advance. It was filthy. Our city view was a construction view. Between the blowing of the tarps outside our window and the noise of the elevator right outside our door, I was kept up all night. When I got up I decided to take a bath, but the tub was broken. I went to check out and listened as the asked everyone around us how their stay was....no one asked us (wonder why?!?!) I told them about the tub and filthy room and was told "thanks for letting me know" with a snotty attitude. I have never in my life seen such poor customer service anywhere. The elevator is broken so you have to go to the lower level then carry your bags up to the lobby. I then paid for my parking (almost double what I had been originally quoted). I have stayed at this hotel once before and it was okay, but after this experience I would never stay again and advise everyone else to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not as grand”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoRory
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on 2/15...valentine's weekend, hoping to have a nice, romantic night in the city (we live in the suburbs). We had high expectations, having known many people who had stayed there before, as well as the hotel's fine reputation, but we were severely disappointed. First, there was the room. We booked a room with a king. They confirmed this at check-in, yet put us in a room with two doubles. We called them to correct the mistake, and they were not all that nice. They sent someone up twenty minutes later (we were tired, had dinner reservations, and were looking to relax right away). He gave us new keys to another room, again, without so much as a lame apology. We go to the next room, which was far less nice than the previous one. It had older carpet, a so/so view of the city, and old, peeling plastic on the desk tops. Again, not what I expected for the Fairmont. Then, there was the pool. We love swimming when we stay at hotels, and so I asked them specifically about the pool when we booked the room. They said we could use the one next door at the health club. After dinner, we walk the ten minutes (indoors) between the hotel and the health club, only to learn it was an addition $25 to use the pool, something they certainly hadn't told us. At this point, we complained. They acted interested, but weren't too quick to actually help out. An hour later, they called saying they could comp us the price of the health club. This was 20 min before the pool closed, so we politely refused. They then offered to send a free breakfast, which come 11:30 the next morning, never came. Finally, at checkout we mentioned the mishap. They did give a free lunch at the hotel restaurant (Aria), which was delicious. But quite honestly we really would have preferred that we get treated a bit nicer throughout the whole experience, and correct the actual problem. If this were a lower class hotel, I would have been fine with the stay... I don't expect too much from ordinary places. But from the Fairmont in Chicago, I expected to be treated really well. That wasn't the case. They're also undergoing renovations, so there was drlling at 8 am, and of course, we got an old room in need of updating. I guess it's hit or miss right now there. I won't stay there again. Next time we plan a special weekend downtown, we will certainly find another hotel that will give us the special experience we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated . . . Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: GOOU
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, and very friendly staff. However, the physical condition of the property has certainly fallen behind the competition. I use to be a regular at this hotel . . . but have not been back for 15 years. Rooms have not been well maintained (old carpets frayed at doors), wall paper peeling off of the walls, TV's from the 80's. There is currently construction going on in the lobby area, making it impossible to get to the restaurant without leaving the hotel and walking to an outside door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TWGeorge
Reviews.Content: Great Location; about 2 blocks to Michigan Ave shopping. Rooms are nice size and the staff is very friendly. The Concierge is great with good suggestions. A Big plus, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can we move in?”
Reviews.Author: travellytimes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in the Fairmont Chicago recently for a conference. We stayed in a spacious suite. All amenities appeared recently updated and in excellent shape. The bed was very comfortable. Views were great. I love their products in the bathroom and used them in the pristine tub two out of three nights. The room was so quiet, it was very relaxing. We ate in the restaurant downstairs (Aria) and although pricey, it was excellent. The staff were consistently attentive and responsive. It is evident that everyone is very well-trained. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star? No way!”
Reviews.Author: niftyc
Reviews.Content: Outmoded and worn furnishings combine with some poor original design choices to produce a drab place to stay. This hotel's five-star rating needs a downgrade! When I visited this hotel 14 years ago, The Fairmont was among the classiest brands. No more. My 29th floor room was expansive, but dark -- only one small window and one light was not working. The upholstery was frayed, the bathtub faucet produced only a trickle of water, and the room's door didn't close unless you pulled on it in a certain way. Worse, the management has filled the room with price lists and displays of things to sell you, with one set of snacks even in a large tacky plastic case on the dresser. It was like sleeping in an old vending machine, but when I looked for a pen to take a phone message, there was none to be found. Other reviewers remarked that this hotel "needs updating," but I think some of the original design choices are also to blame. For instance, someone decided to place a series of heavy doors in strange configurations. I couldn't sit on the toilet without leaving the door to the toilet cubby open -- the space wouldn't accommodate my legs. (I am not unusually tall.) There are so many great hotels in Chicago that deserve five stars, that the Fairmont shouldn't be able to compete. See my profile for better ideas. Niftyc

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel, just $91 found through travelzoo. We only stayed one night, but were very impressed. The sevice was fantastic from the moment we stepped up to the property. The hotel smelled wonderful and was immaculate. Our room, while not enormous was perfect. We had a great view of the city and lake. The bed was extremely comfortable. We never heard any noise outside of our room. The bathroom was nice sized considering we must have had one of the smaller rooms in the hotel, two could get ready very comfortably. Location was perfect, just off Michigan Ave and steps away from Millenium Park. We would definetly stay here again, especially if we could get this great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Thanksgiving Stay”
Reviews.Author: zoohouse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont on Thanksgiving night for a short little get away. We had a great time! First of all, because of it being Thanksgiving, we got a fantastic deal using the Fairmont's website ($129/night excluding taxes). Check-in could not have been more quick or efficient. I even commented to my husband in the elevator up to our room that I have never checked-in to a hotel so quickly! When making the reservation on-line I wrote in the "special request" box that we would love a fantastic view for our quick romantic get away, not knowing if anybody ever reads them or if it makes any difference. Well, they read them, and the woman who checked us in read it back to me (which sort of embarrassed me) and then gave us a free up-grade to the 30th floor with a wonderful view of Lake Michigan. The room was beautiful, as you can see from our pictures. It looked brand new and was spotless. The room was spacious, had a large flat screen TV, and was just overall lovely. The bed and pillows were comfortable as was the temperature in the room. Our bathrobes were cozy, the water pressure great. Anything you can think of was just what you would expect from a five star. The only thing that was not perfect was the coffee maker. It was some sort of fancy espresso deal and we think it was broken. We had very bad cups of coffee. But that wasn't enough to ruin our good time. Location is perfect! It is just north of Millenium Park. That means that you can park in the Millenium Park Parking Garage for $20.00 a day (instead of the outlandish prices charged at hotels) and walk just under two blocks to the hotel. The hotel is just a few blocks from Macy's (formerly Marshall Fields) and is a short walk to the river. We went out Thanksgiving evening and had a fabulous walk north of the river to see the Christmas lights and then found a little pub to enjoy a few drinks in. Wonderful time. The next day we walked to the Christkindlmarkt (which is lots of fun...you should go if you're in town around Christmas) and saw the Macy's window displays. Chicago is just so great anyway, but we had a fantastic getaway! And the Fairmont was icing on the cake and was a nice home base for our activities. Check out was smooth...but we were charged $20 for items that we never took out of the mini-bar. I found this when we returned home. No big deal. A quick phone call and the charges were promptly removed. We were really lucky to get such a bargain for our room. It made it that much grander. But, I would definitely recommend this hotel to any vacationers or weekenders.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: NYGolfer23
Reviews.Content: 2 Bedroom Suite was spacious but the room needs upgrading, shower and TV's are from the 80's. Room was not ready till after 3pm. Bed was very comfortable and sushi restaurant downstiars had a good vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pretty Okay, Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: DallasTricia
Reviews.Content: Recently enjoyed a three night stay here. The hotel overall is nice with typical signs of aging. Our room was spacious and very accommodating, but probably could use a good deep cleaning as evidenced by the dust on the furnishings. Bed was very comfortable. Slept like a baby. Somehow my photo of the entire room didn't download properly so can't show you the size of room, but it was definitely one of the largest non-suites I've stayed in. The view was off the charts. Bathroom was nice and large with separate water closet, shower, and tub, all tiled in pretty marble. The concierge club was nicely decorated (a lot more updated than rest of hotel) with awesome views, great continental breakfast, and chic snacks in the evening and two computers with easy Internet access but not worth the extra expense, in my opinion. I think it's a romantic property based on location and cozy, traditional furnishings. It's a block or two east of Michigan Avenue in a quiet little area so it was nice to return afer experiencing the hustle and bustle of the city. The best description is "nice." I wasn't blown away but when my husband is in town for business he enjoys it for the location, which is less than a 5 minute walk to the office, and the room service. Try the halibut.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: OutofKansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont two nights for the SOFA art fair at the Navy Pier. I was impressed that the bellman called us by name when he met the taxi and pronounced it correctly, which is quite unusual. Everyone smiled and welcomed us. The lobby looks clean and friendly, not ultramodern, but not at all tired or worn. Our room, also clean and comfortably furnished, was larger than we expected, with a clean, modern bath and a lovely view of the Navy Pier and the lake. We did not eat at the restaurant, but it looked attractive. Our only problem was that we had asked for non-feather pillows, upon reserving the room, upon checking in, and calling housekeeping. After waiting an hour, we went to bed. The next day the check-in desk person was extremely apologetic and by the time we returned, all the feathers were replaced with foam and non-allergenic materials. The hotel is convenient to Millenium Park and Michigan Ave. We would stay there again, assuming we could get good rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great, except for the beds”
Reviews.Author: prairiemom
Reviews.Content: This is luxury hotel in a location that is walkable to many if not most Chicago tourist sights; Millenium Park, State Street shopping, the Art Institute, Archicenter, Oriental Theater and great River 21 cinema, plus it's just a bit of a hike to the Water Tower area. Catch the #10 or #6 bus south to the Museum of Science and Industry ($2 exact change fare) to see one of the world's greatest museums. Chicago style pizza is about a block away at Giordano's. We also ate at Sopprafina's, a nice lunch place (with some al fresco tables) in the Aon complex next store (ground level). That area also offers a full service post office and Starbucks. Also nearby is the new Tavern at the Park restaurant. We couldn't get in there because we didn't have reservations so plan ahead if you want to go. ( It's supposed to have a great view of Millenium Park.) The Fairmont offers a swanky bar, highly rated restaurant (Aria), elegant furnishings, bathrobes, etc. Having stayed at many hotels in the Loop and Chicago, this one was the quietest of all. Super quiet, both in terms of exterior noise and room to room noise. The only reason we would not come back here is the beds. They were very uncomfortable. The room had two full-sized beds (not queen) and they just did not support two average-sized adults. A restless night and morning backache just aren't acceptable. However, for the single traveler this place would be great. 4 stars for the Fairmont but if we are traveling with the kids, we will probably opt for the Doubletree or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Bland and expensive”
Reviews.Author: groggery1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a really good location, but I found it bland and not particularly good value. The room was a reasonable size, with all the mod cons, but there was something about the atmosphere that made me think guests were a bit of an interruption to the running of the hotel. They tend to charge you extra for just about everything (wireless internet? why?) though the business centre downstairs sent my postcards for free. The gym is a great experience, worth the 20US just to see the place. I had a great swim, and the atmosphere was excellent. They will also lend you an umbrella if it starts to rain.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from October 19, 2007 to October 21, 2007 in room 1705. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel, its staff, and the room itself. My wifeâ€™s employer paid for the room so it would be really obnoxious for me to complain about anything. However, for the integrity of this review I will pretend I paid the going rate when evaluating my hotel stay. The room was above average in terms of space and the bathroom area was exceptional. The bed was very comfortable and the quality of the pillows and sheets was very good. The room came with a minibar we did not use. It had separate shower and tub parts as well as a separate area for the toilet. The tub was very large as well. The bathroom had two vanity areas, one with a makeup mirror. We particularly liked the quality of the complimentary shampoos and lotions. There were complimentary bathrobes as well. The television had a large selection of channels to choose from. Our room had a nice view of Millennium Park. Other rooms had nice views of the Navy Pier. The lobby area was spacious. There were 7 elevators and they were very quick. The staff of the hotel was its greatest asset. Everyone was very friendly and constantly offering to help. While we were walking through the front doors my wife commented to me how thirsty she was. The doorman overheard her comment and immediately got her a free bottle of water. There were also free water bottles when we were waiting to be checked in. The hotel is located in a very good section of Chicago close to the river. It is just a short walk from Michigan Avenue a.k.a. â€œThe Magnificent Mile.â€� There was a Walgreens 5 minutes away where we loaded up on snacks and drinks. We recommend Bobâ€™s Bike Hike located a short walk up Michigan Avenue. They provided a nice guided tour of Northern Chicago. Our stay was not perfect though. Probably the most disappointing aspect of the hotel is the â€œreduced feeâ€� use of the athletic facility next door. The hotel itself does not have a pool or gym, but they have an arrangement with a top quality athletic club next to the hotel. However, to use the facility costs $20.00 a day! If the Fairmont wishes to call itself a five-star hotel and charge guests $200+ a night, guests should not be charged to use a gym or swim in a pool. Even lesser quality Best Westerns or Holiday Inns will often have free use of a gym, pool, or hot tub. Also, although we were offered free bottles of water by the staff, in the room there was a bottle of water next to the minibar. To drink that water would result in a $10.00 charge to your hotel bill, yes, $10.00! That is simply insulting. Although we usually avoid staying in fancy hotels to save money, this hotel definitely stood out and met almost all of our expectations. We would stay here again. Marc T. Hardekopf

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: jonnevin
Reviews.Content: Great stay! The staff could not be friendlier, the facilities are nice and it really was a great value $169 per night. Close to the river, few blocks to subway. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, staff, gym and linens”
Reviews.Author: BoteroS
Reviews.Content: Best views! Most terrific gym. Not sure how anyone could say it has limited number of machines. The linens are superb. High parking rates but what tourist drives a car here. Will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Not great location”
Reviews.Author: halliegreene
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great- clean rooms, good ammenities, nice staff, etc. The location, however, was a bit removed from the mix. When you walk out of the hotel there is not much around- you must walk a few blocks to reach any action- resturants, the park, stores, etc. We still walked all over Chicago and had a great time but would have prefered a better location. Last year I stayed at Hotel 71 and that hotel/location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travel213
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Fairmont Chicago for a weekend retreat. My husband and I enjoyed every minute of our mini trip. We often take these weekend getaways and prefer to stay at 5 star hotels. We loved the location, it's quiet and not to far from anything. The concierge were fantastic, and always efficient with their services. We loved the Nine steak house, and the ghost bar. We also went to the Rockit bar and grille which was a great atmosphere with classic rock music, and a great burger. chicago has fantastic shopping along Michigan ave, and side streets. We loved the Neiman Marcus store and Saks across the way. Chicago is a great city!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with discounted rooms”
Reviews.Author: servoz2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Fairmont in August. This hotel heavily discounts its room rates, which makes it an attractive place to stay for the traveler that is looking for a convenient downtown location and nothing particularly special. The complimentary continental breakfast was ho-hum, comparable to a comfort inn. I did use the free fitness room, which had a limited number of cardio machines. The hotel was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: zeefla
Reviews.Content: In town for a conference and got a great rate. Hotel location was excellent, right next to Millenium Park. Walk to Michigan Ave, Lake, North Pier and Navy Pier. Close to restaurants, Art Institute, Cultural Center and architectural boat tours. Hotel staff outstanding! The hotel has a first come/first serve complimentary Bentley! Lucky enough to ride in it on a Saturday night - we felt very cool! The hotel asked what we wanted and we got it - local paper in the morning rather than NY paper, regular coffee maker instead of a capp. maker, etc. Restaurant food delicious and service super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller43
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel with large and bright rooms. The location was also great, walking distance from major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong with the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: mwk17
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four-night stay at the Fairmont Chicago. This is a wonderful hotel. Our room was always immaculate. One funny thing was that the staff inconsistently set up the room. We were given mouthwash on the first day only. On the first two days, there was no coffee maker. Magically, one appeared on the third day (it was a fancy espresso machine). None of these quirks matter to me, but I know some travelers on these boards blow a gasket over this stuff, so I wanted to point it out. One incredible thing was that even though there was construction outside, our room was always quiet. Service at the hotel was fantastic. Our bags were delivered to our room very quickly, and the bellhop was great about setting up our suitcases. When we called downstairs to let the management know our TV didn't work right, they immediately sent up a maintenance worker who fixed the problem. Transportation from the hotel was very easy - whenever we wanted a cab, there was always one idling outside. We never used the Bentley, since we never went anywhere glamorous enough that we wouldn't feel flashy showing up in it. The hotel gives guests free passes to the ENORMOUS adjoining Lakeshore Athletic Club. Given the amount of cheese and bacon we ate on this trip, it was great to have such a nice gym. My wife purchased a session with a personal trainer who was very up-to-date on the latest exercise machines and techniques and charged a reasonable fee. Others have commented on the speed of the elevators. They really are amazing - we never had to wait more than 15 seconds for service (yes, I timed it). We live in NYC and spend a good deal of our lives waiting for elevators, so this was a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: nguyens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for the Chicago Air and Water Show. We arrived early and we were able to check in right away. The service was great!!!! We were upgraded to a Lake View room. We were in room 2003 on the 20th floor. The room was nice. The view was incredible, we had a south view of the city, millenium park, grant park, and the musuem campus. We were able to see Buckingham Fountain it was a very nice view. We liked the fact that the windows opened, it was great to get fresh air in the room. The decor was ok, it reminded me of something my grandmother would find as "fancy" not as modern as I like but very nice. The bedding was comfortable, there were marble tops on the dressers and bed stands. The room was very large. The bathroom was great....seperate tub and shower, robes provided on the back door. They supplied enough towels (so many hotels are stingy with towels) the bath supplies were nice, and the toliet was in an enclosed area with a sliding door. There were marble tops and floors in the bathroom but once again it seemed a little worn. There was a vanity with lights outside the bathroom...it was very 80's but a nice touch if updated. We had no use for the closet since we were there just one night but it was huge. Room service was very good, very quick and polite. We ordered 2 sandwiches one with fries, one with salad. We also ordered chicken fingers from the kids menu with fruit salad. It was great!!!! Very efficient, the gentleman who brought our food set up a table in the room and we rather enjoyed the dinner and experience. It cost about $50 which in the Chicago Michigan Avenue area at this is a good price for in-room dining for three. The fruit salad was out of this world not 3 pieces of melon thrown on the plate it had blueberries, rasberries, blackberries, cantalope and honeydew. The salad was also good not just a few pieces of iceburg....it had a european blend with carrots, tomatoes and cucumbers. The breakfast buffet was adequate. Not worth the $25 per person. Our daughter was free, but the buffet was not replenished and consisted of 2 types of eggs, sausage, bacon, fruit, yogurt and pastries...there was also some lox, capers, tomatoes and onions. If you need to eat in the hotel it is ok but if you can venture out to Michigan Ave. there was some places for much less money and better quality. I am suprised since other Fairmont's I have stayed at (Banff) have the most incredible breakfast buffets. The staff in the restaurant were very sweet. Georgia in the restaurant was especially nice. The coffee was great!!!! The lobby is beautiful with nice places to sit, even thought it is all marble and grand...it is very warm and inviting. The location is great for Navy Pier and Michigan Ave. and Millenium Park. We self parked at AON Center to save money, Valet is over $40. Over all we loved this place...it was nice, friendly, the room was large and the location was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average for the level”
Reviews.Author: prashpai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Chicago the first weekend of August 2007. The check-in person was very nice, and took our luggage tags promising to get our stuff delivered to our room. 1.5 hours and numerous calls later we still hadnt received our luggage in our room. I finally had to go downstairs and track down our luggage with the bell man. Our room was on the sixth floor with a lakeview (supposedly), but could only see a small sliver of the lake with numerous other buildings blocking our view. There is another building planned to come up right in front of it in around 2-3 years and that should block all the remaining view plus provide lots of construction disturbance in the meantime. The room itself was fine and clean and spacious. But given the star level and how much I paid for this room, I expected a whole lot more. I found the Swissotel across the street much nicer compared to this.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner23
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago the week of Independence Day for vacation. I was very pleased with the Fairmont Chicago. The room I stayed in was very clean and in good order. I dined at the hotel each night of my stay. I was pleased with the vegetarian choices since I am mostly vegetarian. The room service was quick and friendly. The Fairmont Chicago is in an ideal location. I walked to the Art Institute and the Archictectural River Cruise. And it was a short hop by public transit to the Museum of Contemporary Art and The Historical Society. I am a runner and I was glad to use the indoor track in the adjacent health club. I told them that I was a Fairmont President's Club member and was able to use the facility free. I recommend this hotel to others and plan to return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: ReconChicago
Reviews.Content: Made last minute reservations to stay overnight for the nearby Taste of Chicago and the fireworks. Just a great hotel thoughout. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 4 day business trip. The rooms in this hotel are very nice. The beds are very comfortable, business set up is more than adequate with very good internet service. Rooms are spacious and clean, with the bathroom set away from the main area of the room. Guests have the choice of either a shower stall or sit-in bath. Save yourself some money and join their President's Club and you receive free telephone and internet usage. This savings can be substantial. The one thing that stood out here was the staff. My name was always used and you felt the guest's experience was very important. Doormen taking the time to check cabs for left items when each guest departed a cab. When I pointed this out to one of the doormen his answer was "This is your home while your in Chicago. I wouldn't want your time here to be ruined by a lost phone." I appreciate that, since it has happend before. This hotel also has a great lobby lounge, which is the perfect meeting place for socializing. The staff here is also quick and polite. Although I did not eat at the restaurant I have heard that it is very good too. The only drawback is the valet parking charge of $45 per day. I understand that parking is at a premium in Chicago, but $45 seems high. So, my two tips, invest in the cab ride from the airport and join their President's Club. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “First rate Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: 212Girl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fairmont a couple of times now, for business. The rooms are very comfortable, especially the beds - important to business travelers! There is a nice desk with internet connection, did not have any problems getting on line. The bathroom is separated from the room, which just creates a little nicer "living" space. I recommend a higher floor, have heard there are sometimes noise issues at night -- i did not experience this as i stayed on higher floor. There is a nice bar in the front of the lobby, as well as a restaurant. Plus there is a decent sized convenience store, these amenities are nice since it is not located on Michigan Ave like some of its competitors are. The fitness club is not owned by Fairmont, but they do comp you a pass at the gym next door, which is huge and very nice - and just a short underground walk. Overall I would call the Fairmont a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Join the President's Club before booking”
Reviews.Author: nctraveler123
Reviews.Content: To keep from paying additional fees for phones and Internet use, join the President's Club before you book your stay. I stayed four nights, Sunday through Thursday, and would have been charged for Internet use and phone use each day. They are free with membership in the President's Club. There was a huge line for checking in. The President's Club only line got me through check-in quickly. The rooms are very comfortable and the staff were friendly and always willing to help. I was there for a large conference and the serving staff for meals provided as part of the conference were excellent. The food was also prepared well and tasted great. I never used the restaurant, but others were describing the experience as superb. The Taste of Chicago was ending the day I arrived. I walked to the park from the Fremont and had a wonderful time getting the sample sizes from several vendors. The Navy Pier is a little far to walk, but with good shoes and company, I recommend the visit. Be sure to visit the Stained Glass Museum there. I will stay here again if I visit Chicago in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: GrammyBecky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont on July 6 & 7. While this isn't the most physically appealing hotel, the staff from the bellhops, front desk, concierges to housekeeping were well trained in customer service. They were all a delight! My meals and room at the hotel were great. The food is a little high but the quality was good. My room had a beautiful view of the city. My concerns were the poor condition of the entry you have to walk over to get to the front entrance. I wear heels and I was always having to dodge the big holes and cracks in the brick. Not a good thing. There is a nice deli/store very close to the Fairmont called Bockwinkles. Great place to stock up on soda, snacks and inexpensive freshly made sandwiches. I loved Chicago and plan to go back. I would consider the Fairmont if the price were right but there are alot of hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: madeinmichigan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed at many hotels in Chicago and have to say that this is, by far, the best experience we've had in the windy city. We usually have someone house sit while we are away but this time they were not available so we had to bring along our dog. I was very concerned about which hotels would accept dogs and also where we would walk her. Staying in the heart of Michigan Ave. really didn't seem like an option, since this area is mostly cement. I found that the Fairmont is the answer... 1.5 blocks to Millenium Park and Grant Park, 3-4 blocks to the theatre district (WICKED is a must see), 1.5 blocks to S. Michigan Ave., 2-3 blocks to Lake Michigan. The room was very spacious, clean and quiet and we had an exceptional view of the city AND the lake (Room # 1106). The staff is extremely courteous and Aria restaraunt is fabulous. Don't miss it. We ventured down to Aria during our last night for a drink and were very disappointed that we didn't check it out earlier; Loved the ambiance, staff, and the drinks. Everything is within walking distance but make sure you have some good walking shoes. We had sandals and after walking down to Water Tower Place we were developing blisters so had to stop and get some tennis shoes. I cannot compliment the Fairmont enough. EVERYTHING was perfect and we will definately be staying here whenever we go to Chicago, which is about twice a year. P.S. My dog really loved this hotel too and the attention she got from everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated & poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: jkirkc
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Fairmont for 3 nights. The staff(except the front desk & weekend manager) were nice, especially the concierge & bell-hops. Our room was a little worn down & the a/c would not keep the room cool. The hallways were dirty & stained on our floor(33rd). We enjoyed ourselves anyway, not letting the accommodations dictate whether we had a good time or not. Things went downhill upon checkout. We booked a rate that included a $50.00 dollar room credit for any charges used in the bar, restaurant or mini-bar for each night staying there. We even made a special effort to visit the front desk to make sure we followed their rules the first night. They conveniently "forgot" to credit any of the room charges per THEIR promotion upon auto checkout. I went to the front desk & I had to explain the promotion to them. I had printed out the info from the Fairmont website before hand. The front desk clerk & then weekend manager at first said that you had to spend exactly $50.00 dollars for it to be applied. After I explained to her how absurd that would be she then proceed to rudely tell me it only applied per night, i.e. from check in to midnight was one night. Which made it impossible to have breakfast & dinner on the same day or breakfast on the day of checkout. It took 20 minutes to get it even partly right. They seemed to be perturbed that we would question their billing. The worst part of the ordeal was the attitude of the Manager on duty that at first refused to even credit any charges and then still left over $60.00 that should have been credited back. It was not the money that made us mad(we had 2 dinners elsewhere that each cost $250.00+ that weekend), it was the rudeness & ineptness of the manager that made me dig my heels in. I feel it was fraud to offer the promotion & not follow thru. For some reason the manager tried to set up her own rules & not follow the corporate policies. I will have a hard time staying at another Fairmont ever again. The hotel is a 2 1/2 star(maybe) but the front desk & manager turned it into a one star. They should sell their Bentley and invest in customer relations classes

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Amazing Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Katze
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at this hotel for a business trip and just loved it. The room was gorgeous and it had the biggest, nicest bathroom I've seen in a hotel, and I've been in a lot of hotels. The restaurant just blew me away. I ate 3 meals (b,l,d) there and they were all incredible. In fact I still think one of the best meals I've ever had (and I eat out plenty on the company) was at Aria. If you like Asian Fusion and don't mind spending some money, don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “More than described/expected”
Reviews.Author: pegisue62
Reviews.Content: This was luck of the draw as we attempted to book a quality hotel during the first weekend of "Taste". The rooms were larger than expected and quite comfortable. More importantly was both the location and the use of the house car to get to local downtown attractions/restaurants with ease. You could not have asked for a better/more imformative staff. We would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but there are hotels in better location for the same price.”
Reviews.Author: am88
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a nice hotel and for the most part we were happy with the room. However, for the same price one can stay on Michigan Ave. -- like at the Intercontinental and be close to shopping, restaurants, etc. If I had it to do over, I would book a different hotel.
