The service was substandard. We were never given fresh glasses once we used the first set that was in the room when we arrived. Additionally, the few requests that we made -- pillows, microwave and fresh glasses took HOURS to get to us and in the case of the glasses we NEVER got fresh ones. The microwave took 4 hours and when it arrived it was a huge 1980's model that wouldn't even fit on any surface in the room! The front dest was helpful or tried to be but once the info. left the front desk things fell apart. I would stay at another property for the same money ... more centrally located to Michigan Ave. -- it was nice and the beds were comfy,.

Reviews.Title: “Generally Good But Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Westby
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in late May 2007 for a conference. The hotel location is very central, just one block south of the river and a couple of blocks east of Michigan Ave. The first thing that struck me was the very high level of service from everyone with whom I had contact (reception, concierge, doorman, porter, etc), therefore I was a little surprised when some things weren't quite right. When we arrived at the room (32nd floor) there was a used fold-up cot in the room that hadn't been taken away by housekeeping. This was quickly (and very apologetically) taken care of. Also, on the last day housekeeping came by very early (8am) to see if we were ready to check-out - not sure why, and it seemed like they were trying to rush us. The room itself was a decent size and was fairly well appointed, but not luxurious. One minor note - considering we were on the 32nd floor we never had to wait long for an elevator. Overrall, the hotel is obviously very proud of its high level of service, however little things prevent me from giving it a very high rating. We paid the conference rate of $230 - higher than I'm used to paying for a hotel room, therefore I'm probably holding it to a higher standard than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: McGee_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and just returned from a weekend stay at the Fairmont. Overall, we had a very good stay. Though we booked a standard room, they gave us a room with a view of the lake on a high floor. We heard a bit too much noise from the halls (mostly our neighbor's door slamming, which woke me up early Sat. morning) so the very accommodating front desk manager moved us to a better and more expensive room for the same price. It was a great room with an even better view. It was worth asking the manager since the young inexperienced front desk staff weren't inclined to do as much for us. It's a very nice hotel, with a very comfortable bed and chairs, nice room amenities, big bathroom with separate shower and bath, very clean, pretty tasty breakfast and room service (at prices generally reasonable for these sort of hotels). Also, it's an excellent location--within walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and very close to Millenium and Grant Parks and the Lake. The only downsides: the concierge folks generally didn't know much about the area or Chicago (perhaps they were students, like some of the young front desk staff seemed to me); and the room shower needed updating. I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time... excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this four-star hotel. As a member of the Fairmont President's Club, I was upgraded to a suite with a lake view. The hotel is situated a few blocks from Lakeshore Drive and a few condo towers block some of the view, but I loved looking out at the lake nonetheless. The lobby is very plush... if you squint, it looks like a Four Seasons. My suite was extremely well-maintained with new carpeting and wallpaper, but the style was a little like an early 90s Ritz-Carlton and somewhat underfurnished. The bed was not bad, not amazing. No plasma TVs here. The bathroom was large and mostly marble, but the shower stall was covered in cheap yellow bathroom tile... a weird choice but since the hotel dates back to the late 80s, probably original to the room. Another great thing... for a hotel of this size (almost 700 rooms), I never had to wait for an elevator. It does make a difference when you stay several days. On the weekend when I arrived, the hotel was full of families staying at the great weekend rate ($199). Alas, the one next door woke me at 6:15 AM with their screaming toddlers, who apparently were encouraged to be as loud and obnoxious as they could be by their parents for the next three hours. Finally had to call the front desk to complain. After the rude family checked out, however, the suite was very quiet. As the week progressed, the hotel filled up with a very nice, well-dressed international convention crowd. It made for a much nicer stay. Free internet access can be had in the business center for 30 minutes... a nice touch, considering the last Westin I stayed at charged me a dollar a minute to go online. Valet parking is $45 a night, with in and out privileges. You can probably do a little better in the numerous garages nearby, but not that much better. Had one breakfast in the hotel's very nice restaurant Aria... excellent service by a female server named Michael. The rest of the time, walked over to a little Italian place next to the Hotel 71 on the river (ask the concierge). It has a fantastic location, if they let you dine outside. If not, there's a Corner Bakery next door with outdoor dining. Weather permitting, I found it's a great city to dine outdoors in. The Fairmont is located on the south side of the river adjacent to the large Lakeshore East development of tall condo towers. There are very few restaurants nearby, and even fewer shops... but the setting is far less touristy than anything on Michigan Avenue, which is a relatively short walk away. The good news is you can easily walk to the amazing Art Institute and new Millennium Park a few blocks south. The latter features a stunning outdoor mirrored sculpture that was a highlight of my trip. They just started building (this week) a 900 foot high condo/hotel tower across the street called Aqua (which will apparently house another Fairmont Hotel) which may block the already partially obscured lake view. Also, the Blue Cross building across the street is also adding 24 stories to its height... so there may be some noise issues soon while staying at the Fairmont. But Chicago is in the middle of a building boom, so what can you do? All in all, the Fairmont was an excellent place to stay in a surprisingly great city. I had a wonderful time, in no small part to my spacious suite in the very well run hotel. Fairmonts (in my experience) aren't quite at the level of a Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton, but when you can get one for a great price, they are a really tempting alternative. A few Chicago tips from my stay... the burger place at the Sheraton a few blocks away has really tasty burgers and a riverfront location with tables outside. There's also a tavern/restaurant called (I believe) Lizzie O'Neil's next door where they have a sidewalk dining under the trees and next to the river as well. I recommend the tuna sandwich. If you want to see the night scene on Rush Street (at the north end of Michican Avenue), the Tavern on Rush has pretty good food and the best sidewalk dining in the area. If you're lucky (or unlucky, in my opinion), you may even get to see a solo Jerry Springer walk by your table checking out the loud, happy people drinking and eating there. There's a charming outdoor dining area at the Art Institute with good food, really friendly service (which I didn't always find in Chicago) and amazing ambience under the leafy trees and adjacent to the large fountain. Definitely take the architectural river tour of Chicago's skyscrapers. Go to chicagoline.com for details (there are several of these tours, but this company does a smart, classy job with extremely well-informed guides and even gives you free lemonade and cookies). Good pizza can be found two blocks from the hotel at Giordano's (a chain in Chicago). Really good prices, surprisingly good food. One last thought: I have NEVER been to a city (and this includes New York and Beijing) where I have encountered ruder drivers. The cabbies will actively try to run you down (not kidding) if you enter a crosswalk in front of them, and local drivers are almost as aggressive. It's an unpleasant local trait that the city really needs to work on. It made me appreciate the courtesy L.A. drivers will give you, and that's saying something.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: WirralShellman
Reviews.Content: Great location and quality place to stay. Lovely large clean room with a queen size bed it was great. Staff were very helpful and put us onto some great restaurants and then some music bars. Coleman on the front desk was a great guy to meet as a first impression he sold the hotel to us with his personality. The hotel delivered an anniversary cake to us in our room (compliments of the hotel) for me this showed that they care about their guests Many thanks to all it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Merits Another Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fearful
Reviews.Content: We were guests of the Fairmont from April 27 to May 3 while attending the International Trademarks Association annual meeting. The hotel was an official one and we paid a rate of $239.00 per night. We are members of the Presidentâ€™s Club, so we had complimentary internet service and access to the Athletic Club. The latter is a membership facility not exclusive to hotel guests. It connects to the hotel but is off-site. We took a look at the gym but found the distance and more public nature of the facility off-putting. The hotel is well located to the Magnificent Mile, the Art Institute, and many fine restaurants. Our room did not have the vistas that some posters have reported: we looked at other high rises, not the park or lake. It was, however, quite spacious and featured some welcome touches, like a valet stand and shoe polisher. The bathroom had both a separate shower and bathtub. There was also an ante-room with vanity, mirror, and closet that I particularly enjoyed. Fittings are typical, but the bedding, including linen, was very comfortable. Two bathrobes were provided and towels were thick and plentiful. The only deficiency in terms of amenities -- no coffee maker. An a la carte breakfast, however, is served featuring pastries, yogurt, fresh fruit, and coffee in the hotelâ€™s beautiful lobby each morning and the price point is reasonable. A more formal breakfast is served in the hotelâ€™s restaurant, Aria. (Our review of that is posted). Concierge service was excellent. Gail and Hailey suggested many lovely restaurant choices and secured reservations on limited notice. All staff were extremely friendly and gracious. The hotel offers a refresh service of the room in the evening that requires that one call. Two bottles of water, turn down, fresh towels, and a general cleaning of the room are provided. This service was spotty. We also had some problems with regular housekeeping service. Our view of hotels is that there will typically be problems: the litmus test is how a hotel handles these problems. We ultimately felt heard and the hotel rectified all issues. Moreover, they provided us with the use of the hotelâ€™s Bentley one evening, complimentary certificates for breakfast, and sent a fruit plate as compensation gestures. To sum up, we enjoyed the hotel and would most definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “I love the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: RocketAlameda
Reviews.Content: I never stayed at a Fairmont before my one night stay and did not know what to expect. I thought it would be stuffy and have steered clear of the chain in the past. I have been wrong. The hotel was reasonably priced compared to other hotels with the same rating. My room had a view of the shore line and was three blocks from Michigan Ave. The bathroom amenities were very nice and the soap smelled of lemons. The casual brunch offering on Sunday was nice and uncomplicated. You could help yourself to toast, fruit, coffee, and cereal (for a price of course). The best thing in the room was the automatic shoe cleaner, the thick bath robe, and comfy bed with down pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cityrider76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont this month for business/fun and it was a great hotel. The room was comfortable and the hotel had that neat old world style that makes you feel like a princess. The staff was able to get us last minute reservations on a saturday night at a nice restaurant for a large group and they were happy to provide directions to whereever we were travelling. I will mention that they didn't seem to be able to make suggestions for anything beyond the loop area but their suggestions were all good. The staff was great and we enjoyed the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, complimentary ride in their bently great stay all round”
Reviews.Author: NHamptonTraveller
Reviews.Content: after being really let down on the day we arrived in chicago after an 8hr flight by the hyatt regency we looked elsewhere for a room for 5 days. The fairmont offered a great rate over the phone and could not have been more accomodating at what was very short notice. The room was spacious spotless with a great view 3609. Concerige were really helpful with sorting out our restaurant and sport booking and the front desk were polite and efficient. Room service was expensive especially the bottled water. Beds were extremely comfortable. The bentley ride really finished off the trip, we'd asked for a cab and out of nowhere the bell suggested we took the hotel car, felt like lord and lady for the 15 min journey. Really really great experience at the fairmont, would definately make it my favored hotel in chicago again

Reviews.Title: “Exorbitant Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Chocalate
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to be staying at the Fairmont, until I got there. After having dealt with Fairmont Royal York in Toronto for years, I was sure I wouldn't regret my choice. The room was very luxurious with a king size bed, and wonderful sheets and pillows. Exactly as described in the website. The temperature in the room was just right, and the view of the city was great! But that's all you got for your money. None of the standard items were included. If you wanted your morning coffee, you had to call in-room dining, and be charged $6USD a person for the delivery plus the cost of the coffee. The water in the room was $6USD as well, so if you're thirsty, it's the tap water from the bathroom. YUCK! I had pre-arranged for a crib for my 10 week old son, and was advised upon checking in the crib was already in the room. Except when we got there, it wasn't there. When called, a hospitality staff brought an assembled Graco Pack N Play, and dropped it unceromoniously in the room. If I had known that was what my son would be sleeping in, I would've brought my own from home! I do have to complement the chef on the dinner we had the first night. We had in-room dining, and it was fantastic. The couscous was perfectly spiced, and the steak was just right! If only the proper steak knife had been provided! It was an adventure trying to cut the steak with what I could only call a pointy butter knife! Overall I was very disappointed with my stay at the Fairmont. Instead of feeling pumpered as I expected, I felt gouged. I wouldn't be staying at the Fairmont again.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteless Money Grubbing”
Reviews.Author: DWGriffith
Reviews.Content: The nickeling and diming happens in units of Five and Ten dollars! First they charge a premium rate and then include practically nothing! The rooms are basically average and small and nothing special. Over-all, this is an experience in tastelessness. The Fairmont name may be a legacy from the mining culture of San Francisco, but there was more to that world than just digging for every dime you could get. How sad.

Reviews.Title: “Not a classic, but close”
Reviews.Author: kbchase
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the middle of the summer during a heat wave. Our air conditioning broke, as did two fans, leaving us in a stifling triple-digit heat in our house. We would have settled for something much cheaper, but everything in the city was booked on such short notice (as in, "Do you have any rooms available in the next half hour?" kinda short notice, at 2am). All I can say is wow. We took three days off and just enjoyed ourselves, even though the A/C was fixed after the first day. There was a time when the type of luxury at the Fairmont was something special, like the TV you can watch while soaking in the tub, or the telephone you can answer without leaving the toilet. The only knock on this Fairmont is that it is not exactly unique, especially compared to some of their other properties, or to some of the special properties in Chicago. But this property did make me a big fan of the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called nickle and dime hotel”
Reviews.Author: pad_lake
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was nice, the room was as described, and the lake view was beautiful (got a free upgrade to Deluxe room). The two major problems are: the pool / health club, although described as being on site, are "adjacent" to the hotel as the Lake Shore Athletic Club, with a per person / day fee of $25 and the continental breakfast is charged by item (example $1.50 for a piece of fruit, $3.00 for a single bagel, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance for everyone”
Reviews.Author: hominid
Reviews.Content: Entering the lobby felt like slipping into "bluesy" Chicago in all its splendour. This hotel was fantastic on all accounts, and well located between Millenium Park and The Magnificent Mile, each within a 5 minute walking distance. Staying at the hotel comes at an expense, but is well-priced considering what you get in return. I would definitely go back again. The hotel's service was faultness. The hotel staff were exceptional and everyone made the extra effort to make me feel welcome and at home. There was a sense of personal pride and genuine interest that seemed to motivate service excellence. My room was spacious, with great views of Navy Pier in the distance, and provided all the comforts including a great mini bar, an unbelievably comfortable bed and luxurious bathroom with dressing area. I thought the layout was superb. My only qualm was that I would have expected a more glamorous bath to go with the rest of the room, but then perhaps I'm being overly fussy (given that everything else was so good, why shouldn't I be). I loved the added perks in the room - shoe buffer and valet stand. The hotel has a brilliant restaurant - the sushi was first-class. Room service was great too - well recommended. The park across the way seemed to attract a local crowd - walking their dogs or playing sport. This place will be hard to forget, for all the right reasons. This is what hotels should be like.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant place”
Reviews.Author: livetotravelPA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont to attend a conference. I was very pleased with the hotel. The doorman offered me an umbrella as I headed out for a walk... and sure enough it started to rain very soon after- I would have been soaked with it. Upon my return, the doorman then asked about my walk, etc. This is reflective of all the staff I encountered. The front desk promptly checked me in. DEFINITELY register for their rewards program before you arrive... The complimentary gym access is excellent, plus you save on internet access fees which are waived for members. The bathroom and separate dressing areas were large and convenient. The only negative- no coffee maker! AND the Starbucks in the adjacent building is closed on weekends since the area corporate offices are closed those days!!! Otherwise my stay was perfect, considering the conference rate was $99 per night!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant, well priced stay”
Reviews.Author: chaucerquest
Reviews.Content: We booked The Fairmont for a one night stay after a black tie event downtown. Going directly through [--] we received a rate of $189.00 plus tax--a very good rate for a luxury hotel in Chicago. And I do consider the Fairmont a luxury hotel, even if it is not quite as pretty and glam as the Four Seasons or the Peninsula. The decor is elegant but bland (or soothing, depending on your taste). Our bargain rate room had a pretty view over Millenium Park, and a partial lake view (we could see the Shedd Aquarium and Plantarium). Service was excellent,: friendly and prompt. Because we joined the President's Club online before our stay, we had free access to the super duper fitness center next door to the hotel (adjacent via underground passage). However, we did get stuck with the $45.00 parking fee (yes, that's per day!). At least for that rate we got in and out privileges, and when we called for the car it always arrived promptly. We ate lunch at Aria and found it to be very good, but not outstanding by Chicago restaurant standards (which are very high indeed). The service, in particular, was slow and a little casual. We had to cancel our dessert order because it was taking so long to arrive, and we had matinee tickets.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: MARCOBARROS
Reviews.Content: good location. the room is big and the bed is very confortable, breakfast very expensive. concierge gave good suggestions of restaurants. The city is very nice, we enjoyed so much. I recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AreAnyNamesNotTaken
Reviews.Content: Obviously I wasn't expecting much in the way of character from a hotel as large as this (37 floors, with goodness knows how many rooms on each), but after one night here, the cold sterility was starting to suck the very life out of me. The rooms, while, of course, extremely comfortable, spotlessly clean and tidy, and all the other things that you would expect from a hotel of this quality, were desperately bland and characterless. The furniture in the lounge of my suite was in a uniform grey cloth, while the bathroom and bedroom were an early '90s-style symphony in beige. And this, I think, is the key problem here - what looked modern and stylish ten or fifteen years ago now looks like "posh Holiday Inn", and is sorely in need of an update, but Chicago's well publicised shortage of hotel rooms means that management have no incentive to spend money on refurbishing. The characterlessness was only enhanced by the icy efficiency of the desk staff, who did little to make me feel welcome, or alleviate my rather shaky state of mind after a long, trans-atlantic flight. Like the room, they were impeccably presented and faultlessly efficient, but simply lacking in any charm. And so it goes on: the restaurant too, whilst serving perfectly good food, is utterly lacking in any soul. Perhaps it was simply my expectations that were out of line (I still have very happy memories of the Fairmont in Banff, where I spent 10 days of my honeymoon), as I'm sure that, by its own standards, the hotel is doing nothing wrong. However, it didn't work for me, and I much prefer the city's various Kimpton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, good restaurant, great location”
Reviews.Author: butterfly00
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - directly south of the Chicago River, just a couple of blocks from the lake, a block from Millenium Park, walkable to pretty much all of the tourist attractions and much of the business district. The rooms are spacious and clean; service is good; overall a very pleasant stay. One thing I really liked was the huge lobby with comfortable seating, where people can hang out if they don't want to stay in their room, plus the restaurant downstairs (Aria's) which has a fun bar, a nice sit-down restaurant, and a sushi bar. Great hotel for tourists and for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Deal”
Reviews.Author: Paula V
Reviews.Content: I actually booked this reservation with the hotel over the phone and got a great rate -- much lower than the usual price! It was a lovely hotel, beautifully appointed, walking distance from the places we wanted to go. We would highly recommend the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in town!”
Reviews.Author: martinib
Reviews.Content: We have booked the Fairmont based on the very positive comments over here and we are absolutely satisfied with our choice. Early check-in was not a problem, neither was it late check-out. The city-view-room was fabulous with a great view on lake and city. All recommendations of the concierge for a city tour and a jazz club were reliable and excellent. Valet parking is a bit pricey for a 45$, better leave your car round the corner in an underground parking lot for some 16$. Restaurant Aria was a great choice as well, one of the best restaurants in town with a very obliging and warm service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: hoosier98
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay - classy, clean, great linens and service was outstanding. From bellmen to the servers at Aria (restaurant w/in hotel) everyone catered to and anticipated our every need. Location was great for our night - seeing Wicked at the Oriental Theatre and sightseeing the next morning. Aria was delish.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but pricy”
Reviews.Author: Greg92101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont for a conference. It is beautiful and only a few blocks from the Miracle Mile. The corner room had a view of Lake Michigan between other buildings and the bed was excellent. However, I did miss a refrigerator/microwave for snacking in the room. Because my employer paid I was able to experience what others pay up to $400/night. However I was not even tempted to touch the minibar or room service because of the expensive prices. The room had a shoe buffing machine, but no coffee maker. Room service coffee will end up costing about $8.00 for two cups. Myself and coworkers went out for meals because the hotel restaurant was just too expensive. Great location, clean rooms, beautiful public spaces, attentive staff. But they get you on the little things. Free New York Times every morning though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LisaMF
Reviews.Content: Got a last minute rate of $299 a night through Hotels.com. Requested a room with two double beds and wasn't disappointed. Staff was very professional. Food at Aria was delicious. Located right off of Michigan Avenue with prime shopping less than a block away. Cabs always available in front of hotel for longer excursions. To Park, enter off of Columbus Drive and let valet take care of it for you. All in all, an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travel-lover71
Reviews.Content: The room was more comfortable then we could have imagined...especially the bed! The room was very clean, comfortable, and big! It was larger than I expected, including the washroom. Loads of space to lounge around. And of course, as per Fairmont standards, the service was excellent. The location is great -- close to so many attractions and great shopping. We had a room with a city view, which was lovely. We got an excellent rate, so it really made the stay worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for Labor Day weekend for our first visit to Chicago. We got a ridulously affordable rate including breakfast every day, the only catch it was non refundable. I would suggest joining the Fairmont's presidents club, which is what we did and got free use of the gym, free internet daily and free late 3pm check out. The rooms were large, the beds comfortable. The only complaint we had was the shower, terrible water pressure. The hotel was clean, the staff helpful. Great location, a bit off Michigan Avenue so its quiet. When we go visit chicago again I would not stay anywhere else. Ask for the presidents club rate including breakfast and join the presidents club, its free!

Reviews.Title: “Up there with the best, ... almost.”
Reviews.Author: Nakina
Reviews.Content: My sons and I stayed at the Fairmont for 3 nights Aug 19,20 and 21. The Hotel is located only a block south of the Chicago River and two blocks off Michagan Avenue in a quiet area with just another hotel and some office building with some residential tower towards the lake. A peaceful spot but a brisk 5-7 minute walk to Michigan Avenue. We went to two games at Wrigley Field and the Red Line is only a 10-12 minute walk. The Fairmont is a very attractive hotel that is just starting to show some wear around the edges, but you have to look for it. Our rooms wer large and comfortable with great bathroom. Beds were very comfortable. The only drawback is the walls are a bit thin and so noise from the hall and from the next room were more easily heard than you would like. Having said that, apart from a couple having a lot of fun in the room next to me for a couple of hours one evening , this did not detract from the stay. The lobby has a very nice , large , comfortable area in the middle for drinks, reading and relaxing with wirless internet. There is coffee, bagels, juice, croissants, muffins available on a self serve basis each morning and it works very well. Only drawback is it was to be available until noon on Sunday but by 11 a.m. there was only coffee and a couple of muffins left and no attempt was made to supplement the supply. The staff was efficient and very friendly, particularly the front door staff. There was no turndown service at night but I didn't miss it. We didn't eat in the Hotel restaurant although it looked very nice . The overall atmosphere of the Fairmont was very calm, relaxing and comfortable. I have stayed at many Chicago hotels, including the Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton , Sheraton and others and I would rank this hotel just slightly below the Four Seasons and the Ritz Carlton on amenities but far ahead of the Drake and Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Exhorbitant rate for few amenities and indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: Celadon31
Reviews.Content: My friends and I travel together quite a lot. We had booked more than a month in advance and had requested two doubles, but despite the fact that we arrived at 11 in the morning, we were told that they were out of doubles, so we had to take a king (lumpy mattress) and a fiendishly uncomfortable rollaway (the good news: they didn't charge us for the rollaway). The room was so small that the rollaway barely fit, so that we had to crawl over the person in it to get to the bathroom in the middle of the night. The toilet leaked -- they fixed it fairly promptly, but after that, it flushed only with great difficulty. Also, the shower dripped loudly all night, and nothing we did could make it stop. There was no coffeemaker in the room (we were told, after the fact, that we could have "requested" one, but I'm sure they would have charged us for it), but you could buy coffee in the lobby during breakfast for $2.50 a cup! Needless to say, the breakfast wasn't free; there was a minibar in the room, but none of us were interested in paying the ridiculous prices for that. Our advice: get up early and go to Houlihan's a few blocks away for the $10 breakfast buffet. Internet access was $14.95 per computer per day, the highest price we've ever paid anywhere, and the only time we've had to pay for internet access anywhere in more than two years. There was one dataport in the room; all three of us had laptops and needed to get some work done, so this was very inconvenient. The only wireless access was in the lobby and apparently, there was a charge for that, too. The staff was nice but fairly indifferent, and I have to say we've been treated better at the cheapest chain hotel off the interstate than we were here, and at less than a third of the price. We were embarrassed to have recommended this place to our friends. No, we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Chicago not accomodating”
Reviews.Author: travelingal
Reviews.Content: My family of four went to a convention and stayed here in early August. We were promised a room with two double beds. When we arrived (earlier than most) we were told they were 45 double beds short. We reluctantly agreed to take a room with a king bed and a promise of a roll away bed. We had a to sleep very uncomfortably with a 12 year old in our bed and our other child in the roll away. Little did we know we were being CHARGED a daily fee for this bed. The managment could not handle the large group that was at this hotel. The bellhops and bartenders were visibly stressed and we did not have towels one day until very late at night. The managers would not take off the roll away bed charge and were not the least bit accomodating. We were so disappointed in this hotel. Also, they do not have a pool here. If you want to use a pool there is a health club next to the hotel but you have to pay $20 a day to use it. $80 for a family to take a little swim was a bit ridiculous. Do yourself a favor, if you want to be accomodated and are thinking of booking this hotel for a convention or otherwise, go elsewhere. Chicago has too many hotels to choose from to pick this one. I never heard back from managment on this issue when I called and emailed so obviously they don't care, even when I told them I'd write a review on this website. Chicago is an awesome city though. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, terrific service”
Reviews.Author: iknowquality
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with an attitude for service and class. The hotel is well appointed - all public areas as well as the rooms - and the staff succeeds in attending to your well-being. This was evidenced by the cold bottle of water and hand towel that greeted me upon my return to the hotel each day after a morning run. The rooms are very lovely and most all of the views - given the hotel's excellent hilltop location - are wonderful. Let's talk about the location - you are NOT in the heart of the Loop or on a major street with constantly honking horns. But you ARE within 3-5 blocks of the best, most vibrant parts of downtown Chicago. The Fairmont is like an oasis or retreat in the middle of a bustling city. I will admit that my exceptional rate ($148 prepay non-refundable, found by chance on the Internet and not to be seen again) made me very grateful for the value I received. If I'd been paying twice that - their standard rate - I may have held them to even higher standards. The beds were a little hard and the pillows were the kind that swallow up your head but that's almost not worth mentioning. This is a wonderful facility with an accommodating staff who know how to serve a demanding clientelle.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: tmarcone
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights end of July. 1st class all the way. Great sushi / trendy bar (Aria) that is relatively new - I believe. Sign up for their President's Club (free) and get access to the 5 level Northshore Fitness Center next door. Walking distance to Navy Pier. One of the best hotel experiences I have had in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: RiverTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for a work conference. The lobby is nice, the help at the reservation, bell and concierge desks is all very good - very polite, always someone to smile and ask how your day was. Room was nice - a little dated but still in pretty good shape. The carpet could have used a cleaning and the vanity chair was really awful (nothing a steam cleaner couldn't fix...) but overall it was clean and comfortable accomodations. If I went back again for personal time I would check out another hotel that might be a bit nicer within a similar price range. Location is very good - just a very short walk to Michigan Avenue and the Magnificent Mile and lots of other places. Cab rides are generally short and inexpensive from this hotel. Navy Pier and all of the downtown fun is within walking distance (but not if you're wearing uncomfortable shoes!) Food at the hotel is good but very expensive. A continetal breakfast is $19, which is outrageous. There are other places nearby (Hooligans is just around the corner) with better prices and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at The Fairmont Chicago this summer and enjoyed our stay tremendously. The room was comfortable, clean and very well appointed. The staff was professional and friendly. Location is great and within walking distance to many Chicago attractions, shops and restaurants. We'll definitely reserve a room at The Fairmont on future trips to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend get-away in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LDC923
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel in Chicago has the best value for a weekend in Chicago. It is a great location. Just south of the Mag mile, and just north of Millenium Park. I took my wife for her birthday and we arrive mid-Friday afternoon. We were very courteously greeted by the doorman, escorted by the bell hop to the front desk. He waited while we checked in and then delivered our bags to our room while we retreated directly to the bar for a relaxing "happy hour". They had some very nice light snacks on the menu there. The hotel is not the most up to date, but the room was very nice and clean, with a very comfortable bed. We walked north for dinner in the evening. In the morning they had an excellent selection of pastries and fruit in the atrium for reasonable prices, plus fresh OJ and coffee. I liked that much better than the room service option because you could pick out exactly what you wanted. After a late checkout we took a nice walk through Millenium Park and the Art Intitute before heading home. This was our 2nd stay the the Chicago Fairmont and we it will continue to be our choice for downtown Chicago. We have also stayed at other Fairmonts and found them to be excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont was very fine”
Reviews.Author: SwissHawaiian
Reviews.Content: My wife accompanied me on a business trip for a 4 night stay. We had a spacious deluxe king with a corner view of the lake. Service was outstanding including excellent room service breakfasts. We had a wonderful dinner in the restaurant Aria, that our business clients raved about the next day.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: varliukas
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. My room was big with a nice view to a lake, close to the Millenium park and Mag mile. Usually i've got troulbe sleeping in new places, but here i had no worries- bed was comfortable:) And what i liked most- check out time- i was able to sleep a little bit longer:) Everyone was very helpfull in the hotel, nice restaurant- i'd say a little bit overpriced, but nonetheless next time i'll go to the Fairmont Chicago with no doubts:)

Reviews.Title: “Fairest fairmont”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took our first trip to Chicago in March of this year (2006). I agonised over which hotel to choose and whether I had chosen wisely.....but I worried needlesley. The hotel lived up to our expectaions. Although there were a few aspects of the service that lacked attention to detail (i.e we had to ask that a cofee tray with a jug of cream, that had been left in the room for over three days, be moved) - when we did ask, this was done with speed and no fuss. The hotel restaurant is well worth a visit (but a little overpriced). the hotel is well situated for trips down the Mag mile and Millenium Park. The concierge services are excellent. For those who want to have use of a fitness centre, this hotel is adjacent to one of the best in the Ciy - however, beware that there is a daily charge of $20 to use the facitilities, which certainly adds significantly to the overall cost of a city break, if like me, you're a frequent Gym attender. We both loved the City and our stay at the Fairmount and will definitley re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paid about $700 incl. 2 night stay + United direct flights for two to Chicago this Easter on site59. Hotel room was very clean, but ac wasn't cooling great(forgot to tell them about it). Service was quite good. Very close to Millenium Park and other activities. This was our best trip to Chicago and the weather cooperated.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite There”
Reviews.Author: Snowkarver
Reviews.Content: I'm generally a fan of the Fairmont hotel chain, but the Chicago location was a bit hit-or-miss, especially considering the price and the supercharged competition across the river (two Four Seasons, two Ws, a Park Hyatt, a Peninsula, etc. etc.) The entire property needed some cosmetic updating, and our room, while it was generously sized and complete with the essential conveniences, was only a few notches above shabby - fine for a Best Western, but definitely not for a four-star Fairmont. The bathroom was kind of dingy, and the lighting and fabrics had seen better days. The location also leaves something to be desired - it's a good 10-15 minutes walk away from the action north of the river (and it's a cold walk in February!). The views of Lake Michigan were quite nice, but there was also quite a bit of ongoing construction to look at in the same direction. On the upside, we had a terrific dinner at the (then brand-new) restaurant, Aria, which featured a fine selection of food and wine and above-average service. With so many other hotels to choose from in the area, I don't think I'd go back to the Fairmont at current prices, at least until it undergoes a major reno. I would go back to Aria for dinner, however, as it was really very memorable and a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Halinmich
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but overpriced...they'll nail you for each and every extra they can. Room was a little shabby (peeling wallpaper, noisy air circulation system.) Also a bit of a hike to the Miracle Mile...it wasn't a terrible experience, but given the $$$ involved, you can do better for less!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: msbest
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel close to Navy Pier, State St, and the Mag Mile, this is it. Great lobby, you can sit and relax and have a drink or light fare. Rooms are spacious (corner king) with separate dressing area which is hard to find downtown. Yeah, the carpet is old in the rooms, wear slippers, not a big deal. Bed and pillows were amazingly comfortable! Aria restaurant had amiable servers. My pancakes were somewhat cold by the time they arrived, I received a new order and she comped our beverages. THat was a deal considering 2 coffees and 2 o.j's were $18! Pricey place, but nice if you want the experience. Fairmont's overnight/24hr parking is a bit much, $41. Highest we ever paid downtown. Pool is next door at an athletic club and separate price as well, we did not utilize. All in all, we had a great feel for this hotel. Some reviews claim the property needs updating, maybe, but it still feels classy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lzylitnin
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Fairmont Chicago. Excellent location, friendly staff, fast elevators. On the downside, the valet parking is extremely expensive, as is the restaurant. The buffet was $25pp. We ordered off the menu and our meal for 2 with coffee, juice, omelettes, potato, toast and tip was $60. Kind of pricey for breakfast. I would choose this hotel again if the rate was right.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: deckie
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 nights at the Fairmont. Beautiful room, spacious with large bathroom and changing area. Food and staff at the Aria restaurant excellent. Great location vis the Loop, Michigan Avenue and the Navy Pier. A walk down by the lake is highly recommended, as is this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out carpeting and poor attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in a king room with a "view of the lake". We had requested a crib for our son which we ended up requesting 3 times prior to getting it. Our rooms thermastat was broke and had to be replaced after we arrived. After shopping we came back and found our keys didn't work and had to get them replaced. During the night we were awakened 3-4 times by a fire alarm going off. The carpeting was stained and worn out, and the room was quite small for the $309 rate. Our view of the lake turned out to be through several high rises. On the upside when I complained about getting awakened 3 times during the night by a fire alarm they refunded me $100 off my room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out”
Reviews.Author: Dale46
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont during my recent 3 week stay in the US. The Fairmont's carpet and furnishings are pretty knocked around, and the shower cubicle in particular was revolting - ancient tiles which were starting to come loose. The room also wasn't particularly clean. The foyer area is looking pretty dated. The whole hotel needs major reburbishment. I certainly wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OKAY,Not Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: WEARECANADIAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Chicago from Sept. 24-28/05 in a 1-bedroom city view suite. First impressions: 1. A bit off the Mag. Mile. A $4-5.00 cab ride put you at the centre. 2. Lobby impressive but small. 3. Most of the staff very cheerful and helpful. Pros: 1. Aria restaurant is in the hotel. Good fusion, not amazing . adequate service. 2. Suite was large and well laid out. 3. Hallways and common spaces were up-to-date and well kept. Cons: 1. Rooms are terribly outdated, even the suites. We're talking major facelift required to bring it to 5-star level. 2. No coffee makers in rooms or suites. This is apparently due to the (possibly outdated) wiring system within the property. 3. No in room safes!!! 4. Exercise facilites are next door in a Chicago Health Club. 5. Wireless internet did not work in suite even after phone consultation. Summary: Staff was great. Room decor lacking. Location OKAY. Next visit to Chicago, I would consider the Four Seasons or the Park Hyatt, purely for the location. P.S. Tru restaurant.......amazing. Food and service outstanding...bring your platinum or black cards..... to dine at this Conclusion

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ceejayjay
Reviews.Content: The reviews we read were a bit mixed, but I thought it was excellent. I've stayed in The Splendido, Villa D'Este and others and it doesn't compare, but nor should it. It doesn't claim to be in that space. I expected it to be a notch off the Four Seasons and so it proved. A only a small notch too!. Lovely clean and bright room. Superb views, very quiet, comfy bed etc. Excellent service all round and nice staff. For the money and quality it stacked up very well indeed. Couldn't really fault it any way given it was half the cost of the Four Seasons but pretty close in terms of overall experience. We will go there again when in Chicago. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful room on the 21 st floor, overlooking Navy Pier. The location was great, very quite and we could walk everywhereThe consignee was extremely helpful regarding restaurants and places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but the bed was hard”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, but the bed was pretty hard. Large bathroom, big room, huge closet and okey location.. Shopping on Michigan Avenue was walkable. I was there Aug, 19-21, 2005 and the weather was pleasant enough to walk the magnificent mile. The carpeting on the 21st floor could use some cleaning though. Weekend breakfast buffet was $25. I ended up having a croissant and coffee in the lobby which was excellent and only $6. Ordered room service the day I arrived and the pizza was awful. Since I was starving and the cost was $18, I ate it anyway. Staff was very friendly. When I did go to the gift shop, it was closed and the sign said the employee would return in 30 minutes..I never went back. Overall, this was an okey hotel. I do admit though, it did not meet the expectations of what I have frequently read about Fairmont hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star That Should Be 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont from the 12ththrough 16 August. The hotel is in a five star location. All of downtown Chicago is accessible by walking from the hotel. The Hotel cost $249 per night including breakfast. The hotel location and its Aria Restaurant are five star. The quality of the remaining hotel amenities and especially the services are in my opinion closer to what I have experienced in hotels of 3 star quality. The hotel is substantially overpriced for the services and its amentities. It is clean, but old. I had several problems with the housekeeping services and while everyone is very polite the problems were never resolved without calling the hotel's management. Fairmont in other places specifically San Francisco and Quebec are also old properties but they are operated in five star fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property Overall--but Room Furniture Refurbishment Long Overdue”
Reviews.Author: Vermonter_7
Reviews.Content: But for the poor condition of the carpet and some pieces of furniture, I would have given this property an "above-average" rating. This hotel is in a great location. Right next to Millenium park. Pefect distance to walk. The common areas are beautiful and live up to the high standards one would expect from a Fairmont. The service was likewise exceptional with a very courteous staff. Again, what you would expect at a property such as this. The guest rooms are a great size and the views are spectacular. I stayed in a one bedroom suite (2101) and the room's configuration is exactly what would would and should expect from a Fairmont property. First class. Bedroom furnishings were nice although some pieces (like a bedroom table) outdated and a little worn. The bed was very comfortable. The living room furnishings are a completely different story. No less than 4 stains in the carpet which looks at least 3 years old itself. Not horrible stains or ones which would want to make you always wear shoes or slippers but bad enough to make you wonder how a Fairmont property could allow this to happen. The sofa was worn, stained and sun-bleached. The arms on the two chairs (part of the living room grouping) were tattered and disgustingly dirty. These were dirty enough to make you want to avoid them. While it would certainly be costly for the Fairmont to refurbish its guest room furniture, you would think that it would simply consider such a project as the cost of doing business--particularly when numerous Trip Advisor consumers have reported the same complaints for an extended period of time. Many people put the Fairmont in the same category as a Ritz-Carlton or a Four Seasons hotel. NEITHER of those two chains would EVER, EVER permit this type of wear and tear. At the very least, they would remove the soiled furniture until they had the resources to replace it. Wake up Fairmont! You're losing your core audience!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont downtown chicago. I was told that the cots was not available at the moment. I never received a cot or a phone call to inform me that they had no cots. I finally called myself at 10 at night. I then asked for an extra blanket and sheets. I had to wait an hour and forty minutes and three phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: new2bvi
Reviews.Content: We had very nice 2-night stay over the 4th of July weekend. Our room was lovely--spacious and luxuriously decorated. The bathroom is one of those large marble types with separate sections for the shower, toilet and tub. Everything was clean and they let us check in early, which was very much appreciated. The Fairmont is in a great location for enjoying much of what Chicago has to offer. My only gripe with the hotel is that they don't have a pool or gym in the building--you have to use the Lake Shore Athletic Club, which is in the building next door. And you have to pay $20 per person if you want to do this! We didn't end up doing this--we were too busy anyway--but I think that if you're staying in this kind of a hotel, the gym should be more convenient & free!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surpised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont. Pefect location for us as we went up for the Taste of Chicago (Grant Park one block away). They lost our internet reservation, but immediately gave us the same rate and upgraded our room. We ended up with a king size bed overlooking Navy Pier from the 33rd floor. Everyone we encountered from the hotel was absolutely delightful. Room was nice, but a little dated. Nice bathroom with seperate bath and tub. Cheap taxi ride to most places in the city. Only one major complaint. There were no coffepots in the rooms or complimentary coffee or breakfast in the morning. As coffee addicts, we had to go to the gift shop to get a frapucino instead of paying the 12 dollars for in room coffee delivery or the 2.5 dollars for a small cup in the lobby. It would have been perfect if we had complimentary coffee in the mornings. I would have to highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: hwcii
Reviews.Content: I was not able to find a single flaw during my recent stay at the Fairmont. Check-in (Leonard - exceptionally pleasant) was a breeze. The lobby and public areas were beautiful. The bell staff almost fell over themselves wanting to be helpful, but not in the way that makes you want to shoo them away. My room was enormous, larger than some 1-bedroom flats I've been in. Plush with every amenity I could want. Bathroom was luxurious with both tub and large walk-in shower. I splurged on room service, which came in only 15 minutes. Delicious, large portions, presented with live orchids. I made some special requests and everything came exactly as requested. It was on the expensive side, but it was top quality. The bed, linens, and acres of pillows were wonderful. I was offered take away coffee and bottled water while waiting all of about 3 minutes for the airport shuttle. What an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What A Hotel!!!!! I arrived about 6pm and when i entered the lobby I was stunned by the pale marbles and decoration which gave it an air of elegance. Upon check in I was greeted with a smile and service was impecable. I was given a huge room on the 28th floo with magnificent views of lake Michigan and the lake area. Room was immaculate with a king size bed, parlor area and a huge bathroom. Not new but GORGEOUS. Turn down was heavenly with water in the nightstand and a tray on the bed with controls, room service menus and all you may need. The helath claub next to the hotel in accessible via the lobby and has a great pool, sauna and other areas. Overall, a great stay with excellent service. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good job”
Reviews.Author: Grahamarb
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont did a good job. Clean room, good linens, good service. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!!”
Reviews.Author: Janabelle3
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel- I stayed here for a wedding and was so pleased with everything. Our room was big and comfy. The bathroom was so nice and spacious. I loved the loungey cute bar in the hotel where we stopped to have a couple drinks one night. This hotel is in such a great location-especially when there is great weather outside-it's right next to Millenium Park and steps away from Michigan Ave. What more could you ask for! The concierge downstairs were very helpful. I definitely want to stay here again! Between all the hotels I have stayed at downtown-this is just one of my favorites now.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything was beautiful. Excellent service, prompt, wonderful food, excellent view, spacious. Slept like a baby.
